product_review: long time wait to tick this one , and I have to say - pretty underwhelmed . its delicious as far as maple syrup go , but overall it be lack in complexity . barrel be light and not much else . nice mouth feel and long finish .

this review be for the 2019 batch . it be bottle number 43 , taste as part of a dinner at topple Goliath . pour as dinner be serve , thick and almost black , allow to warm and enjoy as dessert . on the nose , bourbon and maple syrup . thick mouth - feel , and full of flavor . Supreme maple OD ! Soooo easy drinking & well - tasty . history in the making when finally score this one ! ( for the record , try both 2019 and 2020 at the same time , the latter one be the good ... I think )

2020 Bottle .   absolutely bonker Maple Syrup on the nose . coffee open up after a minute , but this beer straight up nail the syrup - soak French Toast profile . hate the small - format bottle .. want more !

some burn sugar and a bit of licorice . nice dark fruit , too . flavor have plenty of sugar and malt sweetness . lot of caramel , toffee , and maple syrup . nice bourbon and vanilla , too . good dark fruit character , cocoa powder , and decent coffee . good stuff .

the look be great , and then it be downhill after that . this beer have so much coffee and sweet flavor that I can not taste the stout .... the beer aspect of it . it need to be in another ( new ) category , because as a stout beer it really just be n't other than ( maybe ) it be color . now , if those coffee , maple , bourbon , et al flavor come from the malt or wood , then bravo . but they do n't .

this dark nectar pour like a heavenly scented motor oil into my glass . its like someone take my morning coffee , maple syrup and good bourbon and combine they into this once in a lifetime treat . I could still smell the maple syrup day later from the EMPTY bottle sit on my desk .

be this the good beer in the world , many would argue that be true . while try on draft at topple Goliath , it ’ hard to imagine the rich smooth sweet maple balance by coffee could be all be pull off the nose , stain the glass . and the flavor and taste to be meet with firework from the grand finale .

rich dark brown with a thin finger of creamy - look mocha head . settle relatively quickly into a nice , last cap and wisp . almost no lacing .   huge maple in the nose . hint of coffee , vanilla , raisin and dough .   the maple and molasse be very strong in the taste , but keep somewhat in check by nice french roast coffee . maple , raisin , prune , vanilla and cola sweetness linger in the aftertaste , but not in a cloying way . like a delicious chocolate cordial .   Super thick , smooth feel with a light carbonation fizz .   I really like the raisin in this . it ’s almost juicy . add some character beyond what , these day , could be a fairly normal maple - and - coffee flavor profile . this beer be all - around excellent .

pour at cellar temp into a teku . bottle 74   look : pitch black , minimal head retention   Smell : maple / hazelnut / chocolate . a touch of bourbon / oak derive character .   taste : actually remind I a bit of a some of the Horus barrel aged stuff I 've have . not as sticky / drip in syrup as expect . coffee be more prominent on the palate than on the nose , come to the forefront as the beer warm . syrup come out on the finish . touch of nuttiness from the base beer ( probably where I be get the hazelnut from on the nose ) .   feel : medium - full body , definitely not motor oil thick   overall : a really solid beer but not up to what I expect from it . look for sticky syrup and pancake . Spirit profile be minimal , with more oak from the barrel than bourbon . touch of oxidation derive umami before it start to warm . be look for a " blow your sock off " and just get a good beer . for a beer in this style I much prefer Coffee Maple Medionoche from Weldwerks , much easy to get as well .

2020 recent release Bottle courtesy of brewnic . l : black with minimal dark brown head . s : vanilla , chocolate , coffee , maple syrup . t : coffee , vanilla , chocolate , pancake , maple , wood , a little whiskey . F : viscous . overall : unsurprisingly , very good .

this review be for the 2020 kbbs from the TG taproom in Decorah , Iowa . I have a four ounce pour .   look : the pour be thick like motor oil . it ’s super dark with minimal head . it ’s syrupy in the great way . when swirl , the the beer nearly stain the glass brown leave amazing leg .   Smell : this be incredible . for many beer , you pick up subtle aroma . for this beer , you immediately get in - your - face maple syrup follow by coffee , bourbon , and dark chocolate . there be nothing subtle about these aroma . you do n’t have to try to identify they . you can smell they from the moment the glass be place on the table — it ’s as if they ’re serve you breakfast .   taste : much like smell , there be nothing subtle about the flavor . once again , the maple hit you hard immediately with bold flavor of chocolate chip pancake with butter . the coffee / espresso flavor come next accompany by bourbon . the flavor be extremely bold , deep , and well - balanced . it ’ a symphony of flavor . perfection .   feel : I debate on include sweetness in the flavor , but it my opinion , this particular sweetness be more about feel than flavor . you can have flavor without sweetness . I ’ve place it here because the sweetness contribute in such a way that the entire feel of the beer be elevate . it add a richness that ’ hard to describe . it eliminate any boozy feeling while keep the warmth you get from a high ABV drink . it ’ coat your mouth entirely and the feel and flavor last a long time .   overall : I do n’t typically prefer stout , but killer stout be topple Goliath ’s bread and butter . I be worried that I could potentially be disappoint due to all the hype surround this beer . not only do it live up to the hype , it exceed my own expectation . it leave I want more . I be fortunate to try Mornin ' Delight , Term - Oil Fluffernutter , Term - Oil S’mores , Kaiju Clash , and Coconut Assassin all on this particular day — each one be phenomenal . but at the end of the day , it be Kentucky Brunch Brand Stout that reign supreme .

2020 on draft at topple Goliath .   it pour pitch black with minimal / almost - none foam around the ring of the glass . Aroma have load of maple with coffee . like maple syrup cover pancake stack . they be definitely present in flavor , maybe more maple than coffee , along with chocolate and a bit of roast . all lay on top of that bourbon sweet base . the most impressive thing be the feel here . it have that soft , warm feel . there be no hint of booze . yet it be also somehow thick and the flavor hang around for a while . it be really one of the good mouthfeel beer I 've have , for imperial stout .   be there beer that have perhaps well flavor or aroma ? yeah , I think so . but the feel be at the very top . great beer .

2019 KBBS look : black syrup , no head , super thick Smell : huge maple note up front , subtle barrel and coffee in the middle , finish with maple soak coffee taste : big maple , bourbon and coffee flavor . front be maple , then come coffee and bourbon , finish with a maple bourbon blast overall not as good as the nose feel : super thick yet well carbonate ... well balanced and linger for age   overall : the good beer I ’ve ever have

2019 draft and bottle .   I do n't think this beer could possibly live up to the hype after the long wait to try it , but get - damn this beer be the real McCoy . huge coffee nose , remind I of walk into a ( great ) coffee shop . chocolate , bourbon , subtle maple hide in the background . taste be simply perfection . phenomenal coffee flavor , chocolate , bourbon , and a perfect maple finish . incredibly well balanced between coffee and maple . thick , oily mouthfeel more on par with Sr-71 than assassin . what can I say , its phenomenal . leave you want more and more , but unfortunately not many oz 's to go around .

smell : early morning pancake and coffee before work that wake you up taste : liquifie buttery maple pancake and hot coffee with some snake bite in it . feel : like that Scene in there will be blood when the oil explode everywhere . tar . overall : magnificent worth its weight in gold

2019 vintage . pour a very dark brown color with noticeable sugar coat the glass . lot of coffee and maple in the nose , not much barrel or heat at all . very rich and coat mouthfeel with a lot of layer in the flavor . coffee , espresso , maple , vanilla be in good balance . not much bourbon or oak if at all noticeable . really great beer as it be very hard to pull off this many flavor and layer without a dominant flavor . just miss it a little with not much bourbon or barrel presence aside from the vanilla note .

review 2019 vintage . this pour thick and close to black with unsurprisingly poor head retention ( that be say , I drink this out of a taster glass ) . do not stop the nose from jump out of the glass . huge coffee and maple , as advertise , mask any potential aroma from the barrel . that trend continue into the taste - difficult to find the barrel even when look intently for it . the coffee be very pleasant and play well with the maple , which present authentically and not as a general sweetness . thick , smooth mouthfeel ( again , no surprise here ) . overall , this would receive a rating bump if it be n't mean to be a barrel aged beer . in that respect , it fall short , as the adjunct and texture be the real star of the show here . very cool to try , but not worth the price of admission these day .

2018 version . pour dark with a small head . Smell be maple coffee with a hint of bourbon . very smooth drinking and taste be wow - chocolate , coffee , maple , and a touch of sweetness . one of the good beer I 've ever try .

a ( very expensive ) draft pour at TG on release day Dec. 7 , 2019 .   look : not as dark as I expect with a very thin brownish - tan head . stick to the glass briefly . for purpose of the review , both 2017 and 2018 be sample together .   appearance - the beer have the vicious blackness of Dark Lord .   Smell - the 2018 have more sweet chocolate marshmallow . 2017 lean more earthy and dry but still have an overall sense of sweetness .   taste - the 2018 have amazing note of toast marshmallow , chocolate syrup , vanilla , and char in back . the 2017 be not as sweet , but still have note of sweet vanilla and chocolate . in both bottle , there be a sweet quality of kid ' breakfast cereal . amazing there be almost no burn from the 15 % abv .   Mouthfeel - on par with motor oil , the beer have amazing thickness . it cling like few other .   Overal - Holy diabetes ! the beer should be too sweet , but it be so good . far , it appear the beer be well consume fresh .
l : pour thick and pitch black with no head s : marshmallow , vanilla , chocolate and barrel . mighty fine T : just like the nose and all in harmony F : smooth , thick and creamy o : world class

2018 vintage . about six month from bottle .   a : pour jet black with a thick ring of dark brown , espresso - like head . no lacing and average retention .   s : Suuuuper rich dark chocolate , blackstrap molasse , vanilla bean , dry oak barrel and cinnamon , and light bourbon . a little bit of cardboard . a very brawny BA stout .   t : dark chocolate , vanilla , cola , light spice ( cinnamon , clove ) and light toast oak , a bit of sherry and roastiness . pretty long finish . the barrel be not very noticeable on the palate . as you might guess from the base , this be super sweet ; the barrel and vanilla balance this out somewhat but not completely . like a liquid candy bar .   M : sticky full body and medium , sharp carbonation that thankfully cut through the massive body . a comfort alcohol warmth gently warm your innard .   o : big , sweet , rich , and pretty tasty beer . the cardboard note be distract , and the sweetness be as overwhelming as it be in regular DL . I ’d always hear that , even though the base beer be terrible , add it to barrel transform it in such a way to somehow make it ethereal . that ’s half true , I guess . I ca n’t drink more than like 4 oz of this stuff .

750 into a fff teku   l- look great , thick and black . nice half inch head   s- aroma be off the chart ! great vanilla and chocolate ! vanilla never smell artificial   t- oh shit this be for real . huge bourbon and vanilla , mix together extremely well . interpreting of the vanilla really make this beer   f- great mouthfeel , smooth and soft . thick and immense but surprisingly velvet   o- this be a long time want . I do n’t think this be worth the asking price but it ’ a must have on all stout lover . remind I a lot of FO batch 2

smell great , mouthfeel great . sweet sweet sweet . it be delicious . but I find , though delicious , it might be objectionable to drink a full glass due to the level of sweetness . I do n't get any barrel , mostly residual sugar . nice beer , I do n't find it elite .

everything I love about barrel aged stout . thick , oily , coat the glass . smell sweet , but not overly so . the taste follow with sweetness , barrel oak / vanilla flavor . not overly sweet , with enough heat to balance it perfectly . ( 2017 Handjee )

product_review: 2016 Vintage - Drank 02/24/21   Smell -pleasant with note of tobacco and chocolate   taste - the tobacco over power this one in the beginning . and then as it warm , the pepper take over . very unique taste , and I think it ’s the brandy barrel influence .   feel - thin , and I expect more   overall - for be the # 4 overall beer on BA , I expect more , much more . the feel be thin , and note of pepper overpower this . yet it be not completely unenjoyable , just not even close to the 4th good beer in the world . regardless , glad I gut to try it as it ’s always nice to see what the hype be about . this one just do n’t live up to it

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged
product_review: after 500 + stout , this one be easily top 5 . a bar to measure all other BA adjunct stout ( for I ) . everything be spot on . sweet - but - not - too - sweet , super balanced adjunct , barrel - but - not - too - much - barrel , thick - but - not - thicc , etc .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged
product_review: thank to my new friend at the Cycle Barrel Aged Day bottle share .   Look- a smooth black with a thin tannish head which fade quickly .   Smell- a mix of barrel , booze , and sweetness of chocolate . interesting mix that really work .   Taste- Chocolate , barrel , coconut , and just a hint of cinnamon . nothing like the Hunahpus that I have try before . there be more sweetness but the barrel give it a nice sharp flavor . I think the brandy really give the flavor an awesome boost .   Mouthfeel- a nice thick coating which linger . full bodied and little carbonation .   Overall- a fantastic brew from Cigar City . this be definitely a one of a kind brew .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged
product_review: this one pour a fairly dark black color , with a small head , and a little bit of lacing .   this smell like heavy roast , pepper spice , rum spice , cocoa powder , oak , dark fruit , smoke , and espresso .   both barrel do n't necessarily come through here - it be more smokey rum than anything else . I be not sure I actually get any apple brandy . there be a decent amount of pepper , and a touch of cinnamon , and a definite big helping of chocolate . there be some tobacco and smoke too , as be kind of common with this brewery . there be a touch of molasse syrup on the back end , too .   this be medium bodied , with a decent creaminess , and no real booziness , with a slightly bitter / syrupy finish .   this be n't anywhere near the height of the hype it ( use to ) get , but it be still enjoyable in a vacuum .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged
product_review: pour motor - oil black with minimal head . nose be seriously off , like a cross between an ashtray and burn sesame candy . Booze be there , too , but largely overpower . taste be extremely muddled . peppery spice , smokiness , minimal barrel presence , with a lot less sweetness than expect from the rum / apple brandy combo . flavor blend much more pleasantly in the taste than the smell , the mouthfeel be pleasantly thick , but overall this be a real letdown .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged
product_review: B2 , share amongst friend .   Black , opaque , mocha froth head .   Aroma have booze , spicy cinnamon , vanilla and roasted malt .   Flavor have a lot of fudgy chocolate with an increase cinnamon presence as it warm . moderate pepper heat , light vanilla in the background . the apple brandy barrel come out as it get close to room temperature .   moderate carbonation , syrupy , above medium body .   a tasty brew , silky , sweet . Heat be there but not overpower .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged
product_review: appearance - the beer pour a silky black color with a dark mocha color head .   Smell - the nose be the of a sweet barrel age stout . the booze and cinnamon be note , but not the heat .   taste - at the front , my first impression be black licorice . it be not nasty black licorice , since it be balance by chocolate syrup , coconut , and dry green apple . my disappointment be that the pepper spice of the base beer be go . there be a hint of cinnamon , but little heat . the barrel note become more pronoune as it warm , particularly the apple brandy .   Mouthfeel - the beer be big bodied , just hover on the tongue and allow the test profile to develop .   overall - the beer be great , but I miss the spice of the base beer .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged
product_review: 2016 batch ( # 2 ) review .   Hunahpu 's be one of those beer that I love the very first time I try it , and I 've be chase that dragon ever since ... unsuccessfully , as it turn out .   I 've be lucky enough to try Barrel - aged Huna twice now - once at great American Beer Fest , and for a second time when I win a bottle in a charity raffle . as it turn out , I drink my BA Huna alongside of double Barrel Huna , expect that I would be blow away by the double Barrel ... in fact , it be the exact opposite experience .   and perhaps I should have expect that , give the barrel use in DB Huna - Rum and Apple Brandy barrel do n't often tend to impart much thickness to a beer , and in combination , they definitely make the beer seem a bit thin . additionally , where the bourbon barrel in BA Huna add depth , richness , sweetness , and complexity , it seem that Double Barrel just take on thinness and acidity . it be also quite charred in taste - it remind I quite a bit of my gripe with 2018 Huna . sadly , all of that cinnamon and vanilla that I love seem to be entirely absent . it be still a sweet beer , but it be greatly overshadow by the barrel note and char and acidity .   in the end , I honestly think I 've find myself prefer non - barrel - aged Huna as my go - to . it be certainly easy to get , and something about it be just a much more pleasant experience for I . yes , I have a sweet tooth , so that be probably a big part of it . or perhaps Cigar City 's age method just be n't to my liking . maybe the barrel ? tough to say - more experimentation require !

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged
product_review: black color with dark mocha head . Aroma be really spice forward with lot of cinnamon , rum and booze . taste be desserty with fudge , chili , cinnamon and some heat on the finish . full bodied , smooth mouthfeel . quite nice but not such a huge step ahead of the regular .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged
product_review: taste from bottle . pour black with beige head . taste against regular 16 Huna and 17 Bourbon BA Huna . Aroma of cinnamon , rum , almost a little nutty , some fruity note and apple . moderate to heavily sweet with mild bitterness . lot of cinnamon , caramel , toffee , some chocolate and finish with a moderate chili burn . you do get some rum barrel sweetness and just a hint of brandy . more intense and complex than the Huna and Bourbon Huna . excellent !

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged
product_review: pour a jet engine oil dark body with a mocha - hue head . the cacao and spice come aroma be strong , along with the booziness from the brandy and rum barrel . the taste be like no other stout I 've have . brandy and rum blend together nicely to add some complexity to the richness of the nib . the chile and cinnamon be very noticeable as well , but be balance out by the chocolate and alcohol so it be never too overpower . the chocolate and vanilla thicken this beer , and the heat of the chile and brandy / rum leave a nice heat . phenomenal beer that deserve the praise it be receive .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged
product_review: pour one shade shy of black with not head , just a tight band around the shoulder . nose reveal chocolate , peanut butter and a hit of cinnamon . taste follow nose . Mouthfeel be light - medium in body with a mild , even carbonation , a hit of heat and a kiss of acidity . all and all a nice beer but I do n't get too much of the barrel .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged
product_review: pour a thick , oily pitch black coloration with a small , creamy head . the beer downright stick to the glass as you swirl it , leave a short - live film of dark beer and white lace . Smell be somewwhat subdue , pretty underwheme compare to the taste . Cinnamon be most noticeable , with a sort of odd earthy , musty , woody aroma be pretty dominant as well . perhaps a hint of coconut there . taste be quite complex , lot of chocolate and rum noticeable at first , with a decent bit of cinnamon and vanilla come through as well . the chili really grow as you drink and the beer warm . quite noticeable in the aftertaste in a really pleasant way . quite a bit of warm boozyness there as well , but very smooth and mellow at the same time . mouthfeel really be fantastic , very thick , sticky , almost oily and very smooth . I be consider wait for CBS for my 100th review , but I think this one will do nicely . the barrel - aging really do wonder to the quite overrated Hunapuh here , add a certain complexity from the brandy and rum note along with make the chili stand out more and generally mellow out the beer , create a rich harmony . still smell really weird though .

product_review: with so much talk about this be a disappointment this beer be fantastic . have a slight chili smell . this be some chili up front follow by nice barrel flavor.some spice come through and have a rich body . overall really delicious .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged
product_review: thank much to chicagopubcrawler for make this one happen .   be worried about the b2 release . this one in my opinion do n't follow the poor review .   a beautiful stout . not a big pop off the cap but the pour have a nice thick lacing . Smell be perfect chocolate . no spice just perfect refined chocolate .   taste be a blend of crazy flavor : apple , chocolate , hard mexican spice . love the integration of rum and apple brandy . the spice / heat come in at the back end as be intense . Mouth be dense and I wish more stout could be just like this . a little harsh with the pepper . gladly share this with friend and definitely two people would be too much for the intensity of the heat .   overall this be an experience . I generally do n't go for this style and have have both good and bad bottle of regular huna . I be sure this be a good bottle .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged
product_review: 2016 vintage 750ml bottle pour into a balloon glass   a- pour pitch black in color with a thin head that disappear almost immediately , leave nothing behind   s- aroma open with roasted coffee that give out lot of green bell pepper note , as well as some earthy note . the barrel note be prominent , with apple brandy popping through and provide note of green apple peel . the rum give aroma of brown sugar and molasse . undertone of cinnamon , vanilla , cocoa and chilie   t- barrel note be dominant up front with apple brandy take the lead and give note of green apple & sweet brandy . the rum barrel provide some sweetness and note of black strap molasse and brown sugar . the finish bring out the cinnamon and cocoa nib , as well as sweet vanilla . the finish give more of the barrel note , and linger of chili with a strong burn linger   M- medium - heavy body with moderate carbonation lead to a slightly creamy mouthfeel and a viscous , warm finish   O- the double barrel treatment add a whole new complexity to the base beer , with the apple brandy leave the way , outstanding

pour very dark black with a thin tan head on top , smell of Cinnamon Toast Crunch soak in bourbon which I think be pretty nice . the taste of the beer have the cinnamon and the touch of spice in there along with the vanilla and chocolate . the feel be nice and silky , do n't burn the throat or mouth from the adjunct which be perfect . overall it be an outstanding beer and be fortunate to try it finally .

big time grail for I . vintage 2019 on tap at Bier Station , consume and review October 2021 .   pour black with a finger and a half of dark caramel foam . good head retention . Aroma be spice , cinnamon , chocolate , toffee , caramel , and molasse . roasty and toasty malt offer up a firm base , add a strong malty stout backbone to each whiff . as the sweetness crescendo to a peak , barrel character sweep in to add some char , bourbon , and bitterness . alcohol remain an after thought , allow the beer to shine forward of its ABV . load from first whiff to last sniff . flavor profile be more of the same - a firm stout base of roasty and toasty malt form the foundation of cinnamon , spice , vanilla , caramel , molasse , toffee , and cream . it open up less spicy than the nose , but finish more spicy than the nose , that be to say , the dynamic be shape in contrast - mirror . only caveat to the mirror image be the barrel character note of char and bourbon that come thru at the end again , drop this stout an octave into deep heartiness . despite the bourbon character pop through the beer , the beer never come off as hot . mouth feel be thick with a smooth , consistent grit . its feel be uniform from front to back . overall , incredible depth with load of barrel compliment the initial spice well . it border on an ADHD stout , spread it be attention in a spiderweb of direction , but remain cohesive enough to form an intoxicate melody .   Draft . 8 oz pour .

look - black thick and a nice tan rim almost no head . fantastic skim Smell - so much barrel with a great balance of vanilla , cinnamon , and chocolate Taste - boozy with a fantastic blend of cinnamon vanilla chocolate . nice woody caramel bba taste . have a friend surprise I with this , so excited to finally give it a try ! black body with a brown head . aroma of the barrel fuel the cinnamon , vanilla , and cocoa to decent height , pepper , rye and oak linger . taste have the whiskey from the barrel merge well with the caramel , vanilla , cocoa , brown sugar and cinnamon , with the pepper , rye , and oak provide a beautiful contrasting wave . almost have hint of cola as it warm . feel be warm and more sturdy than the orignal , but the adjunct texture be dull a bit , oak be a pleasant backbone . it be wonderful , but I have to admit the orignal abraxas still be first in my heart for the series .

on premise pour while pick up bottle from 2020 oznr lottery . thick , spicy , sweet . could n’t be happy about this . king of mexican chocolate beer

pour pitch black with tan head . Aroma be as expect . roast , spice and booze . flavor be a tad shallow . I be expect more bold flavor consider . overall , I expect more . still , solid for what it be .

2019 vintage ( 13 % ABV ) - gold wax - dip bottle - pour into a stemless snifter at 48 ° F .   pour a thick , oily tar - black , barely form a dark brown collar before fizz out , sit absolutely still and oily in the glass . coat the glass in a sticky brown sheen .   Nose : dark roasted malt lend plenty of cocoa , as well as molasse , brown sugar , caramel , and toffee . plenty of barrel presence , with charred oak , spicy rye whiskey , and a lot of woody vanillin . definitely some pepper heat , and just a touch of savoury , almost smoky chilie , with a hint of cacao nib , and just a dusting of a dusting of cinnamon . really do bring a mexican hot cocoa vibe .   Palate : this one be a bit of a sleeper on the nose . barrel - Aged Abraxas greet the palate with brown sugar , caramel , semi - sweet chocolate , and chocolate fudge , with a nice prominent whiskey barrel presence thread all the way through . a vanilla bean intensity build quickly , make you double - check the label to see if there be vanilla here . Sweetness be there , but be surprisingly tame for what this be . a slight cacao nib bitterness unfurl , and just a touch of chili heat , gently warm the tongue , and send a peppery bite down the throat . some dark , roasti note appear , quickly dry out the malt sweetness with a bit of charred malt . the finish bring dark chocolate , burn sugar , a kiss of chili sharpness , and just a minute whisper of blink - and - you'll - miss - it cinnamon , ultimately conclude with linger roast and dry oak .   Mouthfeel / body : there be a rich fullness to this , but more in a creamy lactose way . it be actually not terribly fudgy or at all syrupy , and go down fairly easily - perhaps even a little thin , despite its size . little effervescence - just some soft underlying fizz . only a touch of stickiness around the lip . dry out very well in the finish , and just some mild warmth go down . again , very balanced .   overall : one can not help but have some lofty expectation when open a beer such as this . for all intent and purpose , it be a fine barrel - age stout , with a nice whiskey presence and a pleasingly balanced chili influence . the lack of cinnamon hurt this one , as do the thin body and swift roasty finish . perhaps other vintage convey the mexican cake theme a bit well , but at the end of the day , this be n't a top 3/250 beer for I . nevertheless , a quality stout .

Drank from a 750 ml / 1pt 9.4 fl oz gold wax dip bottle acquire in a trade with cpsfgd 2020 vintage   Review # 2000   Viscous , completely pitch black appearance . the oily look body be top by a small , frothy , saddle brown head that quickly dissolve . a thin collar encircle the liquid . no lacing whatsoever .   the aroma be solid but definitely less potent than I anticipate . Boozy with strong whiskey / bourbon note . malty and robust . moderately roasty . brown sugar be apparent . subtle cinnamon note come through as well . a touch spicy . as the beer warm , the nose turn sweet and smooth . Vanilla be also noticeable . with time , the vanilla really intensify .   the flavor profile be also enjoyable but not as intense or as complex as I expect . rich and malty up front . big roasted and caramel malt presence . Boozy bourbon / whiskey note appear as the beer move along the palate . I have a difficult time tell whether the heat be from the booze or the ancho chilie . Vanilla and cinnamon come through on the back end . the beer finish with more linger roast and booze . later , powdered cocoa note be detectable .   the mouthfeel be respectable , though , like the aroma and the flavor , not as impressive as I have hope for a beer of this magnitude . Fluffy and medium in body for the style . the liquid contain a finely bubble , great - than - average effervescence that turn frothy and slick on the palate . as the beer sit , the carbonation settle and the beer seem to become more oily and rich .   Barrel - Aged Abraxas be impressive but , in today ’s beer landscape , it fail to truly stand apart from other highly rate barrel - aged imperial stout . I be glad I have a chance to crack this beer for my 2,000th review , but I would not go out of my way to acquire it again .
insanely great stout ! lot of the expect goody : Choco , coffee- but also the amazing cinnamon . really good , and much more solid body than the none BA .

the beer pour Pitch Black with a medium dark brown head that recede quickly . it have low carbonation . the beer smell of cinnamon , nutmeg , Chillies , and earthy chocolate . it taste of cinnamon , nutmeg , mild spice from the Chillies , earthy chocolate , and light barrel . the feel be medium and well balanced . a great barrel age stout , but not really blow I away .

obsidian black , with burn motor oil brown edge at a close look , and very minimal visible carbonation , but for a thin dark mocha ring that die to a silky surface fairly quickly .   Smell be potent of cinnamon toast and Red Hots , and less of vanilla nougat .   the medium to thick body have a crackly fizz that firm up and bring out a more dusty cinnamon than on the nose , while the barrel be splintery and add some heat to the peppery sassafra of the oak that give a hint of cola at time . Cocoa dust date come out of the semi - dry , warm finish , as round chocolate and a smoky char continue to develop over top of the mild to low presence of spicy chili pepper .   have this side by side a bottle regular Abraxas of the same year , the adjunct seem like they have ten time the potency here by comparison . it be also not quite as thick or viscous as the BA Sumps I 've have .

pour a pitch black coloration with a small , creamy head . Smell be dominate by rich chocolate fudge and an intense cinnamon note , as well as a strong earthy , oaky , peppery rye barrel note and hint of vanilla and chili . taste follow the nose , be dominate by chocolate fudge , cinnamon and and a subtle but complex rye barrel character of earthy , musty , oaky , peppery note , as well as light note of roasted malt , vanilla , chili pepper and just a hint of dark fruit . finish with a light sweetness and some cinnamon and oaky , spicy note linger in the aftertaste . full , creamy mouthfeel with a rich body and low carbonation .   the cinnamon and chili work really well with the peppery , spicy rye barrel character , although I have to say that the cinnamon presence be way overdone here for my personal taste and that there be also not quite enough of a bitter / roasty counterpoint to the sweet chocolate and vanilla note . while mouthfeel be nice and creamy , it be still disappointing compare to sump as well . do not live up well to the hype .

completely by accident , I run across this beer at a craft beer bar that I frequent - have never hear of Abraxas . Barrel age imperial stout sound like the kind of beer I like , so I get a small taste just to see if I want a full pour . did n't take long to decide ... in fact , I have a second pour because I could n't imagine any of the other 99 or so tap could have anything this delicious .   if you 've have Canadian Breakfast Stout , and Prairie Bomb ! , it taste like a mix of the two . absolutely delicious . definitely World Class !

lucky enough to get a tip of when this be tap at this year 's great taste of the Midwest . otherwise I probably would have miss it . because with so many beer to try , I find it hard to keep track of when specific beer be be tap . but I be very grateful that I be near the perennial tent around 2:00 when they start pour what turn out to be one of the good beer I have ever have .   Regular Abraxas have always be one of my favorite beer . I be curious to see what barrel age would do to adjunct that be already in a fairly perfect balance . it be amazing how the barrel stand out but yet still allow all of the other flavor to shine through . the beer almost taste like a candy bar but be not overly sweet in anyway . the barrel mute the adjunct slightly but if possible , put they into even more of a perfect balance than the regular version .   this year 's great Taste take place on a fairly hot day make barrel aged stout a bit hard to drink . but this stand out by far and I easily would have down another pour have it not be in such great demand .

review 1600 the Alchemist Heady Topper Date : 09 June 2021 it have be on my want for year ; I only dream of the day I get this beer . once my holy grail , now on to the next whale . I have drunk 1600 beer on BA and review 99 % . as I look back since I begin this journey , I be dumbfound by how far I have come . my palate continue to improve ; with every sip of beer , my beer knowledge grow , and my appreciation for the craft multiplie exponentially . the beer be 44 degree , and I use my Jester King glass . the pour create a massive three - finger bright white head with excellent retention . the foamy and soapy head dissipate slowly , tat lace on the glass . the color be SRM 5 , pale straw with light golden hue . the clarity of the beer be somewhat hazy , with yeast float in the liquid . the beer be sublime .   the aroma be orange , passion fruit , pineapple , toasted cracker , biscuit , bready , floral ester , a touch of pine resin , earthiness , and the ever so slight hint of grapefruit .   the flavor in the beer be orange , tangerine , grapefruit , pineapple , peach , bready , biscuit , floral ester , a touch of malty sweetness , a skosh of pine resin , earthiness , and toast cracker .   the mouthfeel be astringent and a touch dry .   the body of the beer be medium , medium carbonation , and long pleasant finish .   I can not find anything wrong with this ; damn near perfect . I want the hype not to be true , alas it be . the harmony and the balance be like watch a perfectly time ballet . this beer be incredible , one of my most favorite beer to date .

I live in VT and buy a pack of these every couple month . Most recent be can ten day before consumption , yesterday and tonight .   about as good as beer get , truthfully . heady vary a bit year to year , but this year 's have be excellent . maybe it be just I , want a strong brew after a troubling time , maybe not .   Thick hoppy , dank , and catty flavor be almost overwhelming but ever so balanced by some magical blend of juicy citrus and malty note . some will say it be too bitter , but I find it smooth and more drinkable than most beer of this style . many similar beer be too sweet , or astringent and unpleasant on the throat as they warm . Heady be exemplary because it can be smooth and almost refreshing while sock you on the chin with hop .   I be biased - this beer have a place in my heart . I love to try new thing , especially beer , and be lucky to live in a place where I can get lot of tasty drink . that say , I keep come back to the Alchemist . not an everyday beer for I , but easily world class and a something you can feel good about buying .

I know I be suppose to drink it from the can ... buuuut it pour a semi clear yellow orange color with a medium bodied white color head that fade quickly but lace the glass nicely on the way down . smell of sweet roasted malt , a mix of earthy , floral , and citrus hop finish up the nose . taste of sweet roasted malt and then finish of a nice mix of floral , earthy , and citrusy hop . it be somewhere in between the ipa of yesterday and the NEIPA craze of today . it be crisp yet smooth , perfect amount of carbonation . excellent beer .

pint can of Heady - Topper date 06/05/21 . serve in a can glass , because I want to . pour slightly hazy and with a nice white head , though not quite as cloudy or murky as Focal Banger . Aroma be not the most potent , but it have a more traditional pine hop profile than I expect . inhale deeply I do get a bit of sweet juice . flavor be big on those tropical juicy flavor . Guava , mango , grapefruit z . where Focal Banger have considerable ibu and conventional alpha bitterness , Heady Topper have the strength and even a hint of the 8 % ABV be actually present on the palate . but this be really only a comparative defect ; compare to million of other ipa the alcohol be still very well hidden .   taste this side by side with Focal Banger I appreciate the difference but confirm my initial impression from 4 year ago in Burlington -- I prefer FB . both have an excellent mouthfeel , with very fine carbonation , which by itself might be remarkable for an american IPA in a can . but this beer be quite literally heady -- and I be not one to shy away from heavy beer in the 8 - 12 % range or even high . but the balance and flavor in Focal Banger be just well in my opinion , even well than this unarguably great beer .   potentially this be Heady Topper 's 15,000th review ? ?

appearance : Clear , light amber ( unfiltered ) with fluffy white head with good retention   aroma : layer with pine leading , then Citrus & Tropical with a trail woody / musty ( some call it dank ) note . Mouthfeel : highly astringent with a lengthy dry finish . bitterness build and linger well into the finish .   overall : rate this versus other DIPA 's . thank you to BA advocate buddy for provide . I can see what the hype be all about . for fan of a dipa , this one be top tier . terrific layered aroma start with pine , then citrus & tropical fruit end with a note of woodiness / mustiness ( dankness ) as you work you way through it . it be aggressive bitter & astringent , so beware of that if you be adverse to those characteristic . the finish be dry and lengthy with the bitterness linger well into the finish .

this beer have always be one that I have admire from afar . I remember when I first join this site over a decade ago , this beer be # 1 . out of the blue , we get a shipment in CO . no idea if this be a one - off shipment or not , but I be elated to find this one hang on at my local store . buy at Hazel 's in Boulder , CO on 05/13/21 . 4 pack of 16 oz can for $ 18.49 before tax . can 05/08/21 , consume 05/16/21 .   A&S : not only be it mark on the can , but I remember see an interview about the Alchemist where John Kimmich be super adamant about not pour this beer out into glassware . however , I properly rate this beer , I be go to have to make a compromise . pour a little out for look and smell , drink the rest from the can . translucent canary yellow beer . lively look with bubble of carbonation rise up . head a bright white and pour at a little less than a finger , but retain really well in a thin layer and leave glob of lacing . Aroma be probably my least favorite part of this beer ( but still great ) . I get citrus ( mostly lemon ) , cane sugar sweetness , and some resiny hop .   T&M : Spectacular and unique . even with all the hazys on the market nowadays , this one still stand out . even though the can clearly state that " this beer be not intend to be the big or most bitter " , but it hit . huge hop flavor ! Most piney and resiny , but with more subdue note of floral and citru ( grapefruit and some lemon ) . slightly spicy towards the finish mostly black pepper and a little chili pepper . bitter and dry finish . not as " juicy " as other hazys , but it work well with this beer . to John 's credit , I do think this beer be well consume out of the can . I think it really do taste well . fantastic mouthfeel . it be very crisp but combine with a medium body , this beer 's texture be nearly perfect .   overall : wow ! I be so glad I have an opportunity to try this one . definitely live up to the hype ! belong in my top 10 , and it be the good Hazy IPA I have ever try . if you can find it , even for the price , it be amazing and well worth it .

from bottle . this pour a beautiful amber - yellow in appearance with good bit of foam upon aggressive pour . Bottled 2/3/21 Consumed 3/12/21   I ’m so excited to have win the lottery and after pay over $ 100 in shipping in total to get everything to Chicago , I finally get to try it ! I feel like these whale have an edge in rating ( especially bc I ’ve pay so much ) but there ’s no deny this be a great beer . it ’s bold and old school as I know it would be . unlike a Hopslam though , the alcohol do n’t overwhelm for a 10.25 % beer . it ’s there for sure but I love it all the more because of it . I feel like these old school beer lose out on the smell versus the new hazie and milkshake ipa . not that I want it to smell sweet , but there ’s just less come out of my glass for I to smell than the more modern beer . it smell like a piny old school triple IPA . a non beer nerd would probably hate this and that ’s partly why I love it . it ’ too much for most people but balance for the seasoned beer nerd . be it worth stand in line for hour and hour ? hell no . be it worth the hype ? sure , for an Imperial IPA . my love be still for hazie lately with an occasional change of pace with an old school . if this be available round the calendar , I ’d be buy it once in awhile regularly . I ’ll be share my other 3 bottle and hope to land it again next year .

a world - and - a - half of thank to jrc1093 for this . what an absolute privilege , and I be eternally grateful for it . thank you .   510ml bottle - date 02/03/21 - pour into a Speigeleau IPA glass at fridge temp .   pour a brilliant , unfiltered clarity honey golden blonde - impressively light for a triple IPA . the elixir be top with a big , dense head of off - white foam , with pretty fair retention , eventually recede to a thick , bubbly collar , with some spotty lacing . slow , but constant effervescence .   Nose : that classic Pliny spirit be so evident . beautifully compose malt , with some toasty caramel , sweet honey , and clean grain , with just a touch of fresh italian bread . the hop be pliny to a t - bursting with floral aroma of magnolia , lilac , and gardenia , lemon blossom , and some sweet pine sap . there be some sweet fruity influence , with apricot jam , marmalade , and a thin thread of white grape , gooseberry , and fresh grass . a touch of grapefruit pith , and just a hint of that subtle boil Simcoe dankness . saturate and cohesive .   palate : Pliny the young greet the palate with a sweet malt foundation , with a nice grainy backbone . some honey and fresh bread lie down a base for the swift flood of hop . sweet , almost candy note of grapefruit , tangerine , marmalade , and a touch of sweet white grape , while some bright citrusy lemon and lime define the high end . in typical Pliny fashion , some floral , flowery hop note emerge before an oily , resinous hop bite cut in with bitter pine sap and pithy bite , quickly dry out the malt sweetness . the finish be resinous , moderately bitter , with potpourri , pith , and grain linger .   Mouthfeel / body : for such a big , impose imperial IPA , the beer drink absolutely beautifully . medium - bodied , with a soft , smooth malty backbone , and a bright , fluid crispness that allow it to remain exceptionally drinkable . effervescence be soft , restrained , but ample and very present , provide just the right amount of lift and sparkle . never cloy , and the hop dry it out beautifully , finish with an oily , resinous , almost waxy cling that adhere to the palate , and let 's those pithy note really dig in .   overall : this be one of those large - than - life beer , and it can often be difficult to maintain realistic expectation . all of Pliny the Elder 's influence be here , and it be strong . it really be an amped up Pliny the elder . now , of course it be n't worth spend a fortune on secondary , or , invest your life in , but for a classic triple IPA , it be supremely drinkable , remarkably balanced , and 100 % Pliny to its core . a little more docile than some might expect , but a truly delightful beer in every aspect .

500ml bottle into a tulip . huge thank to my friend Scott for hook I up with this long - time dream beer !   l : a finger of dense white foam atop a bright orange - amber body . while far from cloudy by today 's standard , there be a good amount of hop haze . head retention and lacing be excellent , especially for such a big beer .   s : hugely aromatic , with a complex interplay of citrus and pine . the resin actually take a back seat for I , with orange and tangerine note really jump out . not much ethanol , but it be definitely a big step up in intensity from PtE , and decidedly more fruit - forward than that classic . I be a fan , but it be actually more restrained than I be anticipate . I can dig that .   t : hop , hop , hop . the tangerine from the nose pop right away , with herbal / piney resin fill in midway through . big , flavorful hoppiness throughout . the finish be what really shine , though , as the perfect amount of bitterness combine with an astonishing dryness that somehow manage not to be harsh or boozy in the least . I 've never have a hoppy beer this strong that be even in the same ballpark of drinkability . I could happily drink several pint of this . dangerous , delicious stuff .   f : on the light side of medium - bodied with a perfect level of soft carbonation and a mouth - watering dryness . excellent .   o : through no fault of its own , this beer be almost inevitably overrate no matter how good it actually be . it be very , very , very good . there be element of it that be truly striking , and definitely put it on the shortlist for good in its style , but at no point do I feel like I be have the good beer of my life , which be pretty much what the pedigree and legend demand for it not to be disappointing . I fully expect that go in , though , so I be much more impressed and appreciative than anything else . pty be a justifiably famous brew , and I hope to get the change to enjoy it again someday .   cheer ! ! !

maybe its the psychology of how hard this be to come by or how expensive it be but I love this one ! the only point I take off be for how sticky it leave everything and for lack of a head . the taste be fantastic ... none of the bitterness of a typical beer of its kind , all of the flavour .   if you be n't into sweet beer , this wo n't be your jam . it take what founder Maple Mackinac Fudge do and remove the boozy sting . it taste like french press coffee , those little maple syrup sugar candy and a bit of chocolate . it keep the chocolate smooth and without the harsh / bitter pure cocoa note many stout these day have .   the colour be black with a slight tan head which dissipate quickly . the beer be syrupy and will leave the glass , your lip and anything you touch sticky like resin . probably the price to pay for such a delightfully sweet beer . an unbelievably huge thank to Chris for this one . you be a saint , sir . thank you .   batch 5 - pour into a balloon stem at 45 ° F .   great big hiss when open . pour an inky coal black , sit like black coffee in the glass , with just a hint of deep brown sheen on the top . a collar of coffee bean bubble form , before quickly simmer down to nary a ring .   Nose : I can smell this from across the table . this thing be crazy . a Tsar Boma explosion of maple galore , like a canadian pancake house with an industrial sized syrup spill . beneath that , or rather , beaneath that , a big heaping batch of fresh ethiopian coffee - lightly roasty , bold , fresh , and warming . the actual beer base be just ooze with caramel , brown sugar , chocolate fudge , vanilla cupcake frost , and a big rich nutty note with hazelnut spread and praline . there be some dark fruit character , but purely in the form of blueberry pie filling and candy plum . a whisper of tiramisu cinnamon , marzipan , and fresh waffle . this be a beautiful aroma .   palate : Mornin ' Delight greet the palate deliciously sweet - almost perfectly so , and just unfurl with a maple intensity that be difficult to describe . this be like rustic , dark , grade b maple syrup boil down and barrel - age , lend a sweet , smoky maple fudge character , and less like Aunt Jemima , report in batch 2 and batch 6 . nevertheless , this be still candy maple , lend a parallel thread of pure butterscotch . the coffee begin to open up , and almost eclipse the maple , lend a necessary roasty bean quality to cut through the sweetness . the coffee be fresh , smooth , and bold , with absolutely no acrid , bitter , charry , or pepper quality . a dark chocolate - cover espresso bean note take centre stage , with a maple silhouette , and some dry blueberry , Almond Joy , dark toffee , and madagascar vanilla bean note play in the background . a nutty malt note emerge , and the sweetness begin to rapidly subside - concluding with roasted malt , hazelnut , ethiopian coffee , chocolate blueberry , malt milk ball , and the reminder of maple syrup , just manage to dry out .   Mouthfeel / body : tg do well here . for how big and decadent this beer be , it be n't syrup . there be some very good effervescence for a 13 % ABV stout , cut through the full body . rich , hefty , and creamy , but not quite chewy or viscous . it be quite sticky around the lip , though . the roast and coffee manage to lend just enough dryness in the finish to escape a cloy fate - mimic very well the effect of oak tannin . not difficult to drink .   overall : this have always be a hype stout , and now I fully understand why it get that praise . in fact , I think by and large , it deserve it . even ignore the maple and coffee addition , the stout itself be fantastic . big , sweet , and so well rounded , with some nice sweet blonde note . the fact that this be so rich , sweet , and hefty , yet never fight back or feel like a chore be a testament to its pedigree . you do n't even care that it be n't barrel - aged . this be the Real McCoy imperial breakfast stout - it just have that special something that separate it from the rest , and I encourage any fan of the style to seek this out and try . absolutely thrilled I get to enjoy this .

2020 bottling ; consume on 10/23/20   pour an inky jet - black body top with multiple finger of creamy , fluffy , pale mocha foam ; spectacular head retention fade steadily to a half - finger of rocky cap and brooding , frothy collar , along with layer gob of thick , sticky lacing ring around the wall of the glass with longevity .   Aroma begin with coffee , dark chocolate , and undertone of maple candy inextricably fuse upfront and foundational to the bouquet ; hazelnut , vanilla cream , and wave of lush dark fruit mesh with roasty maple and the subtle earth of roasty malt over the middle , develop towards a finale highlight blueberry jam , fresh prune , and burn butterscotch to close .   Taste offer a slight coffee character give way to a silky maple - forward profile upfront as roasty malt prickle the mid - palate and blueberry compote and baker chocolate develop ; a linger hazelnut and vanilla cream again form in tandem through the finish with a plummy linger resonating past the swallow .   Mouthfeel bring a medium body , lightly charry with an encroach sticky texture upfront , along with a moderate fluff of pillowy carbonation ; mild - moderate roasty char linger past the mid - palate through the back end and cut the oily slickness for a finish narrowly dodge syrupy texture .   drink well below the weight of both its ABV and the robustness of its adjunct , this stout remain airy and fluffy in texture , and despite the more Aunt Jemima - style maple , be balance effectively with ample coffee and a soft , roasty malt base ; a firm foundation in brewing while adjuncte evocatively with a sense of time and place ( big - time early morning diner vibe ) , which alone emphasize a masterful quality of the style .

opaque , hazy , but not quite pulpy lemon - yellow body . good head production and retention ; the head settle into an uneven , firm , off - white ( light cream ) foam .   Juicy and bright nose , along with a slight dankness and green grassy herbal quality . Tangerine , mandarin orange , mango .   Smooth , creamy , full bodied mouthfeel ; the epitome of a NE ( I)IPA as express by Tree House . soft and cloudy , with plenty of bite , somehow ; low but present bitterness .   Melon and mango lead the way ; a touch of grapefruit peel ; cream and a slight vanilla - like sweetness ; mandarin orange , pineapple , papaya . just a slight hint of bright herbal green note , in particular on the finish . it be fruity and hoppy beyond measure , but I be find it a bit less challenging and complex than the nose .   this be as lush and juicy an iipa as you will find . this be what less brewer be try to emulate when they add fruit , vanilla , oats , lactose , and wheat to their ipa - and they still fall short .

at one time " hazy " be an appearance . but thank to brewery like Tree House , hazy in now a flavor , a feel , a beer experience . ramp up their always popular haze to imperial status , it look like hazy day be here again .   very hazy pour with a matte visual texture of tarnish gold and taupe . as its creamy lather rise to greet the rim , a plethora of citrus , melon , tropical fruit and orchard fruit churn from the glass . honey , poundcake and cereal come to mind as the ale 's malty introduction be rich and cakey .   but its bright fruit bouquet transition to taste immediately with red grapefruit , tangerine , nectarine , pineapple , mango , passionfruit , lime , lemon and banana . Cantaloupe and a berry - like tanginess round out the fruitiness of the ester and hop while the persistent sweetness within coat the middle palate with layer of fructose , cake batter and honey . as the ale turn to take a bitter stride , the taste of fresh spruce shaving and sassafras weave attempt to balance the sweetness with a fresh grassy , herbal and tea - like dankness with a curious nod to cannabis .   full bodied and plush in a starchy cereal texture , the beer 's imperial heft keep the ale rich and fuller long into the session to and resist much convincing to turn to dryness , bitterness or elevated crispness . what the palate get in return be the fully malt balance that give the hop a more rounded and more complex set of flavor . an aftertow of herb and citru have a warm alcohol spice counterpart in a long cereal finish .

Mouthfeel show a medium body with a fluffy , moderate - high carbonation ; a hoppy twang integrate a crush - vitamin minerality with a taut bittering over the mid - palate and through the finish , while the overall consistency continue to highlight a minor grit , subtle resin , and underlie juicy quality throughout .   familiar fruit saturation with a distinctly dank , cooly herbal twist ; this be Tree House near its eccentric well , merge their almost inimitable drinkability with a refreshing deviation from ripe fruit overload in favor of a rawer , resin - focus hop integration . a deceptively diverse , intriguing winner .

Shiny , completely opaque , and viscous . huge khaki color head form with an aggressive pour . once form , the head slowly begin to collapse until a thin layer of foam remain on top of the beer . lot of tan lacing remain on the glass .   CBS have note of coffee , roasted malt , a touch of pine , with note of oak , bourbon , smoke and a sweet tantalizing hint of maple come through . Balanced be what come mind to describe this aroma .   CBS have some nice roasted malt up front , bourbon , oak , a touch of pine and lot of coffee come through up front . at some point , the palate suddenly pick up this subtle , but noticeable sweet maple note . the bourbon come through on the back end with some heat . again , the coffee , the maple , the base stout and the barrel aging be all present , all noticeable , but no one component dominate the flavor profile .   CBS be medium to full bodied . really smooth with moderate carbonation . somewhat dry on the finish .   CBS be a beer that be remarkably good , but I think that these day it do not get the credit or accolade that it once do in large part due to what I think its be great " virtue " - balance . its get barrel aging , coffee , maple , but it let each component shine without outshine any of the other .

I read so much about this beer before I have it , I believe I be go to be beam aboard the Star - ship Enterprise and transport to a far away galaxy , go warp - light - speed 69 with my hair on fire , whilst drink the fine libation know to man ! honestly , I never like bourbon barrel beer before this . I now like they and I humbly believe that there be many beer as good and well than this one . do n't get I wrong it be very good . I mean this be a world class beer , but I be miss the star trek transporter and the smell of charcoal light fluid in my hair . maybe that be why I think there be well beer !

bottle on 10.09.19 - pour into a pint glass . Head quickly dissolve to a thin , persistent layer atop the black brew , leave a thin lacing with just a bit of retention . Aroma be heavy with chocolate and bourbon , with note of maple and malt behind it give it a rich , complex character . bourbon be the first thing that come through in the taste , but the chocolate and maple note interplay , with just the subtle hint of the coffee . the mouthfeel be heavy , settle well on the palate to allow for an extended taste of each sip as the flavor dance in the mouth , with the warmth from the high ABV complement the flavor perfectly - it be not too heavily carbonate either , which be great , since this be one you 'll want to savor each sip of . I 'd describe the overall feel as silky and luxuriant . this be the pinnacle of what stout can aspire to be - I 've never give a perfect score before , but I ca n't find any fault in this incredible brew from founder .

pour a deep black color with almost no head whatsoever . lace the glass like a wine , I do n't know what it be call , Legs ? and they know how to use they ? smell of sweet vanilla , smell like cake with a hint of bourbon at the end . taste be incredible , not as sweet as I be expect . it be sweet vanilla upfront follow by bourbon and then a nice deep roasted malt flavor . it be smooth , perfect amount of carbonation , warming . excellent beer , Bottle Logic do it again !

2018 bottle pour cold , hard to a tulip . Jet black , no floater . no head at all … start to bubble for a ring , then peter out . nose be a sort of light smoke cherry wood , not at all what I expect . first sip be great ! the mix of bourbon barrel be very complex . you do n’t get any one distinct flavor , but rather a change swirl of sweetness and wood . the vanilla come in mid - palate with a sort of vanilla bean shell earthiness , a hint of coffee - ness without the coffee . the malt be deep , robust , provide a massive foundation . some of that cherry come back toward the finish . Mouthfeel be perfect : full but crisp and refreshing . alcohol have that bourbon flavor , but no noticeable bite or warmth at this stage . as it warm , that might change . I can see why people search this out . excellent brew !

2019 vintage ( " fob5 " ) 500ml bottle - pour into a snifter at 45 ° F .   pour a pitch black oily sheen with a glug - glug - glug , form an impressive ultra - dark brown head , that slowly recede to a thick , bubbly tan collar , with I , pressure retention . black and lifeless in the glass . she be a barrel - age stout , alright .   Nose : as soon as the cap be pop , bourbon and vanilla waft out . diving in , there be rich chocolate fudge , bourbon - soak char oak , and a fistfull of vanilla bean . the vanilla be intense , prominent , and extremely organic , but do not overwhelm the stout quality and barrel . Caramel , toffee , vanilla fudge , chocolate fudge , malt milk ball , almond - coconut chocolate bar , brownie batter , vanilla cake frosting , white cake batter , and a vanilla intensity that start to mimic cream cheese frost . some splintery white oak and dusty rackhouse note thread through . as it warm , more chocolate , roast , and bourbon emerge . * note * - this really open up after several minute and the bean cool off a lot , let that stout and barrel emerge .   palate : fundamental Observation greet the palate with barrel - age stouty goodness . chocolate , fudge , brownie batter , some supremely balanced roast , oak , woody vanillin , malt milk ball , caramel , toffee , brown sugar , bourbon , and barrel char , before the vanilla bean smoothly turn up the volume and come into focus . the vanilla be much more natural and properly integrate here , show you that they be very much here , but that there be also stout and barrel share the field . Vanilla bean , vanilla frosting , vanilla cake batter , but blend nicely with the stout , give it this vanilla - frost chocolate brownie thing go on . no real dark fruit to speak of . approach the finish , each sip have this brief moment where everything be vanilla , and then everything become bourbon ( actually close to rye if I be fussing ) , and then the chocolatey roast and malty note enter back in . the finish itself highlight plenty of oak and bourbon , vanilla bean , cocoa , and roast , as the sweetness entirely disappear , allow oak and roast to dry it out . a lengthy aftertaste of barrel and vanilla linger on .   Mouthfeel / body : this one be nicely thick , chewy , hefty , and viscous . it be not syrupy , cloy , or ridiculous . there be some light effervescence underneath , and it find that balance between big , thick , and chewy , without get in the way or become overbearing . coat the lip some , but that barrel really dry out and clean up the finish . some warmth go down , but never hot .   overall : Vanilla stout be hard . I adore a great one , but great one be hard to come by . BCBS Vanilla be a great one . I 'll need to compare , but this be easily up there . BCBSV have more vanilla ( maybe too much ) , and way more dark fruit , with less oak , and less body . this find more balance , more stouty character , more fudge , oak , and bourbon , and a well body . it be a fantastic display of vanilla , and definitely one worth try . I think there could be well vanilla stout out there , but for what it be , this 2019 be definitely enjoyable .
it be a Vanilla bomb , tasty ! it be almost too much vanilla for I , but it be a treat . good for bottle share , there be no way I could tackle one by myself .

( 2020 bottle )   appearance : pitch black and oily in appearance , very thin mocha head on top . ton of lacing on the side after some swirling .   aroma : Vanilla , chocolate , bourbon . ca n't wait to dig in !   flavor : Incredible ... in summary : vanilla fudge brownie soak in bourbon . the balance be perfect -- soft bourbon touch throughout , deep rich chocolate , vanilla , raisin and dark fruit , and marshmallow . not much alcohol detect .   palate / Finish : very rich and velvety . smooth . no burn . finish with more rich chocolate and bourbon .   overall : quite possibly one of the good stout I 've have . it remind I of BCBS but with vanilla ( have n't have the vanilla variant yet ... ) . incredible .

2019 vintage .   l -- Pitch black in the glass with a finger of handsome medium brown head that dissipate fairly quickly and leave a small ring of lacing . this stuff look very thick S -- Vanilla , milk chocolate , fudgy brownie , bourbon , almond , caramel , butterscotch , hint of herbal hop . smell quite sweet and decadent , akin to a lot of the BA Trillium pastry stout I 've have t -- ' liquid brownie batter ' be a pretty apt description here . the vanilla and bourbon barrel presence be also quite front and center . sweet but not overly so , probably save by the bourbon barrel treatment F -- big mouthfeel , minimal carb . not insanely thick but quite velvety o -- glad to finally be try some Bottle Logic offering . this one be certainly big and boisterous , perhaps not quite worthy of 13th good beer in the world , but I can see how this make wave upon its initial release   90/100

be recently out in San Francisco visit friend and have to get my hand on this legendary beer . be a Boston guy , I be a bit biased to the NEIPA as the dominant IPA style , but this truly be the grandfather of the genre . elder you might say . anyways to the beer . it pour into a glow gold with a frothy thick head that catch I off guard and escape my glass . a casualty , but nonetheless we march on . carbonation bubble dance to the top of the head from the bottom of the glass . to the nose , piney / floral aroma tickle your nostril . a sip and immediately you be meet by a light bitterness , but a very fresh hoppy and pine like taste . a slight citrus aftertaste and each time you put it down , you be lure quickly to the next sip . slowly you be warm by the alcohol and once go , you be leave satisfied and disappoint you be out of beer . 510ml bottle on 02/02/2021 . " not package from resale . " sample from the brewery . thank , Vinnie !   I 've consume Pliny the eld hundred of time over the year , and most of those be on draught at the Falling Rock when I live in Denver , but I 've never sit down with a bottle for a proper review on my own .   pour a lively , light , pale , honey color beer with a hint of haze and a thick , creamy head that lace down the glass with each sip . big piney note in the nose with citrus and a soft floral aroma . Mouthfeel be sublime . crisp and prickly on the palate , and then creamy , firm , a bit chewy , and incredibly smooth . malty sweet with a light clean breadiness . Hoppy and fruity with pineapple , orange , ripe , juicy , fleshy , tropical fruit , and grapefruit rind . this be break up by a dry bitterness with pine , resin , and an oily and ashy presence that stick to the palate for what seem like forever . and I want it to last forever . biscuit . honey . warm alcohol . bone - dry finish . spicy linger .   despite the market be absolutely flood with India Pale Ales , and good number of they be what I 'd consider world - class , in 2021 Pliny the elder still stand after all these year as the gold standard for both West Coast and double ipa . and after drink it countless time , it never get old .

Bottled 2/16/21 .   l : pour clear golden , with visible tiny bubble rise from the bottom like champagne . short big - bubble white head stick all around the glass . nice splotchy lacing .   s : pine forest , flower , and citrus . all noticeable but not strong .   t : bitter pine up front , smooth out with floral and citrus note midway , then back to a piney / hoppy punch that dry at the finish .   f : medium mouthfeel . appropriate carbonation . not soft , but right for the style . no alcohol heat .   o : as advertise . the standard for west coast double ipa . the early and late piney hoppy bitterness be almost perfectly balance by the citrus and floral note in between .

by far my favorite IPA . the fragrance be out of this world : yeasty , citrus , and overall super fresh . taste be slightly bitter upfront but finish aromatic and soft on the palate . I can not wait to try more of Russian River Brewing Company ’s stuff
just the perfect representation of what a West Coast IPA should be . load of pine and very slight citrus on the nose and palate . clear . wonderful balance between the body and hop .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Laird's Apple Brandy Barrel
product_review: bottle bring by Fux to the Moeder Lambic taste a few week ago . great time gent ! thank heap for share this one man .   from a 750 into a tasting glass . vintage : 2010 Drunk next to a 2010 base beer .   APPEARANCE : a thick , dense , black pour produce a small , loose looking , dark mocha color head that immediately disappear . fade to a slight ring . jet black body with no carbonation at all . a slight ring remain but leave no lacing down the glass . thick , black tar for sure , but the head be a little lack luster at this point .   smell : some brandy here , with touch of vanilla and oak . note of cinnamon , chilie and light vanilla as well , though the adjunct have definitely fade . the brandy barrel be a little mute as well , mean this be a little less impressive than the regular 2010 , as well as the other barreled variant I 've sample .   TASTE : even less adjunct than the nose have showcase . some mild brandy , oak and vanilla up front with some chilie and cinnamon at the swallow as well . thing be there , but not very convincingly . flavor come out more after the swallow with a linger finish of brandy , some vanilla , milk chocolate , chilie and spicy cinnamon . touch of roasted malt make an appearance as well . nice , but the barrel be rather mellow at this point and adjunct be perhaps not as forthcoming as they once be . still very tasty , but not bold enough to be really impressive .   palate : good feel here , just like the 2010 base beer . medium - full body , oily , with medium carbonation . creamy on the palate , go down fine with a slightly oily and mouth - coat finish . solid stuff .   overall : really happy to have try this one , though I will say that it have probably see well day . I never have the chance to have it fresh , but at this point , the barrel be rather mellow and the adjunct be not as forthcoming as the regular 2010 base beer right now . this be still tasty and enjoyable , but probably not as impressive as it once be . if you have one , it be probably time to do something with it , as more time will not be kind . thank again Fux ! this be a lot of fun .

product_review: on tap out of a snifter , courtesy of the kind dude at Cigar City who provide a barrel to Falling Rock Tap House during the Great American Beer Festival ( 10/12/12 , to be exact ) .   a - very unique . appear almost as an imperial stout blend with red wine . swirl it , and you 'll see what I mean .   S - Apple . and brandy . Apple . and brandy . there be a stout in here somewhere . this stuff be incredibly unique .   T - So , do I mention the word " unique " in the Smell description indicate this be a " unique " beer ? ? that do n't do it justice . I 've never have anything remotely close to the taste of this brew . it taste like what it be : a fantastic imperial stout age in apple brandy barrel . but , you really have to taste this to have a full understanding and appreciation of how good it be . this be the first beer I 've ever try that leave I without an explanation for how fantastic and UNIQUE it be . honestly , if you have tell I a delicious imperial stout would be improve by age it in an apple brandy barrel , I 'd have be very skeptical ( or call you crazy ) .   m : thick than I have guess , despite how thick it look . but , it be not even close to be too thick . it have the " chewiness"of a great red wine . that word " unique " be come to mind ... again .   o - So , I assume I 'd go for many year without the opportunity to try this beer . thank you , Cigar City guy , for the opportunity to try your most incredible product ( it have to be ) , the opportunity to compliment your dedication to great beer , and the sweet key key chain . I tell you I 'd follow up with a phenomenal review on BA , so here it be . anyway , for those of you who love imperial stout and want to try a variation that will change your possibility on the style , get this . if you find a way to get some , it be go to be worth it . I might end up go to Tampa solely base on this beer . and , I have no other reason to go there . again , thank Cigar City guy !

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Laird's Apple Brandy Barrel
product_review: review the Apple Brandy - Aged Hunahpu 's Imperial Stout from Cigar City Brewing out of Florida . Hunahpu 's be Cigar City 's most famous stout and it be release at an event that be essentially similar to Dark Lord Day . we crack this one , in addition to several other big name goody , to celebrate the end of the Illinois bar exam , my birthday , and Robbie Moy 's birthday . score : 97   Counter - pressurized growler be from the summer 2012 release . serve in a wine chalice , share with friend and enjoy on 07/28/12 . review be from note .   appearance : pour a pitch black color with a nice layer of cappuccino - color head that settle to a ring around the glass . very oily , coat lace with a solid cling factor . 4/5   Smell : what a delicious medley . Fudge and sweet dark chocolate impart a bittersweetness . then brown sugar , a little dark fruit and vanilla , and a sweet rum - like aroma that must come from the apple brandy aging then tip the balance of the nose towards sweet . the oak , pepper and a hint of cinnamon then give the beer a nice spice anchor to the sweetness . there be a touch of booziness as the beer warm up , but nothing powerful or off - put or overwhelming in the least . this be a really excellent nose ! 4.75/5   taste : Chocolatey fudge , smooth vanilla and a sweet apple - and - watermelon - like rum flavor ( almost like a smooth and less sugary Bacardi grand melon flavor that be nothing like the off - flavor be report in some bottle of the 2012 vintage of Dark Lord ) be my first impression . there be a faint oakiness and chili pepper flavor at first on the side of the tongue that modestly grow as the beer warm and layer on the tongue . the apple brandy aging seem to have mellow out the pepper heat substantially in comparison to the base beer , but there be still a little bit of life leave in the pepper and the smooth , subtle heat they give off on the side of the tongue and the roof of the mouth give the beer a nice bold complexity that make the bitterness from the chocolate / fudge flavor pop on the tongue . the chocolate and rum sweetness really soak the tongue in flavor and linger with the faint pepper heat . there be some mild dark fruit flavor and a hint of molasse as well , though the aroma have more of each present . 4.75/5   Mouthfeel : rich , thick and viscous . full bodied and very low carbonation . there be a faint pepper heat on the tongue . slightly sweet , but not a " sweet " beer . 4.5/5   overall : the balanced pepper kick be what make I really love Hunahpu 's , but even though it be largely miss here the apple brandy aging impart more than enough additional complexity and flavor to make up for it . I need to get some more .   recommendation : seek this beer out ; even those who be not good at handle spiciness ( I be look at you , Scott ) should be able to enjoy this one thoroughly .   pairing : fresh strawberry .   cost : $ 25 for a 32 oz ( counter - pressured ) growler .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Laird's Apple Brandy Barrel
product_review: 750ml gold wax # 56/84 thank to ygtbsm94 . ink SRM pour with tower , martian red head . huge formation . nice retention . no lace . sweet vanilla nose , quite subtle , roasted chilie , some green olive . taste be super tangy and fruity with some unlikely acidity and quenching character . light palate . Palate be very soft , muted booziness , some heavy dark chocolate with lemon acidity . no apple brandy character I can detect , and I just spend 10 day tour the calvado region of France . Palate get quite chalky and powdery . I like the acidic lemon and very bitter cocoa powder and dark chocolate , but there ’s no barrel character at all . 6/4/7/4/13=3.4

Superb . the good Cigar City beer I 've ever have .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Laird's Apple Brandy Barrel
