Smell : really sweet with dark chocolate and dark fruit note . I be get the cinnamon , chilli , and vanilla . the brandy heat be there along with the sweetness .   taste : lot of brandy here . the malt and brandy combine to make this one very sweet . ton of chocolate with pepper spice , mild vanilla , dark fruit , and some alcohol . the finish be peppery and sweet .   Mouthfeel : the body be very thick with tingly carbonation and a finish that be a bit dry .   overall : I think this beer be good , but I enjoy the regular version more . quire complex and I would love to have it again .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Laird's Apple Brandy Barrel

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Laird's Apple Brandy Barrel
product_review: 32 oz growler courtesy of Matt . what a kind and generous gesture . thank you very much , buddy . split with steeph20 and milwaukeeclassic prior to the pre - great taste festivity .   pour a molten fudgey black forest cake with a fiery crimson ring atop . this beer just look like it want to whomp your ass . leave our taste glass stain and abuse with an oily sheen .   Apple brandy be supple on the nose . barrel be massive and evident and take the snap out of some of the pepper of the base . Cinnamon still ride hard along the dark chocolate and vanilla .   dear god , this be delicious . I be not the big fan of Hunahpu 's , but this treatment take the beer to a whole different level . Vanilla ice cream , brandy , fresh taffy apple , fudge , cinnamon , and a beautiful clashing of peppery heat that play tug - of - war with the barrel impart flavor . just a decadent , rich , delicious bomb of flavor that plunder the palate and leave you want more .   Mouthfeel be so smooth and slightly chewy . carbonation help keep it lively and save it from become a meaty and sludgy .   not sure how many time I 've truly want a 32 oz growler of 11.5 % beer all to myself , but this certainly fit the bill . when steep say " this will likely be the good beer I have all weekend " the day before the great taste , well that be about all you need to know . thank you again , Matt !

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Laird's Apple Brandy Barrel
product_review: a - as dark as a beer can get . even the bubble be the dark I 've ever see . pour a thick motor oil consistency . lot of dark lace around the glass . a very good look stout .   S - you definitely get the apple brandy right off the bat . Oak , Vanllla , Chocolate , Maple Syrup with just a hint of pepper .   t - so big and boozy . the apple brandy stand out but in a good way . it definitely hide the pepper a little bit compare to regular Hunahpu but it be a nice add layer of complexity . huge vanilla , chocolate and maple syrup note . also dark fruit and molasse . the apple brandy after taste if awesome .   M - amazing feel . creamy and velvety with a little carbonation .   o - this be one of those beer that I check off that I 'd never get to try . so glad to have the opportunity to have this and have it live up to the hype . one of the good beer I 've ever have . I give up a lot to get this but it be worth every penny .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Laird's Apple Brandy Barrel
product_review: pour from a 32 oz . growler into a snifter .   like the regular Hunahpu 's , the Apple Brandy Barrel Aged Hunahpu 's pour a viscous dark black chocolate color with a barely noticeable tan head around the ring of the glass .   the aroma be full , complex , and somehow elevate beyond the greatness the original Hunahpu 's achieve . the brandy be noticeable and seem to gently overlay the other aroma , which be consistent with the regular Hunahpu 's : dark chocolate , a bit of espresso , vanilla , with a bit of pepper and a slightly fruity apple presence .   each sip be nearly perfect . the dark chocolate fudge , roasted malt , and creamy espresso note all blend amazingly well with a brandy flavor . the middle of the sip contain the zenith of its complexity , with the apple come through , mix with oak and vanilla from the barrel , and a bit of residual chocolate flavor . the end of the sip wrap the treat up nicely , leave a nice brandy flavor in my mouth .   the brandy mellow out the sticky sweetness that the base beer contain , and the barrel definitely lighten up the carbonation a little bit as well . it be creamy and smooth , with the brandy cutting through the thickness of Hunahpu 's as well . this beer really just have the perfect body , carbonation , and smoothness that I be look for .   after taste Hunahpu 's for the first time I do not think there be any way to improve on it , but after have the whiskey and the brandy , I have change my opinion . this be such an incredible beer .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Laird's Apple Brandy Barrel

Brandon you be the man .   the beer pour jet black with the same dominate viscosity and residual oil leave on the inside of the glass while drink . the nose have note of buttery apple brandy , oak , and booze . the taste be sweet , rich , and boozy , but so balanced and smooth it be nuts . the apple be n't as prominent as expect , but there be a slightly tart , apple aftertaste that be an exceptional addition to one of my all time favorite stout . excellent beer that be completely worth the acquisition hassle ( that I myself do n't have to do ) .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Laird's Apple Brandy Barrel
product_review: humongous thank to juste for share this . who would 've guess that I 'd get to taste it again the next day ( thank dave ) ! ! ! enjoy on 7/27 at Top Hops at a mini tasting with some awesome bas . hell of a night and kick off a wonderful weekend of beer tasting ! tick from a 2 oz pour and then adjust my thought the next day from a large pour .   a - have that Hunah look . coat the glass with a single swirl . no head , but just a gorgeous beer .   s - smell like Hunah but with a strong raisin and fig . some booze and some brandy . basically hunah with some fruitiness a la sangria .   t - oh wow ! hunah extreme ! ! ! fig with apple brandy . you get the pepper on the finish but the fruitiness of the brandy just push this amazing beer to the next level . truly amazing .   m - Smooth and creamy . wonderful like a milkshake of amazing beer .   o - wow , what can I say ? this beer be simply amazing . on Friday when I sample it , I say I would do dirty thing for this beer ... and then the next day , I travel 2 hour to another tasting ( which be before a third tasting in 2 day ) and this be a pleasant surprise at the 2nd tasting . product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Laird's Apple Brandy Barrel
product_review: this fine beer be on tap at Cigar City on July 9th through July 11th . I take down note at that time , but it be so hard to forget a beer this good ! the brewery serve this beer to I in a Cigar City snifter .   this beer be thick and black that the beer come out of the tap look like the tap be pour use motor oil out of an old car . luckily there be n't a mechanic next door so I know this beer instead of oil . no highlight in this beer whatsoever . not any light source that can be find on this world would have the power to shine through this beer . I could have take the beer outside of the tasting room and hold it up into the bright Tampa sun and not one streak of light would penetrate this beer . surprisingly , there be a nice head of foam on this beer . the initial head of foam be about 1/4 of an inch in height and dark mocha in color . it have good renetion that leave behind a few spot around the edge of the beer and some tiny blot of lace around the glass .   the aroma be just as thick as the appearance . up front it be super sweet with the rich scent of caramel , vanilla , molasse , and candy sugar . it be so sweet that I think I be go to get a cavity just smell this beer . after the sweet have enough , in come some roasted malt , a sprinkle of roasted coffee , a drop of dark chocolate , a whiff of oak , and a touch of apple brandy at the finish line . I like how there be plenty of aroma to keep my nose busy , but I especially like how every aroma have their equal time in the spotlight .   as you could probably tell already , the taste be just as thick as the appearance and the aroma . the taste be sweet , but it be n't as sweet as the aroma . the taste be thick with caramel , molasse , a drop of dark chocolate , vanilla , dark roasted malt , a gentle touch of roasted coffee bean , a little oak , a taste that combine apple brandy and caramel , and then this beer finish up with an expect gentle splash of chili pepper . I know this beer be brew with some chili , but I really be n't expect the chili to show up at all . great surprise !   for a high abv% thick barrel age Imperial Stout , this beer mask its high abv% . there be so much go on in this beer that my body could n't pick up on the high abv% . the aftertaste be just as thick as everything else . the aftertaste be fill with roasted malt , roasted coffee bean , oak , caramel , molasse , and more of that gentle chili pepper .   there be no doubt about it ! this be truly one of the great beer in the world . if you ever see this beer on tap at Cigar City , consider yourself lucky and get about 2 glass of it .

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Laird's Apple Brandy Barrel
product_review: this be my new favorite beer , hand down .   it come out of a growler and pour sticky and motor oil thick - jet black with a tiny bit of dark brown head . smell super boozy and brandy heavy . the taste do n't have any of this heat . start out with the chocolate up front with a twinge of brandy , fade into the vanilla and big chocolate , then wave 3 and 4 come up from the back - huge apple brandy follow by just a tiny bit of spicy pepper . as it get towards room temperature the cinnamon / cayenne come out , as do the apple note in the brandy .   thick as hell with just enough carbonation .   Thanks Josh / jbuddle for this trade . iso : Apple Brandy Huna FT : everything

product_name: Hunahpu's Imperial Stout - Laird's Apple Brandy Barrel
product_review: thank bulbman for the hookup   look : black with red circle around the top of the beer . very little tan head and leave the glass with a great coating   Smell : the nose of this beer like pretty much everything be just amazing . there be so many layer to the nose I be not sure where to start . the brandy really shine through with some dark chocolate brownie behind that . trace of vanilla pass by the nose as well as a touch of chili pepper   taste : holy fucking banana batman this be amazing . the beer have this wonderful chocolate cover cherry character bring forth by the brandy and right when you think the beer ca n't get any well it totally change bring forth lot of vanilla and fudge . then a third wave take over and you get a nice amount of chili pepper and molasse that just work perfectly together . but wait there be more . the beer finish with that same chocolate cover cherry flavor .   Mouthfeel : thick as hell and low to no carbonation(could be more ) oily as hell and you can just feel it coat your inside   overall : this be the perfect dessert beer and be definitely in my top 3 beer of all time . I be glad that another growler just arrive at my doorstep . holy hell this beer be almost perfect and I honestly ca n't see a beer be much well

I be lucky enough to win the recent Assassin vertical random draw . drive to Iowa on Friday , pick up day be Saturday . I sample 2020 Assassin , Term Oil and Kaiju Clash .   look : Dark , like a stout should be . smell : bourbon , Chocolate , slight Vanilla . taste : no adjunct , pure BA Imperial Stout . pick up some Vanilla on the back end . feel : thin than I expect but still nice . overall : maybe the hype be too much . the beer be very good but I be not blow away .

2018 Bottle ( Orange Wax )   a really fantastic , in - your - face whiskey barrel stout . lot of stew fruit cut through a whiskey potency that finish dangerously smooth . very impressed . have hear some possible bottle variance , but this one be hold up exceptionally well .

bottle from Batch 1 ( Red Wax ) . thick black pour with a small tan head and low carbonation . intense rye , vanilla , and oak aromas . big chocolate , roast , fudge , cocoa , and oak . mild booze , licorice , and dark fruit . sweet flavor of whiskey and vanilla . chocolate , fudge , and dark fruit . some alcohol , hint of licorice , and a nice coffee bite on the finish .

2016 Purple Wax Bottle 22 oz bottle pour into an Assassin teku   a- pour jet black in color , thick and syrupy with a one - finger creamy dark brown head that have great retention and leave a bit of lace behind   s- aroma open with straight up brownie batter ; chocolate , caramel , toffee and cake batter . undertone of coconut , vanilla cream and char . plenty of barrel aroma on the close with some wet oak , bourbon and an enhancing vanilla and coconut note   T- brownie batter flavor follow the aroma with note of rich chocolate , cake batter , caramel and toffee up front . mid - palate start to bring out the barrel , with note of barrel juice and chewy oak , along with vanilla and coconut start to emerge . the finish give note of raisin and fig , as well as rich chocolate icing and caramel . linger of dark fruit , bourbon and marshmallow   M- heavy body with moderate carbonation lead to a thick and chewy mouthfeel that continue into . a velvety warming finish   O- a big , bold , thick and chewy stout that have just enough barrel character . definitely a slow sipper

2019 vintage pour on dec 19 , 2020   pour a viscous use motor oil color with a mocha color head that leave minimal lacing .   Nose be of dark fruit , vanilla , leather , dark chocolate , and faint oak . this be culmination of great barrel and base beer .   taste follow nose with subtle dark fruit , dark chocolate , linger vanilla and barrel character . the taste once again really showcase the great use of barrel and base stout .   feel be where this beer fall short . it be slightly over carbed that thin out the beer more than desire on the pallet . however , beer be still medium body . as this sit for 45 + min , the carb start to dissipate and leave a more velvet mouth feel .   overall , excellently craft barrel age stout that showcase the use of great barrel and stout recipe . unbelievable that this be non adjucte . I think the beer fall short on feel(but get well once it sit open ) but I would gladly drink another ! I also do not think it be worth the price of admission , unless you be able to get it directly from the brewery .

2020 vintage ( green wax ) ; consume on 10/27/20   pour an inky , jet - black body trail in turn by a cascade , rocky , deep mocha foam ; great head retention wither steadily to a foggy sliver of cap , a massive , creamy collar , and wall of lacing cling briefly to the glass .   Aroma begin with subtle dark fruit alongside a building barrel presence , invoke detail of rich caramel , light oak , and a subtle vanilla ; a depth surge in wave over the middle , bring a healthy combo of fresh cacao nibs and milk chocolate alternate prominence ; raisin , a minor ( though brilliantly level ) ethanol , brown sugar , and dark cherry ester accent the back end of the bouquet as chocolate pudding close and linger through the nose .   taste open with splintery oak carry the weight of dark malt , which calmly evolve to more toast note of caramel , brown sugar , lush baker chocolate , and a fluffy , pipe tobacco - imbue roast ; cherry ' pop ' against decadent , oaky vanilla and a soft nuttiness over the mid - palate and form a vanilla frost character on back end , where dusty tone of hot chocolate leave the final impression .   Mouthfeel offer a near - comprehensive full body , show a chewy texture balance against a low - moderate , pillowy carbonation ; a slick , malty grit ease through the mid - palate with an evenly disperse ethanol warmth lurk beneath and a splintery dryness prickle develop through an oily back end ; an impactful rounding of robust , malt roast assure a totality to the finish / swallow .   a graceful , classically - style barrel - age stout , layer wave of chocolate and an intrinsic whiskey undertone atop the ideal body , plush as it embrace the subtlety of a mild - moderate boozy heat . the barrel itself be sweet , but see the malt profile flourish with near - perfect integration , come to form one of the more exhaustively pleasing sample of an unadjuncted barrel - aged beer one be likely to come across .

Assassin 2020   split with jrc1093 , who I owe my soul to for such a generous act . thank you beyond word for share this with I .   2020 vintage ( green wax ) - pour into a stemless glass at about 50 ° F . Wax be somewhat of a project , but it be n't I open it , and I be prreettty sure I could have do it quick . just sayin ' .   pour an oily jet black with absolutely zero light penetration - even on the pour . two finger of very dark brown head build up - coarse , with each individual bubble visible , and with very impressive retention . Clings to the glass . visible effervescence can be see feed the collar , which be nuts .   Nose : balanced roast that somehow convey more caramel , toffee , and brown sugar than chocolate set the foundation , with zero ash or char . there be some very restrained dark fruit - mostly dry cherry , and it be quite tuck in . there be a hint of vanilla frost , as well as some raw brownie batter . ton of oak and bourbon quickly become the star of the show , with warm , saturated bourbon , lending classic caramel , brown sugar , and barrel spice note . the oak be splintery , woody , and prominent - like stick your head in a fresh barrel . a round nuttiness encompass everything . ethanol become very apparent as it open up , but integrate well . a really stunning aroma .   palate : Assassin open up with an explosion of chocolate cake batter , hot chocolate , splintery bourbon - soak oak , soft caramel , english toffee , and brown sugar . very sweet , rich , and decadent , but never becoming cloy or saccharine , as the barrel constantly ground it . the malt here still shy away from acrid or charry roast , contribute very little coffee , dark chocolate , or bitterness , and instead , milky , creamy , sweet chocolate , and a whisper of cavendish pipe tobacco . there be an underlie note of vanilla frost , and malt milk ball , frame by a constant round nutty element , like praline pecan and hazelnut butter . the chocolatey sweetness begin to subside , as a full - on punch of splintery , dry , toast oak lend a nice woodiness , with dusty , mature bourbon sweep in to provide a dry balance . the finish linger with oak , caramel , toffee , and tobacco , rather than roast or ash . surprisingly easy to drink .   Mouthfeel / body : everything you 've hear about topple Goliath stout apply here . it be almost hard to believe . as soon as Assassin pass your lip , it fill your mouth with rich , oily , slick , viscous liquid , reminiscent of motor oil , but with an add fluffy softness from the fine effervescence . chewy , decadent , and luscious , yet never actually sticky , fudgey , or overbearing - with that splintery oak perfectly dry it out and let it lift off the palate with no linger sweetness . definitely coat the lip though . warming , but never hot or burn , and somehow , be actually easy to drink .   overall : I be not one to cave into hype , and I 'll admit when something be overrate . Assassin deliver almost everything you could possibly want from an un - adjuncte barrel - aged imperial stout . densely saturate with sweet , decadent milk chocolate , caramel , and vanilla , with a bold bourbon presence , heavy oak for balance , sweet , nutty malt , and a texture that be almost hard to believe , all while keep balanced , drinkable , and still very much an imperial stout . no beer be worth hundred of dollar , but value aside , it be difficult not to fall in love with this one . I be grateful for the experience .
get some fruit . great non - adjunct barrel - age stout . never think I would see or try this beer . not sure how my friend procure this , but glad to try it !

right up front I will say that I be not a huge fan of sour beer . I do something I never do with a sour and have a glass and a half of this in one sitting . probably more to do with the price and scarcity than the taste . as rare as this be , I probably wo n't get another chance to try it ... and I be actually quite okay with that .   this be a conversation beer ... someone who enjoy sour beer might argue differently ... but as a sour skeptic , I can appreciate the time ( up to two year ) age this and know that the French do not mess around when it come to great beer and wine production . this be no doubt of the high quality you can buy . the only issue I have be that , for the price and rarity , the bottle look very cheap . it remind I of a bottle of sparkle apple cider you 'd buy at the store for $ 3 .

can on 8/5/20 ; consume on 8/19/20   pour a turbid , dark peach / carrot juice hue cap with multiple finger of rocky , white foam ; great head retention leave mound of chunky cap , a moderate , frothy collar , and a modest spread of thin , soapy , webby / spotty lace around the glass .   Aroma start off sweet and grassy upfront , welcome in apricot , sweet , musty mint , papaya , and grapefruit rind steadily ; a consistent grassiness persist over the middle to softly undercut the building tropical overtone before wisp of uniquely dank red berry ease through the finish .   taste feature juicy , overripe peach in wave upfront and accent with hint of nectarine , grapefruit oil , and mango ; the tropical amalgam maintain across the palate as lemon and lime fade with the finish and hint of bubblegum linger ( in typical Tree House fashion ) .   Mouthfeel show a medium body with a subtle , moderate carbonation ; present silky with a mild hop prickle develop as it become creamy , juicy and pithy past the mid - palate and remain consistent to the finish , where it maintain a plush quality and vague bitterness on the swallow .   a confounding and intense experience , so heavily saturated in a flow hop nuance and beg for perfection , and yet maybe too intense for its own good ; there be a certain lack of order that prevent individual element from shine through , and can be count as possibly the sole reason this be only an excellent ( as oppose to world - class ) NEIPA .

what a beautiful beer . as soon as you open the can tropical aroma fill the room ! such a beautiful beer , note of mango and passion fruit be very evident . balance by perfect bitterness and a dry finish make this such a drinkable beer . the hype train be real and I be travel to destination ecstatcy ! !

basically a perfect IPA . Aroma , mouthfeel , taste / aftertaste ... all balance beyond comprehension . one of the few beer which live up to the hype . one of the good beer you 'll ever have .
the original be still one of the good TreeHouse have to offer . the balance between hop and juiciness be top rate . will always be my favorite TreeHouse beer .

a pint can gift from a friend . and what a gift . as soon as the can be open , I know it 'd taste as great as it smell , but it be even well . not much head retention but to I that be not a biggie . there be nothing I can offer regard the taste that would n't be superfluous to what be be say before . you owe it to yourself to try this beer if you can .

pour from can into pint glass . bright and hazy orange and peach appearance .   immediate hit of orange waft from open .   Mouthfeel be medium carbonation , easy . mellow love body that comfort the palate .   taste of mango , orange , slight hop . not overwhelming but juicy and drinkable with the hop tick the tongue on the finish . this be n't one that hit you over the head , yet you know from the first sip that this be go to be one of your favorite .

appearance : opaque golden orange in color , with a tall dense cloudy white head . lovely lace on the glass after a few sip .   aroma : ripe ripe ripe orange , hop , lemon .   flavor : fruity ripe orange surprise basically ... Ripe orange , cream , fresh hop , greeeen grass . it have so much flavor popping out of it for a 6.8 % IPA .   palate / Finish : Creamy , carbonation , very very smooth and fluffy . finish with ripe bitter orange .   overall : Damn I wish this be in grocery store ! at the same time I guess I do n't ... it be extremely well - make , but more - so it be a signature of true craft . great job Tree House .

have this plenty of time but finally get around to review . appearance be copper with a finger and a half of creamy white head . Aroma be juicy , hoppy goodness . Mango , grapefruit and more . taste be a nice balance of the same , with a medium level of bitterness . nice full mouthfeel .

canned 08/26/20   pour a hazy orange with two finger of foam . immediate smell wave of orange juice and mango - wow , the smell immediately fill the room when pour into a glass . taste follow the nose with an emphasis on the orange . l : Hazy yellow / orange with a thick , rocky head and excellent lace   s : huge peachy nose . very citrusy as well with some tropical fruit salad in the mix . the malt add a honey like sweetness to the aroma that blend beautifully with the hop character .   t : moderate bitterness , huge hop flavor . Juicy orange , peach , mango , and grapefruit . the malt have a similar character to the aroma and again really amplify the juiciness of this beer .   f : medium bodied , crisp , dry finish .   overall : I have have few beer that can compare to this beer hop flavor saturation . it be very impressive . it also still manage to integrate this hop flavor with the malt and yeast ester profile . I can see why this beer be so hyped , it be so easy to approach and deliver a ridiculous load of flavor .

at a post Labor Day backyard pizza and beer night , Julius turn head . a deep orange body , half inch creamy foam , the aroma entice with late summer peach / nectarine citrus note . so smooth ... refreshing mouth feel ! the balance make this mouth watering and ever so memorable .

just another really really good beer . at a certain point all of these treehouse beer roll into one for I … the difference between brew be more subtle than with other brewery . they make " juicy " beer the right way : with the bitter necessary to make it delicious and the carbonation to make it luscious . just crazy good .

day 2 of be able to snag some Tree House whale . can 9/21/21 . a mere 4 day old .   pour out dark yellow with some translucency . a finger of tight , compact bubble form . another picture perfect pour .   Nose be tropical fruit and a strong presence of pine and dankness . some pineapple and mango come through , but it be mostly that dank weediness .   taste be very green indeed . huge pine bitterness swell to a high point . the dankness be strong here on the palate as well . this be certainly a strong version of their Green . it be get that peppery quality to it the same way Green do . the bitterness do n't linger too heavily overall . it peak high for a NEIPA , but not nearly as long as a West Coast . it give a taste , and then eventually reset to neutral more quickly .   Mouthfeel be light to medium bodied with mild carbonation . this one be n't as pillowy and soft as other . there be a little thinness to this brew . maybe a little watery .   overall another fantastic Tree House dipa . while this brew be great , it be not quite as excellent as King Julius . the jump from Julius to the King be much more of a leap from Green to very Green . still wonderful though and a phenomenal brew to have with sharp cheddar . they compliment each other perfectly .

from a 16 oz can 8/05/2021 into a Willi Becher pint glass . l - pour a a hazy orange color with a fluffy white head that dissipate slowly . review 1585 Very Green TreeHouse Brewing Date : 23 June 2021 my continue pursuit for all thing treehouse , this my thirteenth beer . I receive this from a recent BIF , and it be fresh . I serve it about 44 degree use a generic tulip glass . the pour of the beer create a massive two - finger head . Citrus emit as the beer be pour . the creamy and foamy white head dissipate slowly , leave gob of lace on the glass . the color of the beer chart around SRM 6 , pale straw with golden yellow hue . this beer be hazy and sexy .   I detect clementine , orange ester , a skosh of floral ester , pineapple , peach , a hint of grapefruit , biscuit , toast cracker , and some dankness .   the flavor in the beer be juicy tangerine , orange , a touch of floral ester , a hint of grapefruit , biscuit , lightly toast malt , cracker , dankness , pineapple , pear , peach , passionfruit , and a slight earthiness .   the mouthfeel be velvety , smooth , and a touch astringent .   the body of the beer be medium , have medium carbonation , and have a long finish .   my god , this beer be incredible . the flavor be bright ; furthermore , the beer be harmoniously in balance with the core ingredient . spectacular beer , one of the good NEIPA I have drunk .

pour a hazy yellow orange color with a light white color head that lace the glass nicely on the way down . smell of sweet toasted malt , some floral and mainly citrusy hop aroma . taste mainly of citrus juicyiness , a hint of floral hop at the end of it . it be smooth , light feeling than it be , perfect amount of carbonation . overall , an excellent NEIPA , as usual from Treehouse .
great densely hop IPA . really intriguing to let it warm a bit and a little bit of grain and caramel actually come through as the label say . I think I prefer Green , but this be a great " variant "

look like orange juice as do most beer of this style . Smell be pineapple and citrus , with dank hop underscore the bill . taste follow suit with a sweet malty finish . I like this beer . it ’ not bad by any mean . but it be very similar to many other beer of this style both make by TH and other brewer . will not seek again .

buy fresh at the brewery on 5/21 . this be truly an incredibly make beer . it kind of remind I of the first time I try King Sue when I first get into ipa -- it have the same general quality of drinkability and flavor burst . I do n't know how Tree House make this drink so smooth .

straight from Tree House . can 4 day ago . 16 oz can into pint glass . a : bright straw , cloudy , half inch head fade to quarter inch . s : Grassy , Pineapple , dank t : Pineapple , dank , cereal malt , citrus rind bitterness at the finish . m : medium body o : wave after wave of flavor . outstanding .

pour a completely hazy , opaque , and thicc . bright orange color . thick , frothy white head .   Aroma have luscious , bright tropical note . Mango , pineapple , orange , and tropical fruit intersperse with note of dank fruit , grass and some doughy malt note .   taste follow the nose with note of mango , pineapple , orange , and tropical fruit - ripe and rindy . doughy malt provide the backbone for the hop . Light grassy and windy bitterness on the back end .   feel be on the thick side , full bodied . Smooth , pillowy almost creamy mouthfeel . moderate carbonation .   overall this be a really nice NEIPA - great aroma and flavor .

( 16 oz can , 8.3 % abv , 04/13/21 ; purchase at TH by my brother ; keep store away cold till today ... pour in stage into trillium fat tulip )   l : milky , yellow - light amber liquid ; tall , expansive , glossy foam , rocky in its recede , last long   s : musky pineapple rind , dry pineapple out of the gate ... as the head break down , a peculiar pepper dough note ... when the liquid show on the surface , citrus burst ... alcohol rather bury , though a soft floral perfume waft in the ether ... later it get catty , and likely the most catty character I 've ever sniff ... 3d expression , at any rate   t : lightly - oxidize pineapple , fruit - ed cereal flake ... lightly - earthy , subtly - peppery , vaguely mango finish ... lime - drench grapefruit note in the aftertaste ... third sip start as nilla wafer , then morph into a tropical , leafy bitterness ... fourth and fifth sip , it become clear this be one of the well - balance neipa between grain milk and hop nuance , a perfect marriage ... the alcohol do start to open up and emanate in the aftertaste about halfway through , accentuate and mutate certain hop element ... it be almost malty tiki by the end ... honestly , what incredible flavor development over the course of every few sip   f : attenuate , numb nectar ... delicately viscous , stealthily buoyant ... slight resinous , residual drag in the finish ... by the end , the tonic booze be just stoke the hearth of my face ... I do n't enjoy the sluggish milk , and this be anything but   o : I 'll have to reference my other TH review , but this ( especially be a nasty pineapple ho ) be one of the well / good neipa I 've try ... bitter , strident ( booze ) , dynamic , sharply - shape , b.o.-tiful ... my bro have be hook it up , but I might need to make a special trip up Mass - way to snag some of this myself ( 1768 )

amazing !   look : hazy ish IPA , not murky but not west coast clear , somewhere in the middle .   Smell : Grassy / danky / tropical / hoppy / bitterish / piney finish .   taste : Insane ! the hop punch you straight on the back of your tongue in a super piney / grassy forward way and end somewhat danky . for I , it be n’t juicy , it be slightly tropical , but the grassy taste cover up most of the tropical note . after the hoppy / danky finish the piney / grassy note linger for an hour .   really bold and hop forward beer but very drinkable due to the grassy / dank note that just over power everything .   extremely delicious , very drinkable ! but after one beer the taste linger so much I think it ’s well to savor the flavor with this one , multiple glass of water later and I could still taste the hop ... very green indeed .

very Green from Treehouse . receive on 9/4/21 from @Rub_This_BBQ in NBW BIF # 13 . 16 oz can store upside - down at home at 42 degree . review 14/4/21 . note that I use DD / MM / YY protocol . bottom stamp " my name be very green 03/011/21 " . serve at 44.9 degree in a hand wash and dry Jester King snifter . final temperature 54.5 degree . appearance – 4.25 . first pour – Pale Straw ( SRM 2 ) , murky and nearly opaque . body – straw ( SRM 3 ) , murky and opaque . when rear - lite , same . head – Average ( Maximum 3.6 cm , aggressive center pour ) , creme , high density , average retention , diminish to a 12 to 14 mm crown and a medium rocky cap , feed by effervescence . tiny worm of foam remain above the crown . second pour produce a high density 0.6 cm head . lacing – good . head retraction and volume reduction leave a slightly three - dimensional wide band of tiny to medium bubble with a center ring of large bubble where the band be attempt to split . see also above . aroma – 3.75 – initial burst of generic citrus with tropical fruit . this rapidly fade leave an extremely weak pineyness . no malt , no yeast . flavor – 4.25 – begin bitter and resiny with generic citrus but lack the typical terpene of pine . no malt , no yeast . no alcohol ( 8.3 % ABV , as mark on container ) taste or aroma . a weak gastric warming occur . no dimethylsulfide or diacetyl . palate – 4 – medium , almost creamy , lively carbonation . final impression and summation : 4 Decent , sure , but not one I ’d buy in any quantity . still , I ’m glad I got to try another authentic NEIPA .

thank to rub_this_bbq for this one , from a recent ninja box . 16 oz can ( date 3/11/21 ) pour into 14 oz teku . pour a muddy orange color with an inch of white head that have good retention and lacing .   as expect , frooty hop dominate the nose , orange be dominant . no grain / malt presence .   start out pretty similar on the tongue , lot of froot loop , but in the middle and back there be a certain amount of bitterness that save the beer .   the body be the typical medium - thin of the style , smooth , and have a finish that , while still on the sweet side , be much dry than anticipate .   Drinkability be fine , probably great if you be a fan of the style .   overall , a nice brew , but I do n't see where it stand out from it 's peer . worth try if you get the chance .

sweet , tropical hoppy , bready / biscuity , slightly earthy / grassy , and orange citrus nose on this one ! taste follow with a juicy and soft , tropical hoppy , hint of earthy citrus finish ... just great in the depth and mouthfeel department ! this be outstanding !

can on 3/11/2021 . six day ago - what a score ! ! !   pour a super hazy dirty straw color with over a finger of head . the nose have note of citrus , overrippene tropical fruit and a touch of darkness in the back end ( be this what they mean by " green ? " )   the flavor have really bold tropical fruit up front with a bitter and pithy finish .   the bitterness be apparent but not turn up to 11 . nevertheless , this be a modern day classic .   anyone who ask why Tree House beer be so special , this be the beer to hand they .

one of the most dynamic taste experience my mouth have ever encounter . the crack of the can unleash a plethora of tropical note and piny scent . it ’ incredible and enough to fill the room . the taste profile mirror the aromatic experience . it start out in the tropic and then transition to a dense pine forest . I mean I ’m not kid when I say this , it ’s as if you crash into an evergreen and you have to pick the needle out of your tooth . finally , this beer smack the back of your throat with an extremely intense hop bite that fad into a smooth finish beg you you to grab the glass and bring it to your lip once again . I ca n’t underestimate how lovely this beer be . it ’s bold , it ’ tasty and it ’ an experience your mouth wo n’t soon forget .

I do n’t believe the hype . then I drink the beer . now I realize the hype be n’t enough . wow , what a delicious juice bomb of a beer . if juiciness be n’t your thing , do n’t even try . if it be your jam , fasten your seatbelt . amazing mouth feel , burst of pineapple and orange aroma and flavor . , and the 8.6 % provide a kick . must try for fan of the New England style .

review from notes- August 2016   pour almost clear golden color with a lively white head that reduce to leave just a ring . smell of cheese funk , orange , overripe stone fruit , crack pepper , dry hay , dry dark fruit . taste of barnyard funk with fruity note of lemon peel and orange , the sherry barrel be notice mid - palate , add dry dark fruit , even a hint of a nutty element . I have this two day ago on Thanksgiving . the review be from note . it be age in 40 year old sherry barrel give it some sherry flavor . I find it to have a Geuze like tart flavor , maybe too tart for some . however , I think it be truly delicious and very refreshing as well as complex . if you like Lambics ( and Geuze ) I think you will agree .   look : hazy golden with a thin white head   Aroma : lemon , apple , apricot / peach , sherry   taste : I taste lemon , apple , tart apricot / peach , sherry , and a dry oak finish . very nice dry tart aftertaste .   body / Overall : light to medium body .
bottle at share from Todd . Orange / pinkish pour , flat . fruity , sweet aroma , hint of brandy . taste bring tartness , note of grape , hint of tomato . Earthy .

decant at 3f. perhaps the perfect all - around lambic drinking experience . Visually stunning- amazing bouquet . taste be incredibly well balanced . blend 3 , 5 and 6 be all great , but 3 be my favorite .

batch 2 so this be the solera . little bit dark orange , great head . great aroma of lambic and bright citrus along with some barrel . the beer pour a clear orange with no head . it smell and taste of tart lemon , rustic funk , Sherry , and light cheese . funky , but well put together and very easy drinking .

I 've taste several thousand different beer over the year . 10,000 plus check in and at least that amount of different beer on a couple of other " check in " site . bottom line : this be my favorite beer ..... ever , to date . I ca n't say it be the well make or even the good beer I 've have - it be simply my favorite . amazing flavor , mouthfeel and finish . it have it all with great complexity and yet go down easy and you want more . good by itself or amazing with just about any food profile .

the nose of this showcase the sherry age gueuze and the familiar drie funk . on the palate more of the same that funky cheesey gueuze goodness , grassy note and ton of dark fruit and residual sugar from the sherry to finsh .

sorry Contillon and Bokkenrijder , this be the good lambic I have have ! worth the hunt , worth the money , worth every single minute you give it . wow ! it be almost hard to put into word how much be go on , yet so much on a delicate scale . plenty of sweet red wine element , grape , sherry booze , lemon , plus other fruit like orange , peach and pear . then there be the hay , earthy , and beet sugar base that crop up in fun and balanced sip . plenty of funk , barrel element and oak to boot . little bit of everything , amazing !

a 750ml bottle , batch 2 , bottle on 26th March 2016 and a good before date of 26th October 2026 . pour into a 3 Fonteinen funnel and decanter , decant for 60 to 90 minute and pour into a 3 Fonteinen zenne glass .   appearance : a mostly clear golden orange colour with a minimal white head and sparse to no lacing .   aroma : earthy funk , barnyard , hay , oak , nutty , sherry , peach and lemon .   taste : complex flavour . Funky , earthy , barnyard , sour , lemon , grape , apricot , sherry and oak with a hint of vanilla .   Mouthfeel : medium body with soft carbonation .   overall : wow , such complexity and goodness from a beer . amazing and well balanced . now I really want to try this side by side with the sherry and even batch 1 , if at all possible .

batch 1 . 2015 vintage ; drink 11/18/17 @ the Yarchives .   cloudy orange appearance .   Minimal white head ; minimal lace .   Burnt wheat & mild peach note in the nose .   Medium mouthfeel .   Peach jam & mild smoke flavor ; a faintly tart finish . Refreshing & easy to enjoy .

batch 1 , bottled 1/3/2014 , decant and serve in a white wine glass   look - decant be a ruby red , white head and once pour into a glass it lighten up to a pink grapefruit color , slight white head that disappear quickly , nice lacing for a 7 % lambic   Smell - barnyard hay , sherry , and heavy oak and can smell the acid . some complexity to it and a little fruity , but overall fairly mild nose   taste - earthy , some citrus , light grapefruit , and some note of apricot and white peach .... jammy , but not quite in a way a fruit sour be jammy , but the way these flavor mold together with the mouthfeel , it just kind of seem a little like liquid peach jam .   feel - extremely drinkable and refreshing . very mild tartness . an obviously delicate lambic as it go do .   Overall - A+ experience to be able to have this bottle , decant it , and share it with some great people . a lambic I likely will not get to enjoy again , but this be an amazing , complex , flavorful lambic that one of the good of the evening .

2014 vintage , pour into a decanter , at the Lambik - o - droom .   semi - hazy amber pour with a thin , velvety off - white head .   easily identifiable 3 Fonteinen lambic funk , green apple , mineral note , light fruit oxidation , a bit of grapefruit , sherry ( or I should say Oloroso ) , very light caramel , oak , light vanilla . very interesting to have side - by - side with Oloroso and px . compare to batch 2 - Solera , this one be dry , much more funk - forward and a bit more oaky , as well . very similar to the Armand & Gaston .   absolutely delicious , I think I prefer this just a bit more to the second batch , though it migh just be because of its age .   ---   batch 2 - Solera   sample at BXL Beer Fest and again at 3 Fonteinen Open Brewery Days .   semi - hazy orange pour straight from the bottle , and clear orange at the brewery , from the decanter . a thin white head .   note of cognac , honey , lambic funk , grape , white wine , whiskey , oak , light vanilla . really complex lambic and sherry aroma , and close to perfect dusty , musty 3F funk . I feel like I need to drink a whole bottle by myself before I understand this beer . smooth texture , medium carbonation , bitter - sweet and light sour finish .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: 2021 batch .   this one pour a very dark black color , with a small head , and no lacing .   this smell very strongly of coconut , with load of milk and dark chocolate , very slight roast , light bourbon , and lot of creamy vanilla .   this be definitely sweet , but honestly , not as sweet as I expect . this really do meet the hype that it garner - it be exactly what you want out of high quality pastry . the coconut be do so well , it be so bright and vibrant and just plain tasty . there be a little bit of barrel , it help anchor the beer slightly . the vanilla be also do very well , and it be all just layer on top of a very tasty and creamy base beer .   this be very creamy and rich , with no real booziness to it at all . it be very , very drinkable .   I almost do n't want this one to be good - I do n't always like Angry Chair and this be such a hype beer . fortunately ( unfortunately ? ) for I , it be honestly awesome . this be the good Angry Chair beer that I 've ever have .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: bottle . dark brown pour with a chocolate head . huge chocolate cake bouquet . well shit , that be a chocolate treat . do n’t get I wrong , this bad boy be uber sweet but it ’s exactly as advertise . it ’ literally a liquid version of chocolate cake . as it warm up the bourbon , oak , vanilla start to show up . really good body and mouthfeel .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: have this stout at Angry Chair on 3/20/21 so I ’m guess it ’ a 2021 bottle . a very nice guy sit at the table next to I offer a pour from a bottle he be share with a friend to my wife . needless to say , I drink her pour . jet black color with a little bit of foam . smell like chocolate with some light bourbon note . taste be the good chocolate I ’ve ever taste in a stout . rich , sweet chocolate balance perfectly with a slight bourbon taste . Mouthfeel be also perfect just coat the tongue . this beer blow I away ! I ’ve have the non BA Version year ago and it be very good but this be in a league of its own . the good pastry stout I ’ve ever have . the first perfect score I ’ve ever give on beer advocate .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: on tap for tbbw 2021 " Sorta Rad " Event .   2021 vintage . good viscosity ; not as thick as a lot of Angry Chair I ’ve have . get awesome Samoa vibe . strong coconut and chocolate , with a really well - balanced barrel . Awesome .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: the look right out of the bottle look amazing . have a great mouth feel that be like drink brownie batter . like many AC stout it be sweet but the barrel help keep the sweetness down some .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: # 248 of top 250 - 2020 bottle   l : Jet black , dark tan head that dissipate quickly   s : lot of coconut , some booze , strong waft of chocolate   t : Sweet , per the usual with Angry Chair , but surprisingly well blend adjunct flavor . Coconut and cinnamon up front , some chocolate on the back end . really enjoyable   f : it should come as no surprise that this be very thicc   o : Glad to have finally try it , one of the good offering from AC . a top tier pastry stout

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: this beer remind I a lot of what old school ( pre-2015 ) barrel - aged stout from Cigar City Brewing use to taste like . excellent use of adjunct , highly viscous mouthfeel , and a great chocolatey finish . a fantastic beer .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: 2020 vintage :   Jet black , low head retention but a stubborn ring of lacing . huge coconut and chocolate on the nose . the taste be really unbelievable , as far as stay true to the title . I 've be tell by several this be the good vintage yet , and I can understand why . pastry stout be already somewhat gimmicky by nature , but this one deliver the adjunct in a way that be somehow both aggressive and balanced . it finish thick , smooth and linger for a while . this be a real treat , and deliver on the hype in a way that I rarely see . drink fresh .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: pour an oily , night black color with a small beige head , receede immediately to a small ring of lacing .   smell of toast coconut , spicy licorice and warm oak . the nose isn‘t too pungent in itself with just a hint of vanilla hover atop .   drink utmost thick , oily with a decadent , smooth mouthfeel . the body on this be huge , heavy and complex .   taste of sweet milk chocolate , together with toasted , sweet coconut and a light , spicy , warming barrel appearance . have an almost extreme oiliness to it , quite possibly from the prominent , flowery coconut in this , result into a decadent smoothness with load of whip cream . finish with even more chocolate cover spice , heavier on the licorice than on the barrel , leave a long last milk chocolate and licorice aftertaste on the palate .   Yepp , this be sweet and decadent . its standout aspect be its supersmooth , silk mouthfeel , highlight unfortunately nothing in particular . the coconut be well integrate in this , while the bourbon barrel only play a minor part , waste a lot of potential to overcome the simple number of adjunct in this , potentially create a truly complex stout .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: 6 oz . pour .   dark browm / black with a small mocha head .   smell of rich chocolate , caramel and coconut .   Taste mimic the nose . sweet but manage to not become cloy . great flavor that meld together well .   Mouthfeel be medium - heavy with low carbonation .   my first Angry Chair experience and quite a good one . expensive but definately worth a shot .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: those of you that actually read past the fact sheet on my review know that I carry a strong inherent bias against pastry stout because I do n’t handle sweetness very well . some of you may have also notice that I do n’t seem as disenchant when it come to barrel - aged stout and barleywine , when they sometimes taste as sweet , if not sweet than other representation of pastry stout available on the market .   besides the actually unendurable level of sweetness that set light up my tas1r2 and tas1r3 with the force of hellfire , the thing that put I off most about pastry stout seem to be the drive force behind its popularity . I ’m not go to straight up say that I do n’t like pastry stout because of all the hype and attention they receive , because I myself be guilty of buy into beer and brand that receive hype and attention and actually enjoy they every once in a while , but it ’s probably because one of the thing I value most about beer be that it ’s proletariat and ubiquitous in nature ; if I like a beer , I want to be able to reach out into my fridge and grab another one , or run to the store and buy another without feel like I could have do well thing with my money — the reason why I value mouthfeel so much in a beer be because I personally believe that correlate most strongly into how repeatable a beer be no matter how flavorful or unique tasting a brew should be , I normally wo n’t want to try another unless there ’s some sense of balance or leveling factor that clear my palate for the next sip .   give my totally make - up standard and personal value state above , pastry stout could n’t stand any far from brew that I would normally be willing to pay an amount of money or stand in line for . I ’m pretty sure this comment will come back to bite I in the ass when I find myself stand in line for BA Double Stack next month , but I digress .   some ( actual ) preliminary thought about this beer . apparently german Chocolate Cake do n’t really come from Germany , and despite its name , its main highlight be whip cream and the coconut - pecan frosting that ’s use to fill the cake . on a more relevant note , this beer be well sum up by contrast it to the beloved Street Fighter zero character Hibiki Dan .   so for those of you that be n’t millennial or be live under a rock when Street Fighter , Dan ’s character be create as a parody of SNK ’s King of Fighters franchise character Ryo and Robert , who very suspiciously resemble Street Fighter ’s two most recognizable character , Ryu and Ken . outside of have twist mannerism and catchphrases suspiciously resemble the two SNK character that be rip off capcom character that he be rip off , Dan be kind of memorable for be all show and no power whatsoever ; his super / ex combo finish , Shinkū Gadōken , for example , look awfully similar to ryū ’ Shinkū Hadōken while do 1/40th of the damage it do — many - a - time have I sit in front of the tv screen , think " oh shit I ’m fuck " when I see the screen suddenly turn red , orange , and yellow while CPU Dan catch I off guard with my HP at 30 % , only to realize my character be still alive after be hit by ostentatious super combo .   labor metaphor aside , baigcc be similar to Dan ’s super finish in that it pack all the flavor it purport to deliver in one ginormous , sugar - spice - and - everything - nice upside your head , but then present a rapidly dry finish , which make you feel stupid for cringe and brace for impact — it ’ hard to explain in close detail , but it ’s like the opposite of get a penicillin shot at the doctor ’s , where you do n’t feel the needle go in , but it feel like somebody inject the meaty part of your butt cheek with peanut butter for the rest of the day . ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ a vacuum wave motion fist of toasted coconut , wild sugar cane , rum cake , baker ’s chocolate , intense caramelize sugar hit you square in the noggin , follow by a frost - like sweetness . there ’s a slight hint of hazelnut that follow the gargantuan sweet super attack before all the flavor just simply drop off the side of the earth . save for some residual flavor of hazelnut and powdered sugar , your pixelated character brush off the blow as if nothing happen and get up ready to fight again — the fight against the glass be one of attrition after that initial " surprise " ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ ⠀ the mouthfeel be initially thick and sticky like raw cake batter , but it morph into a more tolerable moist - ish soft texture with subsequent sip . the only way carbonation could make any impact on this beer be if it be effervescent to the level of a brut champagne ; the intense brick wall of mouthfeel counteract against any fleeting semblance of carbon dioxide on the tongue .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: dark black with a pretty thin tan head . Smell be pure vanilla and coconut . taste be out of this world , one of the good thing I 've ever taste , period . coconut up front , smooth out into pure chocolate flavor that really do taste like german chocolate cake . the only knock I 'll give it be that the barrel do n't come through a ton in the flavor , but it be hard to call that a negative when it taste this good . pretty sweet , but not painfully so . smooth feel , maybe I 'd like it a little bit thick , but again - this be just quibble and it be hard to really knock this at all . fantastic .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: 2018 vintage . release about a year ago .   a : pour jet black with a thick cap of dark brown , espresso - like head . recede quickly to a sharp ring . a few dot of lacing .   s : dark cocoa , toast coconut , oak , vanilla bean ice cream , and bourbon , with light roast and anise round thing out . very well balanced between the various aroma .   t : rich liquid chocolate , moderate roast , toast coconut , oak , bourbon , cola , and vanilla bean . moderately sweet , like the base , but balance more than the base with the bourbon and roast .   m : Thick , chewy , and full bodied with medium carbonation .   o : Exceptional BA pastry stout . pretty sweet , as expect , but the sweetness be balance with the other element , all of which you can pick out individually .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: thank to Heisenbrew for this 750ML bottle , which I be take solo tonight . if you do n’t hear from I by Sunday night , please send someone out to check my dead body ’s blood sugar level .   ever go blind ? that ’s how dark the beer be , with nearly no visible carbonation . the nose be barrel aged brownie whip up with bitter cocoa . I ’d eat that .   imperial German Chocolate Cupcake – Barrel Aged be easily my favorite beer from Tampa Beer Week 2018 , & the bottle do n’t quite live up to my glow memory . it be , of course , sweet enough that my vulnerability to type 2 diabetes just tick upwards 5 % . straight corn syrup mix with cane sugar & supremely bitter chocolate to form the base : the chocolate actually take a half hour to warm before the nasty edge wear off the bitter cocoa . below the sweet upper crust be a healthy helping of bourbon , milky chocolate , long pull of vanilla , & cake batter . I do n’t believe I type that . thick , full , coma - induce . pretty sure I ’m not go to have any trouble finish this off by myself . that say , I ’m get full .   not as mid - blow as fresh off the tap , but still an excellent beer … if you have a high tolerance for all thing sugar .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: exactly what you want a german chocolate cake stout to taste like . coconut and chocolate throughout with great body and aroma . maybe a little on the sweet side , but we be split hair at that point

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: I 've nearly manage to try Barrel Aged imperial German Chocolate Cupcake stout on two or three occasion now - this time , it do not elude I ! I also have the pleasure of try this side by side with the non - barrel - aged bottle - and while this experience certainly hurt my tooth a bit , it be a pretty great time to be alive !   I 've have my fair share of sweet , sticky , dessert beverage , but there be just something about Angry Chair 's dessert stout that surpass everyone else 's attempt - the beer be practically simple syrup in consistency and taste , but then they be also quite high in ABV , and do n't taste it for a second . BAIGCCS be like a bucket of fudgy chocolate cake batter goodness - it coat your glass and it be absolutely opaque . the carb be so minimal that it be like drink a light viscosity glass of motor oil . a delicious one , obviously . the nose be rich and warm , and that chocolate be just excellent on the nose and in the taste bud .   I really like this beer - but as I tell my friend , I think this will be the only time I 'll ever drink it , and I be honestly pretty okay with that . it be just too much - there be no moderation to this beer . it be a bottle that you essentially need to share , because the flavor and syrupyness of the beer be just unrelenting .   in all , like many of Angry Chair 's beer , it be a tremendously compelling novelty - I really enjoy , and would certainly recommend it ... but I can happily live without it ever again . Yum and do , basically .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: pour pitch black with little to no head . nose it ’s baker chocolate , sweet coconut , get some barrel heat , grain alcohol . taste follow the nose , rich milk chocolate , coconut , get a little oak / bourbon note . Mouthfeel be velvety smooth . overall , delicious stout . as I ’ve state on several of my BA AC review , the only knock this beer be there be not a big barrel presence here . otherwise , fantastic .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: pour from a 750ml bottle into an Angry Chair pint glass . thank Ryan for share this one .   Aromas be straight chocolate cake batter intermingle with some bourbon , cocoa , chocolate fudge , hershey ’s syrup .   on the tongue be rich chocolate fudge , sweet chocolate cake with a dark chocolate frosting . bourbon barrel add a vanilla - caramel flavor in the background , but the dominant flavor be straight fudge cake . full - bodied with a rich , thick mouthfeel that coat the tongue . low carbonation . this be most definitely a sipper .   this beer may be the king of pastry stout – it ’s literal liquid chocolate cake , as the name suggest .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: pastry stout delight ! pour very dark with a mocha head into a Torst glass . expect this to be more like motor oil but it be n’t . Aromas of fudge and subtle coconut release from the glass . smell like dessert ! flavor be insane . pretty sweet with fudge brownie , coconut and subtle Barrel / oak . amazing flavor here . like I ’m sip on brownie batter . feel be viscous and mouth coating . pretty sticky . overall , this be a treat . Dessert in every way !

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: pour from a bottle . motor oil look and pour . coconut fat float on top . Smell be coconut , chocolate , vanilla , barrel , amazing . taste be all of that , plus add that perfect thick and chewy mouthfeel , you get the perfect beer .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: great beer , but I have to say for the value and what I give up to get this I would rather go for the non ba version . great beer , where I think the bourbon barrel actually do not add a lot cause there be so many adjunct . definitely a chocolate bomb . get point because of Angry Chair 's dark lacing and overall turbid , oily , thickness that make it a unique beer .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: batch 1 bottle , so thick , so sweet . smell exactly like german cake , great smell . pour nice and thick . great dark look . taste be one of the good . angry chair barrel aged stout be fantastic .

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: batch 1 drink on 3/24/2018 split 4 way into a snifter   Look - pitch black , low carb but still a little , thick but not massive lacing , still a lot there Smell - sweet chocolate galore , my oh my . this really be a chocolate bomb that smell like a chocolate cupcake . plenty of vanilla and barrel come through , but definitely play second fiddle to the chocolate . the coconut be subtle but open up more as it warm . really incredible . taste - follow the nose , however , I do get some caramel in the taste too . a really nice addition with everything else go on . feel - pretty heavy thickness , no booze , finish be exceptional . really coat the mouth and linger in a terrific way overall - the hype be real . this be not overrate and this will age impeccably . I have a small sample a year ago and think its improved a ton . I think this may not peak for another 2 year to be honest . incredible beer and could keep get well . wow

product_name: Barrel Aged Imperial German Chocolate Cupcake Stout
product_review: Hell of a beer ! would I pay the crazy secondary price ? no . very thankful a family member stand in line and get a bottle . the only detractor with this beer be a soy sauce aroma after initial pour . thankfully it be n't present in the taste . that be very much german Chocolate .

appearance - the beer be bright yellow in color with a bubbly white head that leave generous lacing .   Smell - the nose be a bouquet of fresh lemon surround by dankness .   taste - Initially , fresh but dry lemon lead the profile . there be just a touch of sweetness like the East Coast style , but it be not liquid candy . the dankness really come through in the finish .   Mouthfeel - the body be nicely thick with an almost gritty body . carbonation somehow survive the viscosity .   overall - this be a great IPA , but I have have well .
the good of the Hill Farmstead ipa in my opinion . smooth and bitter and the same time and a very delicate balance . nose of citrus and color be like fruit juice .

canned 5/11/21 Consumed 6/2/21   it say to drink by 6/8/21 , so be this almost old ? ! either way , it ’s still fantastic . it look , smell , and feel world class . it ’ one of the well balanced ipa I ’ve have in a really long time . I would have guess this be a 6.5 % abv and not 8.2 % . I love the bitterness throughout . not West Coast style , but East Coast hazy like . I ’m so happy to try this guy and will drink my remain can before they ’re officially old !

I could n’t be more lucky than to have fantastic neighbor willing to share a can of Hill F Abner . this be my first and right off the bat its smooth . dare I say there ’s a creamy vanilla hint ? the aroma be the classic fruity NE ipa . be this really a dipa ? could not tell .

pour from a can . fail to capture the date but I believe from a fall / early winter release . as always , a delicious beer ... although this particular can be a bit murky relative to its peer . still , appearance do n't impact taste ... floral , citrus fruit , not juicy . one of my favorite beer .

a : proper hazy yellow with slight opaqueness   s : citrusy with a slight sweetness which be the only telling of the malt   t : juicy on the front of your tongue with slight stone fruit , while the hop bitterness shine through at the same time . perfect meld of old school and new age hop usage .   m : properly crisp and smooth , but like a lot of HF I get a phlegmy feel which keep the flavor and I love for beer like this   o : this be an exceptional beer that make I disappointed I have to drink other NE ipa that be not Hill Farmstead . I would gladly drink this daily . this actually get well when pair with food too .

pour from a can ( 08dec2020 ) into a Teku   l : pour an opaque not creamy dark yellow orange with a very thick and dense white head . slowly fade leave very chunky lacing , nice foam on top of the beer ~30 minute post pour   s : great fruit - forward note with piney hop bitterness to match . avoid be overly sweet despite the quite tropical aroma , mix of mango / peach / melon with that more west coast piney bitterness add some complexity   t : follow the nose well , with a mix of tropical flavor with a slightly piney / citrusy bitterness . get that mango / peach / melon flavor from the nose , fully and slightly sweet but far from cloy . that bitterness follow quickly and carry through the medium / long finish . it ’s just so easy to follow one sip with the next it ’s amazing - do n’t get old , feel heavy , get sweet   f : medium body , medium carbonation , smooth , very easy to drink   o : amazing DIPA , remind I of the wave of flavor and easy drinking nature of HT ( with less bitterness , of course )
2020 can pour into a snifter . wonderfully juicy aroma and flavor . soft enough mouthfeel . it be a great beer experience when hype and reality dance in harmony .

I tend to be the kind of person who end up underwhelme by the beer that end up on the top 250 list ... especially when they be ipa . but every once in a while , I try one that not only completely live up to the hype , but surpass it - Abner be one of those beer .   pour a cloudy , opaque , but bright orange color . three finger frothy white head slowly dissipate leave just a splotch of foam on top of the beer with a ring of white foam along the outside of the beer . Sparse white lacing coat the glass as the beer be consume .   the aroma on this be incredible . sweet and fruity without be too " juicy " . undertone of dry pine needle and grassy hop peep between note of orange , tangerine , peach and mango .   the taste follow the nose with note of sweet orange , grapefruit , mango , pineapple give way to a mild piney bitterness on the finish . there be a certain sweetness to it , but its very mild and balanced . the bitterness on the back end , kind of build on itself result in an overarch linger bitterness on the palate .   feel be pretty light for a dipa , very smooth with bright , vibrant carbonation .   overall an absolutely stellar dipa and worthy of its hype billing .

a beautiful hazy golden orange color , the head be nearly perfect - a pearl white color , really dense and foamy , it literally create a lace wall down the glass . never see anything like it .   the nose be dank tropical aroma , especially grapefruit , pineapple , mango - and also some pine . wow . I do n’t see that come .   the grapefruit be prominent on the taste , and it have a candy element that be absolutely magnificent . there ’s also pineapple , mango , and the aforementioned pine . perfectly balanced , with no hint whatsoever of the 8 % ABV , this be an example of a brewery confident in their prowess with hop .   the mouthfeel be really dry and substantial , as expect . what a treat this beer be . if you look in the " IPA Hall of Fame , " this beer be one of the original inductee , IMHO .

truly excited to finally get to try this legend !   pour from 16 oz can into stemless tulip . straw colored , slightly transparent haze . slight dank bitterness with undertone of stone / tropical fruit on the nose . taste / mouthfeel be soft on the front of the palate - go down with just a bit of a bite of bitterness . somewhat juicy .   overall - this one do n't disappoint ! the softness / juiciness back by the slight bitterness be the perfect marriage of east coast / west coast style .

l : straw w/ a little bit of burn amber in hang around   s : Grapefruit , pineapple and a little bit wet fire wood   t : Orange / Grapefruit pith . assertive bitterness but not overpower   f : chewy up front but finish really dry ; my favorite part of this beer .   o : a beautiful beer with layer of complexity . with that , and call I crazy , I prefer Nelson Pale

pour like most cloudy ipa but it be n’t murky at all , which be nice . have a linger opaque head , no lacing but that could be the pour since this beer usually have some nice lacing . Smell be fruit , mainly citrus lemon and orange to I . taste follow same , sweeter citrus tangerine , Clementine , sweeter orange ( cara cara , if you have n’t try one do it you ’ll thank I . ) it finish with a grapefruit bite . what separate this beer from other hazy beer be that it be not thick and cloying or heavy at all . it finish pretty dry too and have a soft bitterness that be very pleasant and go well with it . Glad I get to drink this guy once a year , always an enjoyable experience .

can 4 day ago and pour into a pint glass ( only " beer " glass available at time of pour ) . pour a glowing , hazy orange / yellow . modest head that leave behind some nice , thin lacing . Aroma come off the beer in wave of tropical , hoppy goodness . taste be a nice combination of citrus & tropical note , but with just the right balance of hop and a tiny bit of bite . medium carbonation and a medium to medium full mouth feel . overall , while I be not a huge IPA fan in general , I have to admit this be a great beer .
taste from can . pour a hazy gold . huge citrus and fruity aroma . taste be a ton of citrus but not a juice bomb . you get some bitterness but not overly bitter . just a perfect balanced hazy ipa .

shade of lemon and gold cap by a solid two finger of eggshell white head that settle nicely leave cave pattern drawing in its wake . aroma of honeysuckle , pine , apricot flesh , pineapple , light malt , and lemon z . taste follow with piney note up front , pineapple juice in the middle , a bit of orange peel on the back , as well as the slight hint of peach . for the amount of hop use in this beer , they be integrate seamlessly . it coat the palate ; soft up front , creamy in the middle , and finish somewhat dry . I could drink this one all day long . Superb .
quarantine bonus ! Armsby Abbey in Worcester sell growler to go of this legend . pour hazy dark orange . creamy mouthfeel . Pine hit I first then subtle citrus . fantastic dry DIPA .

12 oz draft pour at Churchkey in DC   hop : centennial , Chinook , Columbus , Simcoe , Warrior   well here it be . a legend of Vermont craft beer . a relic . I love Edward , and this seem to be the double IPA version of that beer . I consider it part of the first wave of NE style ipa , along with Double Sunshine and Heady Topper . hugely influential . a little dark than most make these day and look at those old school " c " hop ! this would have blow my mind in 2012 , but now it be merely a great beer of many around these day . I prefer HF 's new offering , to be perfectly honest . but I be a lucky son of a bitch to have try this .

opaquely hazy yellow - orange with a fluffy , lumpy white head that display good retention and cling in ridge .   the medium full body have a firm carbonation that bring a not unwelcome but decidedly strong than usual bitterness of citrus rind , also accompany by some mild booze . in a way it be still well balanced , particularly by some herbal dankness and a little white pepper , but still , this be the most syrupy , woody and resiny IPA I 've have by Hill . just before the semi - dry finish , some mango , Cuties and pear characteristic surface .   it be solid , to be sure , but not even close to my favorite Hill IPA . that this be the high Hill beer on the Top 250 be beyond I .

pour into a pint glass from a growler fill the same day ( Aug 10 ) . opaque and deep . medium - bodied for an NEIPA and pungent in a piney / musky sort of way . taste like the apotheosis of the style . this be special .

excite to try this . expectation high give its reputation . on tap at BeerShop , NYC . pour a hazy orange color with a thumbnail length frothy head . it be juicy looking and inviting . a medley of tropical , citrus and stone fruit open the aroma . in addition , there be a touch of dank and herbal aroma evoke resin , floral sweetness and a touch of onion . the malt aroma be bready with a hint of honey and caramel sweetness . juicy flavor all the way redolent of all kind of fruit . note of pineapple , grapefruit rind , orange peel , tangerine , peach pit , and mango . there be a develop bitterness that add balance , along with herbal and spicy hop flavor . note of floral hop , pine , grass , onion . there be a mild and clean alcohol spice at time . the malt profile , although mostly secondary to the hop dominance , nevertheless have note of biscuit and honey . medium bodied , moderately crisp and a carbonation that be on par . a dry and resiny finish yield a linger bitterness . it be a delicious pleasure drink this one . it be like a hop explosion in the mouth that represent a bouquet of complex flavor . one of the good .

drink this in a dark bar so hard to get a good read on the appearance . Faint ( very faint ) note of grass / earth and citrus rind on the nose , would expect more aroma from a HF IPA   taste be somewhat mute , a little grapefruit bitterness , a little pine and not much else . not as juicy or expressive as society and solitude offering   feel be effervescent and light , good carb , do n’t coat the mouth despite its abv   overall — good , and glad I try this but prefer other HF hoppy offering

l : beautiful deep cloudy orange with 1 inch of frothy white head . pour into a tulip glass from a growler , fill @hf the day before .   s : tropical fruit , but very ripe tropical fruit .
