Vanilla , toffee , caramel . this be barley wine vs stout vs bourbon . warm , smooth , boozey all in one . I do n’t know how it ’ possible . dark dry fruit , molasse , and wet oak . just wow . this be unlike any other deal with a devil .

product_name: A Deal With The Devil - Double Oak-Aged
product_review: do this , 2020 vintage , and the original back to back , because quarantine . dark clear brown , no head . smell strongly of bourbon , wood , toffee , raisin , brown sugar , barley , coconut , vanilla and caramel . taste be so deep , really get the barrel character in a rich way , with booze , flavoring and wood all dynamic , with rich toffee / caramel , molasse , and everything from the smell , especially dark fruit . feel be smooth , very warm , rich , sneaky thick , and full . like the original but with more barrel and dark , barley more present too . good american barleywine I have had the wife love it

product_name: A Deal With The Devil - Double Oak-Aged
product_review: the big man bring out all the barrel aged version back in October . cheer !   from a 37,5cl bottle into a taste glass .   37 degree Plato IBU 60 Galaxy hop   appearance : pour a one finger , medium - thick looking , light tan head with great retention . dark maroon red or brown body with no carbonation evident . Head slowly fade to a ring leave some dot of lace down the glass . beauty , just like every variant .   smell : this one be quite woody , with caramel and toffee aroma , butterscotch , some milk chocolate and coconut , and a good dose of oak as well . mute red fruit underneath . Boozy and woody , same as the Redford 15 month .   TASTE : lot of cognac , coconut and milk chocolate up front . big finish of cognac , coconut and milk chocolate , as well as some heavy toffee and butterscotch sweetness . some decent oak and alcohol linger as well , though not quite as wood forward as the nose have suggest . hint of red fruit in there as well .   palate : very full body with medium level of carbonation . creamy on the palate , go down silky smooth and finish sticky . a good amount of heat linger . excellent feel for the style , much like all the variant , but this one be even full than the rest .   overall : Super enjoyable , though this one be also a touch wood - heavy on the nose , though not as much as the Woodford 15 month . I might be nit - pick , but when it ’ this good , you can still separate the awesome from the other - worldly . thank again , man !

product_name: A Deal With The Devil - Double Oak-Aged

product_review: pour a thick , gooey brown and smell of fig , dark fruit , and caramel . this be the good tasting barleywine I have ever have . rich , thick , oily , all of the dark fruit and smooth bourbon finish . wow just wow ! !

product_name: A Deal With The Devil - Double Oak-Aged
product_review: on tap at the recent HOTD fredf event .   the beer pour a somewhat murky orange chocolate brown color with good head retention and lacing . on the nose , it be apparent this have see some pretty serious barrel aging , as I pick up considerable vanilla , caramel , light bourbon , molasse and light coffee . the flavor profile replicate the nose pretty closely in this sweet , rich beer , and I appreciate how well integrate the alcohol be in this beer . you can definitely tell the abv . be up there , but I would never have guess 17 % . the sweetness wear on your after a bit , so a little bit go a long way , but this be otherwise a very impressive BA barleywine from Anchorage brewing . Mouthfeel be very full , soft and long on the palate .   excellent beer for sure , and one that remind I very much of the Fremont Brew 1000 from a couple year back . not as much bourbon as the B1000 I suppose , but pretty similar otherwise . definitely a treat to see this fine beer at Fredfest this year .

product_name: A Deal With The Devil - Double Oak-Aged
product_review: I will say this be probably the good barley wine I taste . it pour a dark murky brown - almost like prune juice ( but not in a bad way ! ) . very little head , probably due to high alcohol content . the smell be just delicious - pick up note of heavy dark fruit soak in bourbon with oak , toffee , and vanilla . More than what word can describe . the taste be just outstanding - again ton of bourbon soak dark fruit . very sweet with note of toffee and vanilla that become more prominent at room temperature . the bourbon be up front from start to finish with a nice spiciness . there be just a subtle hop bite but its pretty much a desert in the glass . no alcohol warmth despite its ultra high ABV content . very full - bodied , sticky , and rich . overall : seek this out , it will not disappoint ! because of its high alcohol content , I be glad to share with a friend .

product_name: A Deal With The Devil - Double Oak-Aged
product_review: 375ml bottle , from the 2017 release . serve in a snifter glass . pour an ugly as shit murky brown body , one finger white head , short retention , no lacing . this be a damn ugly beer , even for barleywine . Smell be transcendent ; huge caramel , toffee , bourbon note , distinct sweet brandy / cognac note , with trace of spicy fruit on the backend . this be as metal / barleywine as it get . flavour follow , thick syrupy caramel , mild earthy bitterness that do just enough to balance it out and prevent this beer from be too sweet or cloying . no alcohol heat , plenty of oak and whiskey flavour , toffee , touch of resin and spice . wonderful . Mouthfeel be full bodied , not cloy or syrupy , incredibly substantial , lot of complexity throughout , with a sweet nutty toffee finish . overall , a damn delicious barleywine . I like this well than the single cognac release that signify the first 3 release .

product_name: A Deal With The Devil - Double Oak-Aged
product_review: not at all for the faint of heart , this massive barleywine of ale be a testament to what ale can be and not of what anyone prescribe what it should be . high succulent charm the sense with slow - sipping reward , patience be reward while bask in the indulgence of what be good about cognac , bourbon and oak .   Double oake A Deal with the Devil pour with a highly viscous weight while gloss the glass with such brandy legging and sugary weight . tawny mahogany in color , the beer 's appearance give way to breath take aroma of brown sugar , toffee , molasse , chocolate , wine and a cognac and sherry glaze boozy spice . the combination of bourbon and cognac carry the full force of blackstrap molasse , sorghum , brown sugar and the unexplainable savory taste of extend aged sherry .   the beer explode on the middle palate as the booze - soaken fruit of fig , date , raisin , red grape , plum , blackberry and prune all represent the macerated character of the most savory fruit tar to exist . oxidation note nearly extend past port and sherry and into the world of teriyaki and soy sauce with a kiss of fudge . playfully tangy , the sweet and heat of the late palate , balance with a lavish malty rich taste and a spicy , sassy finish .   full , chewy and pleasantly cloying , the most supple of sip quickly reach across the palate and saturate the tastebud completely with the sweetness of butter rum , butter pecan and an elegant richness that satisfy the sweet tooth and the need for all - thing - savory all at once . its forever long finish close with an afterglow of seared sweetness , fortified wine and lavish malt richness .

2020 release . bottle a couple week ago .   a : pour black with a razor thin ring of head . look kinda flat . no lacing .   s : Toasted coconut , vanilla bean , maple and brown sugar sweetness , cocoa , butterscotch , and a bit of coffee , bourbon , and roast , and dust .   t : a blast of coconut , which dominate the palate . support by moderate coffee , light roast , vanilla , maple , butterscotch , and brown sugar . moderate sweetness .   m : Thick , mouthcoating , sticky full body . very light carbonation , border on flat , which make it sort of syrupy . alcohol very well hidden .   o : Solid , tasty BA adjunct stout . barrel treatment be light . need more carb .

Shoo bee doo bee doo , life be bite a dream sweetheart ! have to admit ... I’m a homer fanboi for so many of John Wakefield ’s stout , but this be one of the OG pastry stout , and it be simply phenomenal .
really good stout.they actually fill barrel with maple syrup and clean they out to brew this beer . it ’s really good and off the cellar menu at the brewery .
a smooth soft maple backbone with a splash of coconut , with coffee and vanilla to follow . very drinkable , my only complaint be the maple over power the bourbon barrel .

pour into a snifter . a motor oil viscous opaque dark brown color with a small tan head that stick around for a while . the taste and aroma be as bill with a big coffee presence , maple , chocolate , and faint bourbon . oily black with a surprisingly persistent creamy but thin mocha blanket .   Maple brulee and mocha roast be accent by sweet dark fruit and a little waxy oak via a crackly medium - light body that finish semi - sticky with a mild heat .   I be n't floor by this one , especially consider the hype behind it , but I have a few other beer this night that kind of trounce IWAAD . the complexity be lack , and so too be the pastry decadence -- I figure there 'd at least be an explosion of one or the other . I guess on one hand you can say , then , " it be balanced , " but it be n't quite there either . pretty sweet with some heat , and a mostly mild maple character , I be surprised there be so little coconut -- I get a couple of pour to be sure .
very dark appearance with slight tan head that dissipate quickly . Aroma be a very pleasant maple and bourbon . taste be a nice slightly sweet blend of maple and bourbon .

almost to good , the flavor be all there and none of those be really overpower the other . but the presence of all those wonderful flavor push the stout into the back just a little to much . I be just nag though , I feel really privileged for be able to enjoy this beer .

incredibly sweet , a straight up dessert beer for sure . it have delicious , intense coconut dominate the overall flavor profile . Mouthfeel be excellent , no complain at all . only good in small quantity though , due to the cloy sweetness .

07/2017 - this be banana - I love all the element of this ale , such as the nose and palate be chock full of maple , coconut , and coffee without be overwhelming . supremely excellent mouthfeel that go on and on . but my favorite part be you ca n't detect the 17 % . Superb !

have have b1 and b2 and consensus for both : absolutely amazing aroma and adjunct presence ... but extremely sweet , a bit insubstantial both in mouthfeel and barrel presence . a whale worth taste but with room for improvement .

Phenomenal !

750 ml " champagne " bottle , now available in Norway ( Vinmonopolet ) . ABV be 6 % . bottle date : 14 - 02 - 2007 , the " well before " date also read 02 - 2007 , which obviously must be a misprint . hazy golden colour , big white head . lovely aroma of lemon and other sour fruit , with strong note of farmhouse and horse stable . the flavour be very sour and tart , with lemony note and a dry and astringent finish with noticeable hop .

lightly foggy burn orange to amber , nearly glowing , with a tall off - white foam head settle to unevenly airy , bubbly lump that be somewhat translucent , translate more to a khaki hue , leave tiny spot of lace on the glass .   Smell be both more oaky and peppery than regularly OG , a little dusty even , but also bright and spicy , in a pleasant , sense - awakening way . add to the allure be hint of dry , gooey apricot , fresh fig and white grape .   the medium body 's lively effervescence perk up the palate , again with surprisingly bright , zippy characteristic . it be super refreshing and also very pleasantly balanced on the palate , quaffable to a frightening degree , particularly for a bottle so hard to find .   it be like a mimosa with white grape juice instead of orange , while very fine white oak add complementary complexity without any undesirable feature , and barely a touch of funk . again here it be more peppery , yet not as toasty as regular OG , but it simultaneously give a feel like you can crunch down on it before the frothy light carbonation die into a perfectly clean , semi - dry swallow . it consistently remind I of nelson , my favorite hop .   absolutely scrumptious , with an unbelievable mouthfeel .

side - by - side at Lambik O Droom . all of they have that signature green apple and barnyard funk but I be gon na focus more on what distinguish they from each other / from typical bottle of Oude Geuze . 2003 OGV : orange - gold color , full and thick body , plenty of carb , old and musty , huge brett pineapple , shellfish note , super unique and absolutely delicious : 4.9 2004 OGV Magnum : bright and well - balanced . apparently the bottle have a lot of off flavor originally and they be think they would have to dump these bottle . they hold onto they , and I be so glad they do . totally turn the corner : 4.8 2008 OGV : ton of funk yet relatively mellow compare to the rest , smooth and absurdly balance : 4.9 2010 OGV : super balanced but the least interesting of the five : 4.75 2012 OGV : Paint and drywall , smell and taste like a new townhome , incredibly cheesy . in - your - face flavor : 4.8

the regular Drie Fonteinen Oude Geuze be rock solid . this be definitely a notch above when try they side by side .   2012 375 ml bottle .   everything be heighten with this vs the regular Oude Geuze . brighter smell and flavor . Awesome Geuze .

a 2010 vintage generously share with I after quite literally year of anticipate this bottle together . its incredible stuff , worth the wait , and as good as anything I have have from these guy really , every bit as good as the lou kriek or the fou . deep dusty brick red in color , dense with fruit here , not as electric and bright look as a lot of raspberry beer , and with a fizzy lazy head , not super robust there . the nose be mind melt for I , pure raspberry and insanely mature lambic funk and tartness , turbid wheaty age hop base , ton of oak and brett , a well developed wild acidity as well , this be rather piquant , and then of course all the berry , as natural as it get and like stuff an entire handful of they in my face , as intense as can be . I smell it for awhile before I taste it , so complex and mouthwatering and inviting . great sourness up front in the flavor highlight the fruit right from the start , with the sturdy wood and mature wildness right there with it , tart and red winey towards the finish , a little sweet from the fruit , still malty in a lambic sense , and really brightly acidic and interesting . the complexity of the yeast element here be as good as it get , and why cantillon be so well regard as far as I be concerned . the raspberry be perfect with it , and really bold in this beer . the maturity be unrivaled and the flavor be just incredible . beautiful lambic , famous for a reason , and probably even more striking to I now in term of quality because there be so many lackluster fruit sour out there in the world . this be the cream !

2021 vintage   appearance : slightly cloudy amber - yellow color with a fairly generous generous - sized thick , foamy white head that slowly fade . a nice look IIPA for my taste . Mouth - feel : on the light side of medium - bodied with a generous level of carbonation . the mouthfeel be spot on for an IIPA .   overall : a great iipa . a very good hop flavor profile with enough of a malt backbone to produce a good flavor profile . can on 3/22 , fresh I 've have by some margin ! l : Eschews classic West Coast IPA visual with a slightly more opaque and deep color than other classic of the style . beautiful lacing on glass after some sip , yet head dissipate rather quickly . this have little bearing on the beer overall personally , a minor complaint . s : lovely nose of tropical note . smell of fruit and citrus , not an overpoweringly strong scent yet clearly express the flavor profile to expect . t : Citrus and fruit flavor explode here . measure bitterness remind that this be a West Coast IPA , yet have a juiciness that have come to be associate with neipa nowadays . hoppy and fruity , taste follow suit on the nose and then some . F : perfectly measure medium body , finish on the dry side yet the tropical fruit and citrus note linger for some time . o : my third experience with Citra , I think I can conclude that this be my favorite West Coast IPA of they all . the juicier and sweeter characteristic of it as oppose to other notable example of the style put it over the edge as a truly original and exciting beer . Drank fresh , it be an absolute revelation in a time where the IPA market be oversaturate and often difficult to get excited about . seek it out !

huge thank to Ryan for this can !   Pint can - can in mid - November - pour into an Spiegelau IPA glass at 42 ° F .   pour a very attractive golden amber - honey hue - just a touch foggy , with a creamy , dense , two - finger eggshell white head with remarkable retention , leave a thick sticky collar as it recede .   Nose : right there . it smell exactly like a heavily Citra - hop West Coast double IPA . the malt base be surprisingly pale , with a lovely lightly toasty grain profile , with some sweet , bready crystal malt note . Citra note just explode with ripe tangerine , grapefruit , drippy pear , meyer lemon , candy pineapple , mango juice , fresh grass , pine sap , and actual fruit . like that fruit skin smell you get in the produce aisle . it smell like produce aisle . so fresh and bright .   palate : I try to be objective as possible , but sometimes , you take that first sip , and a beer just rock your world . this be that , for I . the beer greet the palate with this simultaneous punch of perfect malt sweetness , grainy pale malt , mineral water zing , and a big explosion of Citra hop . Lemon z , grapefruit pulp , Satsuma mandarin and tangerine , and even some key lime z . there be some wisps of pineapple , mango , and passionfruit , but , it be n't thw tropical cocktail that the nose be . this be a bowl of citrus . there be this raw , green , leafy hop character that I usually only find in Nelson , and that obliterate the malty backbone , reduce it to pale grain . some resinous Ponderosa pine sap , pithy grapefruit , and leafy green hop set a dry , resinous , moderately bitter tone to the finish which linger for age , eventually come across as pure hop cone .   Mouthfeel / body : the beer be medium - full in body . it have a sturdy backbone , but it do n't overtake the beer , and it remain fully drinkable , and even quite crisp . you could drink this on a hot summer day and not feel like you be choke back a big beer . very minimal malt stickiness , and a nice oily resinous hop cle that just adhere to the palate . effervescence be so beautifully lively and zippy . fully dry finish .   overall : I hate that I be do this , but this ia a 4.5 across the board . I almost never review a beer that get the same score for every category , but I ca n't honestly rate this any other way . this be a truly unique and incredible West Coast DIPA . it be saturate with intense citrus on the nose , with a huge punch of Citra flavour balance by a perfect malt base , beautiful minerality , the prime level of bitterness , and it be refreshing ? come on , what more can you want from this ? what a gem . it be beer like this that make I excited about ipa . seek this out .

l : a darker filter orange with an sizable ivory head settle down to a wisp and a wide band that climb the glass and leave a couple narrow partial band of lace .   s : Malt Bomb , medicinal pine , and citrus syrup .   t : follow the nose , there ’ an unexpected clove note in there too . pretty strong . bitter and resinous like the West coast double of old .   f : heavier weight , malty and sticky and a good stomach full . right carbonation . off - dry with a dry and bitter finish .   o : if you like’em malty this be well do . overall I personally would not put it at number five however . a bit of hype .

this be a great , old - school West Coast IPA with a strong malt backbone and a solid use of Citra hop . this be a game changer back in the day and still deserve its due respect .

refrigerate can to glass . no canning date , but believe it to be about a month old . Tan almost orange . little cloudy . minimal off white head . nice lacing . Citrus and pine on the nose . taste start out sweet and citrusy , but then end bitter with astringency . soapy aftertaste and burp . slight booze presence . I think Pliny have make I spoiled .

Citra pour a beautiful amber orange with a soapy and loose , 2 - finger , light yellow head that deposit some minimal lacing . the smell be resiny and dank with citrus fruit , a hint of floral and a slight malt sweetness . the taste be initially smooth and sweet over the palette with a dank , hop bitterness from the Citra , give off flavor of grapefruit , pineapple and a hint of z . truly an outstanding dipa , comparable , maybe well than Pliny the elder for I . take nearly 2 year to finally find a can up my way in NoCal and this be an impressive beer !

from a can with a couple week on it into snifter . pour copper in color . somewhat muddy ?   Piney . resinous . extremely hoppy but not well balanced with a malty backbone . little alcohol burn but not overly flavorful . astringent . remind I of the classic , overly hoppy west coast hop bomb but not as good .   I do n’t know . still really like a classic west coast IPA but this one just do n’t do much for I . Glad I be finally able to try it even if it be ultimately disappointing .

pour a semi clear amber with fine head .   Smell be piney with note of resin , grapefruit an grapefruit rind .   taste be piney and citrus with a strong , resiny bitterness . there be a medicinal hint that hamper it somewhat and make it a little bit astringent .   Mouthfeel be medium , well carbonate .   overall , a very nice west coast DIPA , shame about the medicinal thing .

bottled 11/2/16 ; drink 12/5/16 @ the Palace .   semi - opaque dull orange appearance .   a rough pour yield a huge off - white head ; frothy lace .   sweet orange citrus , grapefruit & cane sugar note in the nose .   Medium mouthfeel .   Orange citrus & cane sugar flavor up front ; mild grapefruit bite on the finish . no booze heat .   a little too sweet , but overall an excellent DIPA !
02/2015 - Pineapple and mango fosho with mild pine , dank aroma ; fruity , juicy , nice hoppy tang , tropical fruit on the palate ; sweet , wee bitter , clean finish though .

golden , slightly hazy with no visible cardio and a finger of white head .   smell of pineapple , citrus and a hint of pine . a Caramel malty backbone follow .   taste of perfection in balance . fruity and floral almost like a rose , lily of the valley . Caramel sweetness with a hint of bitterness like grapefruit pith .   medium body with a little spritzy carbonation . cover the abv .   have on tap at Liquid Gold , San Francisco , Dec 30th , 2018 . amazing brew . the feel be powdery and amazing , the taste so soft yet define so that it finish quickly on the palate , leave you crave the next sip .
Awesome ! golden with white head . it glow . awesome citra smell and super choppy taste . rival the alchemist . get a bit bitter as I make my way through the glass . 16 oz draft .

surprise by the haze , it be a nearly fully opaque orange - amber with a light gold around the bottom edge , top with a large khaki foam that slowly settle to a thin film with a bubbly cling collar .   Smell actually start garlicky and biscuity , with some sharp yeast , orange z and rind , lemon and pine .   taste be tangy and almost spicy with a mix of allium and citru , back by a sting of pine and a biscuity rug with a Triple Sec finish .   this be definitely more old school , malty , bitter and pungent than the new haze class , but be also very citrusy and enjoyable . body be moderately light with a bubbly light carbonation and a dry , prickly swallow .

on - draught at Verdugo Bar , Los Angeles . I 've wait a long time to try this one .   30cl for $ 8 usd . 8 % ABV . Imperial IPA .   pour a glow orange body of average vibrance . no yeast or lee be visible . Head be white , coating , and thick . head retention be good for the high ABV - ~8 minute . leave scatter lace on the side of the glass as the head recede .   aroma : orange creamsicle , fresh orange peel , fragrant citrus , a blip of rind , tangerine . have concomitant bitterness but it be nevertheless well balanced . suggest an imperial IPA with a well - disguise ABV , plenty of hop pungency , and good depth of flavour .   aromatic intensity be average . I be eager to try it . very fresh and vivid .   TASTE : undertone of orange creamsicle and candy citrus peel ( orange , tangerine , maybe even mango ) underscore this fresh citrusy brew . Juicy but adequately bitter , with pale malt keep the hop in check , result in an impressively well balanced beer .   good depth of flavour . above average flavour duration and intensity .   I would n't say it be complex , but there be some intricate layering of citrusy flavour that amount to a beer with a nice diversity of citrusy flavour . exceed the sum of its part , but it be far from the most busy imperial IPA out there .   Nitpicking , it could be more vivid , fresh , and/or juicy , but it be very well - balanced as be .   mouthfeel : creamy , soft , medium to full - bodied , smooth , wet . not oily , hot , boozy , astringent , harsh , rough , or scratchy . well - carbonate .   overall : ludicrously drinkable for an 8 % imperial IPA . its balance really set it apart . I can see why it be regard as one of the very good in the style , and it showcase its hop selection extremely well . up there with Alpine - brew Alpine beer in my estimation , and very well execute , but I 'd balk at the idea of wait in line for it .   one of the good expression of the style I 've try to date , but I can imagine it well . if orange creamsicle iipa be your bag but you want more bitterness and hop pungency than the hazy IPA fad offer without the yogurty tang of a Hill Farmstead expression of the style , this be the beer for you .   really damn tasty .   B+ ( 3.84 ) / very good

have on tap at KRBC . unremarkable head at beginning ... but stunning rich amber honey color ... and outstanding lacing . full hop aroma and a citrus bomb for flavor . so clean and drinkable . Reamarkabke easy for an 8 % DIPA . definitely build in the malt perfectly . Yep ... live up to the hype .

have on draft in a pint glass . dark amber color with a slight haze and one finger head . smell of burn caramel and toast orange rind . totally full bodied with creamy carbonation texture . flavor of roasted pineapple , peach with toasted orange rind bitterness . long last fruit sweetness and bitterness .

l : pour a beautiful golden color . 2 finger of foamy head with good retention .   s : wonderful aroma of tropical fragrance , floral aroma , and just enough pine to let you know this be a West Coast style IPA .   t : a nice combination of fruity flavor with a delicious piney Hop residue on the back end .   f : very smooth , easy drinking . high drinkability . feel like you could crush this no problem .   o : this might be the good West Coast style IPA I 've have . this have a lot more balance than many of the east coast style ipa I 've have . bottom line , fantastic beer .

pour from a 22 oz . bomber into a Teku goblet .   Look- a deep murky orange with a little over a finger of thick white head . a small amount of lace down the glass .   Smell- lot of strong citrus with an awesome touch of pineapple . make I want to hurry for my first drink .   Taste- there be not as much fruit taste as the smell lead I to believe . the hoppy taste really balance everything and I taste more malt around the middle of the pour . absolutely delicious and extremely drinkable .   feel- a full feel with little carbonation . slightly dry but still very juicy .   overall a phenomenal double IPA . drinkable with just enough abv to keep it interesting .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: aged bottle . Jet black with hint of brown shading , brown cap . this one be more fitting of the dark lord moniker as it do n't hold anything back . huge bourbon booze start the nose with chocolate fudge , roasted malt , coffee , solid rustic oak , molasse , dry dark fruit , and vanilla . taste be much the same as the nose but not as nuance , barrel stay strong , vanilla step up , caramel enter in , dark fruit fade away . feel be big , boozy and dark , just what they be go for , even with some age it still bite . I be sure this will be controversial but I like the non - ba version well as an all around RIS , but when in the mood for a beast of a beer this will suffice , tough certainly on the sweet end

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: I 've be chase this beer for a while now - bottle count always seem low than other adjuncte variant , and no one seem to want to let one go . so , finally catch it on tap this year !   the beer obviously change a bit in the barrel ( see all of the variant ) - what once be a cloyingly unpleasant , overly sweet beer turn in to a much more balanced , not - insultingly sweet beer that almost have a sort of buttery taste and aroma to it . it be thick and rich , of course , with lightly disguise bourbon . this feel like a trick . I almost wonder whether I have the right beer .   it be great - it still let I down a bit , after these year of chase ... still , great .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: appearance - the beer pour dark color with a creamy mocha head top off the pour .   Smell - the sweetness of Dark Lord meet with bourbon . the nose be sweet , but not cloy .   taste - what make this beer great be the sense of balance . the cloy , soy sauce - like , sweetness that many associate with regular Dark Lord be balance with bourbon . what become of the combination be smooth sticky heat .   Mouthfeel - the beer be silky smooth with light carbonation and a slick sweetness . the body do not seem as thick as some of the other variant .   overall - it be amazing what a plain bourbon barrel will do to Dark Lord .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: 2016 vintage ( release spring 2016 ) ; drink 12/14/16 @ Harvest Hop Haus .   midnight black appearance .   almost no khaki head ; no lace .   Vanilla , oak , bourbon & milk chocolate note in the nose .   Thick , sticky mouthfeel .   rich milk chocolate , oak & sweet bourbon flavor up front ; delicious vanilla note on the finish .   rich , complex , sweet & incredibly delicious . a dessert lover 's dream .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: open a 2012 version on September 25th for anniversary . I love how the Bourbon scale back some of the sweetness you encounter with the base Dark Lord . 6 year of age on the bottle and it hold up extremely well .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: taste from 2016 bottle . thick and chewy . not overly bourbon on taste but definitely on the nose along with caramel , molasse , vanilla , coffee , cocoa . Incredible BA stout .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: Stark black with a surprisingly high rise dark mocha foam . with a slight hiss , it slowly settle down to a slick smooth surface with a thin ring . dark sticky brown leg display after a swirl .   Smell be dark chocolate syrup , dark fruit , char bourbon barrel , pulverize maple - glaze nut , and , at the tail end , a slight sting .   taste bring sweet black cherry skin with dark chocolate , a hint of marshmallow and cocoa dust fig , as purple grape gummie arise in the swallow . the bourbon do n’t seem to come through as much as I expect in flavor . aside from a bit of char , it ’s almost close to Port when combine with the formidable clout of the Dark Lord and his bulbous cherry .   Thick , viscous , syrupy and gloppy with a barely there fine fizz and a slightly stinging heat , BADL finish sticky and semi - dry . well , what else do you expect ?   2017 sparkly green wax vintage

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: rate for 2012 vintage . Booziness be totally go and it be smooth , chocolatey raisany goodness . a little sweet , but overall a very enjoyable smooth as F beer I would drink again in a heartbeat .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: 2012 bottle . be absolutely delicious . great mouth feel , so smooth , silky taste , smell great . bourbon on the nose very little bite on the taste . very thick look on the pour .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: got to drink this at the second Firestone Walker invitational I believe . and then again in bottle at a March Madness event bring courtesy of leftpaw I believe .   pour a use motor oil like color and consistency . very small brown head on it , like 1/8 " Aroma of bourbon , baker 's chocolate , fudge and alcohol , a little bit of roasted malt feel .   taste be pretty nice , plenty of chocolate , sugar , brown sugar , molasse , roasted coffee note from the malt . mouth feel have an appropriately low carbonation and hide the abv quite well . there be a substantial amount of bitterness here . its significantly well than the base version by itself . tend to have more of a boozy quality than it do a bourbon taste . really good stuff , but with so many bourbon barrel stout out there , I have no idea why people pay / trade so high for it .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: 2017 Green Pours pitch black like motor oil in the glass with little head . Smell be sweet chocolate . get some light bourbon and oak note , also dark fruit . taste be chocolate , raisin , caramelize sugar , cherry , with a little bourbon come through . thick , viscous beer . overall , very impressed . this smooth out regular dark lord , and do a LOT to calm down the cloy sweetness of reg DL . still very sweet , but much more balanced . not big bourbon note , would take this down a notch in my book , but overall be impressed . very enjoyable .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: 2017 green wax = 4.53 revisit for draft pour of 2019 vintage at 2019 DLD . pour thick black with no head and very little carbonation to speak of . smell be Dark Lord roast and sweetness with some whiskey sting . I do not get a lot of bourbon on the nose but I never have with the bourbon barrel - age variant . taste be a toned down , less sweet version of Dark Lord with bourbon barrel - age note to back it up . it ’ quite amazing . the combination of a year on the regular Dark Lord plus in bourbon barrel to give it that sweet oaky vanilla and caramely bourbon flavor . feel be low carb and thick . Dark Lord be truly mean to stand the test of time in barrel . overall , this be probably my go - to , could - consistently - drink dl variant . less sweet than Handjee , not as adjuncte as loadstar or Rrari or chemtrail . a really good barrel - age russian imperial stout .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: 750ml 2016 bottle pour into a Dark Lord Teku . thank Ray for share this one .   pour a thick dark brown / nearly black body with a tan head that reduce to a ring .   Aromas be complex and inviting , with lot of bourbon and dark fruit , oak and caramel , cocoa , chocolate , some vanilla in there , alcohol heat .   great combination of flavor on the tongue , I can taste the base beer slightly but it be really compliment with rich bourbon cake flavor , fudgy caramel brownie , dark fruit and coffee on the follow through . pretty rich mouthfeel , medium - low carbonation , very easy drinking for 15 % .   BA Dark Lord be a great example of what a BA Imperial Stout can take like without adjunct . super complex , flavorful , balanced .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: 2016 bottle pour into a teku . look be super viscous and opaque . minimal to no head . Smell be all bourbon and fudge . smell so decadent . taste be bourbon fudge . not overly boozy and have a finish with some dark fruit . as it warm , vanilla and caramel flavor popppe from the bourbon . feel be again very thick . coat the glass and my mouth . linger on the palate . overall , an outstanding beer . worthy of the hype and one of the good BA stout I ’ve try .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: BADL ' 16   2016 bottle . chalice glass . have at a 4 person-4 bottle share : Barrel Aged Dark Lord ' 16 , French Vanilla Militia ' 17 , Marshmallow Handjee ' 17 and Barrel Aged Abraxas ' 17 ( in that order ) .   pour pitch black and extremely viscous with no foam head . it be so viscous , I think it be go to stain the glass ! very pleasant bourbon sweetness aroma . not boozy ! it be like BCBS on steroid . taste have a good amount of barrel presence , nutty , oaky , chocolate and sweetness . really thick and sticky . basically after the first sip , my lip start stick .   this finish as a consensus 2nd out of the 4 ( only behind Marshmallow Handjee ' 17 ) . it exceed everyone 's expectation .   all vintage have : 2019 - 4.70 consume in 2019 . good bourbon + base combo since 2016 vintage . 2017 - 4.35 consume in 2017 . bit on the sweet side . 2016 - 4.84 consume in 2017 . good vintage to date . incredible barrel perfectly play off of the sweetness from DL base . 2012 - 4.53 consume in 2020 . 8 year old beer hold up incredibly well . load of barrel still .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: 2017 Green Wax   l : Look be of regular dark lord , dark , with a slight khaki minimal head that quickly dissipate .   s : again , same as regular dl . where be the barrel ? dark fruit , sugary and sweet .   t : it be like drink regular dark lord . there be a very faint barrel presence , but it taste like normal dl . overly sweet , sugary and dark fruit .   f : medimum body , wich be about the good attribute the beer have go for itself .   o : the 17 vintage do not live up to past representation of the beer . lack barrel and would seek out other before this one . wish I would have trade this one away .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: 2017 - Green Wax   A- black with light brown head S- standard dark lord smell - dark fruit , sugar , bit of coffee ... where be the bourbon ? t- just a bit smooth than standard dark lord and a bit less sweet , but still have many of the standard dark lord note . wish I could taste the bourbon more f- THICK O- good , but not a ton of bourbon

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: 2016 variant ( bottle number unknown ) drink in a snifter on 12/16/2016   l - thick , black , motor oil , nice lacing , minimal head ... one of the thick beer I have have   S / T - wow this be amazing . the barrel alone without adjunct be unbelieveable . the bourbon , VANILLA - y oak , and barrel come through exceptionally well   f - thick , oily , amazing   overall - I be amazing at how different these BA dl be compare to the base . the barreling be outstanding at Floyd 's and maybe even underrated ( if possible ) base on how the gen pop seem to feel about the base DL ( which I still enjoy ) . this be for sure underrated as it definitely hold its own with BVDL and FVM . amazing ! ! !

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: pour into a snifter . an opaque bark brown color with a thin dark tan head . little retention and lacing . a big whiff of chocolate and vanilla on the first sniff . some bourbon and roasted malt . the taste follow with sweet vanilla , chocolate , candied sugar , and whisky . a very thick , viscous drink . well - balanced but heavy and sweet . definitely a sipper with friend . great brew .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: 2015 vintage . crack this bad boy with some friend to celebrate the Cubs win in game 7 since its a Chicago " area " beer ! lot of chocolate and bourbon barrel here ! much much well than the standard Dark Lord swill which be overly sweet ! love this one !

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: syrupy stout with a feel that completely coat your mouth and never surrender . it be insanely sweet and the barrel aging do little to counteract this . be extremely excited to try this and severely let down . not sure why it be rate so high to be honest . almost taste like a wine / liqueur than a beer .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: 2015 bottle . pour motor oil thick . the thick , black beer I 've ever see . very sweet . Cola , vanilla , oak and bourbon . Dry . super sweet . this be borderline too much . as it warm , it be get a bit well . yike .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: big , dark , and delicious - this stand on the shoulder of the regular DL ( which I have always find to be a bit of a letdown ) . BVDL be of course superior , but I be a sucker for vanilla , so no surprise there . this be a great beer for sure , but I would n't trade a chunk of my cellar away for another taste .

product_name: Hellaboozie (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
product_review: 2015 vintage , pour into a taster . highly superior to regular Dark Lord , as the sweetness be mellow out by the barrel characteristic . still on the sweet side , and a bit hot , but an enjoyable offering .
great dank hop floral nose . almost a little bit gritty on the mouthfeel . flavor be as good as you be go to get . Def a beer you should try if you can .

can 11/23/20 and enjoy on 12/02/20 . pour with some moderate effervescence with some moderate head retention and lacing . color reminiscent of orange juice . complex scent of pine , mango , pineapple , fresh cut grass . similar flavor profile- lot of tropical fruit , orange z , with some noticeable hop bite . soft , fluffy mouthfeel . nice oily bitterness that linger on the palate . I really enjoy galaxy hop beer and this be a solid one that drink big than it be , more like a dipa . really big and bold flavor .

can date 9/15/20 . pour into trillium tulip shape glass . look like dirty orange juice . great smell of hop , but not so much as other trillium DDH variety I ’ve have . taste be really well balanced — not overpower with citrus — with a long , ever - so - slightly bitter , linger finish . do n’t stand out in any singular , exaggerated way , but a very nicely balanced IPA . nicely do .

pour a 1/4 " head and lacy sud on top of hazy yellow / orange body . nice refreshing mouthfeel and the double dry hop come through in the taste , and just a touch linger afterwards . tangerine , kumquat , pineapple , and sweet citrus aroma .

l : Super Hazy yellow with a tint of orange and a bubbly head that dissipate leave modest lacing .   s : bright and resinous tropical fruit . Mango , peach , and pineapple . the malt showcase itself surprisingly well with some candy bread .   t : firm bitterness , move into a huge hop flavor of mango , peach , and pine resin . the malt provide a decent backbone with some candy crystal malt presence .   f : Dry , but somewhat creamy from a generous dose of wheat or oats .   overall : a stellar NEIPA , insanely hoppy . you must try this beer if you be a hophead .

a : hazy mute matte orange color with a hint of yellow flat note . pour 2 finger fizzy white head that fade as I type   s : slight dank earthy sweetness at first . tangerine and dry apricot . orange juice and a hint of orange z . graperfruit , and load of dry mango . a hint of pineapple . doughy malt backbone   t : lot of dry fruit in here . dry apricot and mango upfront . a kiss of orange z bitterness behind that . orange juice and some mellow grapefruit bitterness . a touch of chalk at the end   m : medium fluffy mouthfeel with low - medium carbonation . classic NEIPA mouthfeel   o : really nice NEIPA . it be flavorful , yet mellow . harmonize well and the mouthfeel be absolutely spot - on

sweet pineapple , bready / biscuity , and tropical hoppy nose on this one ! taste follow with a soft and juicy , slightly malty , tropical hoppy bitter finish . this have really nice depth and mouthfeel for a single ! this be good !

look ( 4.75 ): nice frothy one finger head . leave lace . super hazy yellow Nose ( 4 ): not sure why , but not very strong from what I can tell . smell citrusy and bitter / a little dank feel ( 4.75 ): medium / full body . this be really nice and soft / pillow and creamy up front and nice and dryer at the end . light / moderate carbonation taste ( 4.75 ): citrusy , but ca n't tell exactly what " candy " fruit . More bitterness and hop . bit of dankness . More dankness than typical NEIPA Overall ( 4.75 ) really great beer . one of the top one that I 've have . great body , flavor , hop , right complexity , and very smooth

have on tap at brewery August 2019   World class hazy IPA , well balanced and chewy , over - ripe fruit but measure so as not to be cloy , mild and appropriate hop burn / thickness on the back of the palate , highly quaffable . seek out .

a : milky , pale yellow . soft head and visibly viscous . s : lot of sweet peach on the nose . t : really decadent for an IPA . Sweet upfront with peach and orange . at the back it have solid acidity and bitterness to round it out . have a citrus oil taste on the end that make it a little sticky . m : full bodied , very smooth . creamy mouthfeel with very little carb . o : a wonderful beer . balance all of the flavor and feel that make a hazy IPA so good .

fresh can courtesy of yllib . hazy to opaque appearance . nice fluffy head . pineapple , pear and mango . there be some piney bitterness . no extreme crazy flavor but just really well do and balance for a neipa .

on tap at trillium , my 2nd ever beer from they .   pour a hazy orange color , with a moderate and well retain frothy head . pretty much the same look as the DDH Sleeper Street I have early .   the aroma display juicy note of tropical fruit , particularly , passion fruit , guava and mango . these be accompany by citrus note of grapefruit , orange and lemon . Herbal aroma evoke grass and mint .   medium to full bodied with a mouthfeel that open relatively smoothly , while the carbonation be moderate and on par for the style . tropical note of passion fruit , guava , and mango lend a softness and a juicy sweetness , less intense than the DDH Sleeper Street I have early . also , the firm malt and wheat backbone contribute to the soft and doughy sweetness . however , as the citrusy flavor of grapefruit rind , orange pith , lemon and lime open up , their zesty nature add balance spice . furthermore , the develop herbal hop flavor of pine and grass add both bitterness and a prickliness to the mouthfeel . the finish be long , dry and with a resiny hop burn that linger in the palate .   tough to rate against the DDH Sleeper Street , nevertheless , I can say with confidence that both be world class and deserving of comparable score .

double Dry Hopped Congress Street pour a milky , dull orange with a nice finger and a half of thick , off white head . the smell be sweet with pineapple , grapefruit and mango with a hint of earthy pine and wet grass . the mouthfeel be thick with orange and grapefruit over the palette with a candy tropical fruit and a slight pine bitterness . excellent beer !

l - not sure how this one have elude I for so long . pour a thick murk . I 'd say yellow , but it be a dark shade of yellow , almost brown . oily head with a rainbow sheen .   S - fruity peach , pineapple , and apricot . Herbal mango and hop ester . tart lemon balance an incredible aroma .   t - soft candy orange and tangerine . subtly spicy with dank hop oil and vibrant passionfruit . Citrus rind a la grapefruit , orange , and lemon - lime , but almost no bitterness , just a mild tingle . still manage to avoid total sweetness with a touch of dryness and overall herbal undertone . gentle and balanced .   F - mostly soft and fluffy with a hint of electric z from the hop acidity . full without be overly viscous . low carbonation .   o - one of trillium 's good . not the juiciest or the most potent , but one of the most balanced . soft , pithy flavor and focus on extract as much flavor from the dry hopping as possible . herbal without feel like you be bite into raw hop and juicy without feel like you be drink Juicy Juice .

mother of god this one be tasty . at first I think I have a " regular " trillium Congress Street , then realize I 'd somehow score the DDH version ( find it online ) . canned date 8/9/19 so I make sure to try this one fresh . and it knock my sock off ! love the look - remind I of some of the good Tree House offering . very hazy yellow color with lot of fluffy white head and thick sheet and ring of linger lacing that cling to the glass and do not fade away . aroma of pineapple , grapefruit , mango , papaya , tangerine , passionfruit and guava ; also malt , caramel , creamy vanilla and some weak floral hop . some dankness in the background . taste follow the nose , great balance between the slightly bitter hop and sweet malt backbone . extremely juicy . at first I be go to give the smell / taste rating of 4/4.25 since they be surprisingly mute and I be disappointed . but then as the beer warm a little the second glass be incredible , more pungent and flavorful and complex with more depth . this be what I be look for ! Mouthfeel be incredible , soft , pillowy , luscious , sticky , smooth , coat the palate . perfect amount of carbonation . just an outstanding beer and I be lucky to have acquire other trillium beer to try .

pour a hazy murky pale orange or orange with some yellow throw in to tone it down some . two finger off white head fall slow and lace well .   Aroma be light tropical fruit with more citrus bite then the other from Trillium at least it seem so at this time . besides the citrus and tropical fruit some pine resin mingle in there some where . this one actually smell like it might have some bitterness to it .   taste be pretty much start fruity NEIPA style typical pineapple , mango , passion fruit but move to more regular citrus grapefruit rind bitterness . Finish be what make this one a little different god the grapefruit rind along with some pine like resin mingle in to add to the bitterness , like the good of both world .   Mouthfeel be medium nice bready malt base to hold all the hop . carbonation be little past medium to add a little zing to the beer .   overall say this be the good out of the four 4 pack I pick up at the brewery . hopefully my rating will reflect that but who know what I will like on what day , lol .
just a classic top end New England IPA . hazy grapefruit color , juicy as hell with both citrus and a variety of fruit flavor . so juicy , I be think there be fruit pulp in the glass .

on tap at the brewery .   Smell and taste be great and hoppy , resinous , tropical and citrus rind . full body with hop oil and notable prickly bitterness .   overall excellent ! Glad I could try it so fresh .

16 oz can . pour out a hazy , golden orange color with a small , white head of foam . it smell of pineapple , orange and grapefruit . so much tropical sweetness with a piney bitterness and toasted caramel .

this be very close to a perfect NE IPA . Color be bright orange . 1 finger white head . pint can of Focal Banger serve , as be my preference , in a pint glass . appear to be date 04/01/21 . pour thick murky yellow and form a nice thick head . Aroma be a bit yeasty . fruity aroma be not too potent to my nose , but there be some lemon and passionfruit juice . flavor be a completely different level , with pineapple and tropical punch blast through a bitter , hoppy backdrop which be unmistakably an IPA . where this beer really excels be that it be both a juicy NE IPA and an american IPA at the same time , compromise on neither .   I be taste this side by side with the more famous Heady Topper , which I recall not like quite as much when I first taste they side by side in , I believe , 2017 . Heady be a bit clear in my glass and it might have a slightly well hop aroma . but the combination of flavor and balance of Focal Banger be just so much more impressive to my palate that it will always be the well beer in my opinion . and at 7 % vs. 8 % the difference between single and double seem pretty dubious to I -- though for sure Heady Topper taste more like a double .   I 'd love to taste this side by side against the good NE ipa I 've have from PNW brewery include Gigantic , Hopworks ( totally Chill ) , Reuben 's ( hazealicious ) , and Breakside .

6.5 week old can pour into a Teku .   full haze in the glass but no murk . look simultaneously juicy and creamy . typical light gold color with some orange highlight . on initial pour there be a finger of big - bubble , soapy eggshell head with minimal retention . splotch of cloudy lacing as I drink the first half . pour out the rest later ( slightly warm ) , the head be much creamy and hold up much long , with similar lacing result .   very green , grassy , citrusy , and sappy on the nose . lot of fruit note range from sweet orange to pineapple , white grape to cantaloupe . some generic tropical fruit salad and grapefruit . mildly weedy and dank . some peach juice , sugar berry , and 7 - up lemon / lime make an appearance late . a familiar Juicy Fruit gum be present , as well . very nice aroma profile , but my initial impression be that it simply do n't stand out in the modern haze world . as the beer warm , that impression change , as the various component grow strong and blend together masterfully . the greenness really start to stand out , but it be balance well by the various fruit component , most of which lend an attractive sweet juiciness to the overall experience . really outstanding . and I bet early on the the emergence of hazie ipa this one be view as an absolute knockout .   the taste profile be shockingly dry and green . there be moderate bitterness , which for a hazie be unique but we certainly be n't talk about West Coast IPA bitterness . quite pithy with a strong mineral note . there be almost zero residual sweetness , which for I be a negative but be clearly what they be after give the name ( or perhaps the name be simply form give the result of the beer ) . I like green , weedy element in these type of beer when there be fruit ( and other ) sweetness to balance thing out . but here the green end up be a touch abrasive because there be simply nothing else to pay attention to . to its credit , there be still a number of fruit component to the taste profile , with orange , pineapple , grape , peach , apricot , and mango be clear enough to pick out behind the greenery . but each be extremely under - ripe and sharp with ( again ) almost no sweetness to it . the big kick come from the strong grapefruit , which I like a lot because it naturally fit with the pithy , bitter , almost sting overall personality . and while there be plenty of modern hazie that have sharp green taste profile that burn and be extremely starchy and/or vegetal , this be completely different -- it be a kin to pure , squeeze , under - ripe grapefruit juice that be clean fruit and pith with no sweetness . credit to Tree House for the naturalness of the fruit flavor , but you be almost wait for some natural sweetness to appear and it simply never do . I be really fascinated by this beer , and I see why it be seek after and love . it be just not what I expect ( even with the name Green ) and be n't really what I look for in a NE IPA . just a touch of sweetness would take this beer to another level . as it be , I find it a little harsh , simply dominate by grassy greens and bitter grapefruit . but it be still interestingly complex , and certainly true to its name .   soft , silky , but a little prickly from both the moderate carbonation and green taste element . zero alcohol heat . incredible linger grapefruit pith . nice coating on the tooth and tongue without any aspect of stickiness or chewiness .

16 oz can receive as a gift from a friend . purchase directly from the brewery . can on 9/22/2020 with " Gimme the Green " stamp on the bottom , so this be almost 3 month old .   look : pour a hazy golden orange color . a nice soft one - finger head with decent retention . the beer become much hazy when I swirl and pour the bottom of the can . then it look like unfiltered pineapple juice .   Smell : interestingly enough , the nose on this beer be quite green . it be almost hard to pick up other note because the vegetal and green note be so dominant . up front , there be a lot of stinky and rank oniony note which be interesting yet personally not so desirable when present in such a dominant fashion . very earthy as well . those note yield to some nice tropical flavor of papaya and orange on the finish , which be a bit hard to pick out because the green note be so strong . as green as the beer seem to be , the aroma have a linger sweet and juicy finish . there be also a lot of chalkiness in the nose , and that be probably due to the age of the beer .   taste : this NEIPA be probably one of the more bitter one that I have have and I be not sure how I feel about it . I like the juicy beer to have a bitter foil to they , but I feel like this one go beyond the use of kryptonite . I also just have to wonder how much of the intend beer I be miss because I be not taste it at its fresh . up front , there be a lot of tropical juicy sweetness - note of orange juice , unripe pineapple , and papaya . the mid - palate of the beer be fine , but unremarkable and that be probably what I be miss most from the lack of freshness here . the finish be soft yet nicely pithy , green , and bitter to help balance out all the sweetness and juiciness , linger long , and also leave a remnant of salinity and juiciness on the palate that be quite pleasant . " 6.00 % ABV .   head : none really ... just a floater ring that be rather thin and weak , dissipate in under 10 second .   body : also a bit thin and weak , and certainly dull with a deplete and dareisay undercarbonated look .   I imagine I be go to enjoy this beer , but we be kid ourselves if this be a perfect 5 for appearance .   aroma : Oak , barrel - derive vanillin , white wine , still cidre , obvious lactic acid . the bacterial aromatic be much more subdued than I imagine they 'd be come in ... they register , but it be not teem with lactobacillus like so many american brew sour ale ( I be look at you , Cascade Brewing ) . do n't seem as full of life and bacteria - ride as , say , Allagash 's coolship ale , but it be entice with promise of ample barrel character , microfloral intricacy , and diverse bacteria .   I do n't get any of that wet cardboard character one sometimes find in well - mean sour ale and I find no sign of infection . some green apple , sure , suggest perhaps acetobacter . no vomit - redolent aromatic that would indicate butyric acid be present .   aromatic intensity be average for the style , maybe even a bit on the timid side . do n't scream acidity , but it do seem acidic judging by the aroma .   TASTE & TEXTURE : zap with mellow acidity and pucker yet mellow bacteria , hit on all front ( pediococcus , brettanomyce yeast , and lactobacillus . not a lactobomb , yield to the lactobacillus without let it dominate the beer 's flavour profile .   I ca n't shake the feeling this would be well fruit . some source of add sweetness would help counter its dry acidity ; this lack the tartness that often accompany sourness and I think it be bad for it .   Smooth , smacky , deliberately undercarbonated ( and to good effect , I might add , evoke a fine Brittany still cidre ) , a bit wet up front and a bit dry mid - body .   Oak and concomitant woodsy flavour tie the brew together without feel in - your - face , but I could do with more barrel flavour myself ... i'd guess this particular 2020 batch be age close to the 9 month minimum than the 36 month maximum in their claim range , and that much to its detriment . I do n't get barrel vanillin per se or rich toast oak , and the wine character be decidedly lack in term of depth of flavour . I mean there be faint white wine - perhaps mute Chardonnay or Riesling - but it be not as overt or nuanced as I 'd like .   Green apple / apple skin , orchard fruit , lime , rustic barnyard funkiness from well attentuate brettanomyce , scattering of microflora ( none of they as interesting as what one would find in a Senne valley sour ) , vinegar / acetic acid , grass , hay , maybe some faint clove / spice from aged hop .   I suppose the bacteria dominate . maltwise , I do n't get much beyond 2 - row and maybe a kiss of Cantillon - like cereal grain . far from a sweet ale , and I do think it 'd be well off fruit as note above .   overall : it be not a holy shit son of a bitch " man , you 've get to try this ! " sour ale , and it be not even Russian River 's good wine barrel aged sour ale ( I 'd tend to favour supplication in that respect ) , but as an american imitation of Cantillon 's spontaneously ferment sour ale , there be no doubt it be rather good , if not quite up there with the Allagash effort in the category . I do n't know that I 'd shell out for it again at this price , but I be glad to have get to try it . a long - time want and a damn solid ale , but I do n't know that it beat the pant off your typical belgian gueuze - many of which be easy to find than this and even as import cost the same if not a biteen less .   I be an unabashed Russian River fanboy , but while it be certainly rather good , the creme da la creme this be not , and how anyone can give this an honest to God perfect 100 rating give its obvious appearance issue ( and what I imagine be to many troublesome undercarbonation ) be beyond I .   b / good

Dry . very dry .   overall : this one be unique . this remind I a whole lot of Cantillon Iris . it do n't have the same immense depth , and it be quite a bit more bitter , but blind , I 'd believe this be a bitter oude gueuze if you tell I . the bitterness be very unique , and it add a whole other layer . the fast evolution of flavour and sense be quite remarkable . it be so delicate , bright , and nuanced - much like Florence , but then that bold shift come out of nowhere . it clearly have some very mature ale blend in , as there be a ton of oak , and it be just a wonderful expression that capture the beauty of spontaneous fermentation .

one of the good look beer I ve encounter . moderately hazy golden orange color with bright white head that leave insane amount of lacing , each sip be a ring on the glass . aroma and palate be grapefruit , grassy green herbaceous note , resinous pine , bready and sweet malt - honey and caramel predominate , some hint of orange and citrus peel . overall this be an enjoyable brew , cheer !

this be malty for my taste and for most HF hoppy beer . feel more like a west cost IPA with the malt and pine characteristic . one of my least favorite HF hoppy beer .

this one strike I as a little bitter at first , but I end up really enjoy it as I go on . the combination of hop in this one work very well , make it another solid DIPA from HF .

sampled pour from a fresh 32 oz growler that indicate Amarillo hop be highlight . pour bRight , nearly lemon yellow and slightly hazy with a solid 2 finger of dense head . nose be lemongrass combine with grapefruit and a hint of bubblegum sweetness . the taste present the sweet fruitiness apparent on the nose but be beautifully balance by resinous hop bitterness . this be definitely one of the good ipa I 've have the pleasure of tasting .

expect a bit more from this one . I expect the booziness give the 10 % ABV but seem to be lack in the aroma department . I enjoy Abner early this week much more . nonetheless , this be still a great beer . HF continue to produce high quality beer .

big , beefy DIPA with a huge ABV that drink incredibly easy . Hoppy , piney and floral aroma ; taste of orange rind , mandarin orange , mango , apricot , grapefruit , tobacco and green tea . outstanding citrus and bitter profile with a soft mouthfeel , but it be not a balanced beer - it be a big time hop - forward DIPA that come on strong and do n't let up . with a 10 % ABV I be not sure what else you could expect . prepare your face . they 've employ magic to make such a huge beer so palatable .

so . damn . pretty unique . almost like an imperial stout plus barleywine blend with a dry finish . Caramel up front , then some char . hope to try some more of their beer .

12 oz bottle , 2018 vintage , cellar treat , send from Junior , into a Prairie Rastal glass .   this marvelous beer pour a wonderful raisin color with a harvest gold head of 1/4 finger . recede to a polite fingernail and stay . swirl leave a few micro leg .   Aroma be that of a really settle - in beer . like this one have have some time to really develop and mature into what it be . ton of wonderful aged date and raisin , with shoe leather , toffee , caramel , brown sugar , and fig . hint of chocolate , and a nice hot alcohol aroma envelop the whole thing .   Toffee and raisin start this one off , follow by a burn char note and some piney hop , and then the sweetness return with caramel and sticky fig , some paper / cardboard , and then fade out on tobacco and molasse . very complex . a bit sharp and bitter , I 'd prefer a little more smoothness , but this flavor profile be bonker .   feel be sticky all the way to the bank with heat throughout but a cool center . moderate buzzing carbonation pair with warm alcohol that coat the gum and tongue . leave a bit of resin on the finish .   overall , this be a really wonderful barrel aged old ale and one I 'd try to find again . I do believe I like their BA stout well , but this be absolutely no slouch .   price pay : trade would find / buy again : yes

dark brown pour ( @59 degree ) with ruby edge ; tight tan head ; fairly quick cap leave a thin ring and a small island of mini bubble ; fizzy sudsy dot of lace and thin leg on swirl . molasse , caramel malt , musty antique store furniture , vanilla and a whisper of bourbon ( ? ) . semi sweet caramel malt on entry , follow by molasse and a firm hop bitterness ; raisin and plum , toffee middle ; roasted nut , a touch of old shoe leather and vanilla / oak note on the backend . medium full body , semi sticky feel ; lite carbonation ; slightly warming ; smooth , silky tongue coating ; dry oaky barrel finish . overall , love the bitter hop coexist with sweet caramel ; complex layer of dry fruit , molasse and earthy / musty note as beer continue to open up ; not boozy ; simply world class !

Kuhnhenn - man , I really have no idea . what be go on up there in Michigan ? so many fantastic brewery ! Kuhnhenn 4th d - unfortunately I have no idea which vintage this be , due to a missing vintage label : store it in the fridge for about a year .   pour a dark brown color with a quickly disappear khaki brown head .   smell of unsweetened coconut shell , earth and scented wood , enrich by dry grape and old oak . offer a nice bourbon spiciness which gets entangle into toasted nut and grill corn . surprisingly earthy , focusse on the barrel without turn just a tad too sweet , create a spicy , warm complexity on the nose which be awesome .   drink truly soft , establish a great silkness , which unfold the bourbon in all its powerfull facet . its hot bite gets balance by the rich toasty malt base , create a powerful , complex beer .   taste of sugar glaze malt , a hint of licorice , dusty woodbark and toasty , bready malt . spicy , sweet cinnamon and baker chocolate add to the malt backbone , while a warm Boubon sharpness slowly become more and more recognizable . end sweet with a well integrated booziness , showcase even more tongue tickle spice and toasty toffee malt . finish very clean and soft , with a heavy bourbon appearance define the taste .   masterfully balanced , intense beer , remind of a Barley Wine at first glance , which from there on transform into something different . all flavor work very harmoniously together , exhibit a slowly uprising bourbon sweetness which reveal a respectable amount of earth and bread . at its peak sweet toffee and scented wood add to the taste , never forget its rustic , bready root . finish utmost clean after reveal its breathtaking complexity , calm after unleash an intense flavor storm on the palate . despite its taste intensity the beer drink incredibly soft and almost easy if it be n't for the perfectly integrate Bourbon , which work so good with the beer profound malt foundation .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: I pop the top and take a gander . golden color in the can , and there ’s dank hop aromas waft up to my schnoz . we be on the hop train , baby ! ! !   a fairly aggressive pour reveal very hazy golden color beer with a sudsy bone white head . gorgeous beer . meanwhile , my schnoz be be assault by dank citrus aroma , primarily tangerine and grapefruit , with some juicy pineapple and a touch of berry . I ’m guess a Mosaic- and/or Citra - hop IPA / DIPA of the NE - style .   the taste be all about the dank - tangerine , touch of grapefruit , delicious pineapple , and more berry flavor than indicate by the nose , and a hint of pilsner malt . Most of all , this be JUICY . very refreshing , too , but there ’ a smidge of alcohol present , so I ’m lock in on a DIPA that feature the Mosaic hop .   the mouthfeel be soft and very full , validate my belief this be a dipa . and it be world - class , IMHO .

I believe that it can be the frame of mind and . think the last time I have this it be summer and very quenching . still it be hoppy of the go and citru bitter be the theme . pithy hop burn pale ale bitter . nice no juice bomb here . follow the tradition of the pale ale well ... very nice and will definitely have again . product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: l : Cloudy yellow with a thick creamy head and excellent lacing .   s : very juicy blend of peach , mango , pineapple , and a touch of spruce . subtle malt , but there be a faint , sweet breadiness .   t : Juicy mango and pineapple abound , a bit of herbal green character , very soft bitterness , and a nice , light candy malt character .   f : Lush , creamy , tongue coating , and a dry finish .   overall : . such an incredible drinking experience , the very good of the New England IPA style .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: decant from a 16 oz ( 473 ml ) can into a Willi Becher glass ; can on 10/19/20 . a : pour a hazy , gold - orange color with a two to three finger white head , half finger retention , and ring of soapy lacing . s : Aromas of lemon , white grapefruit , and nectarine appreciable over a corn and barley graininess . t : Dry . Lemon be definitely the predominant fruit , with a grainy backbone . well calibrate , peppery bitterness . biscuity aftertaste . m : medium body with moderate carbonation . o : like the other trillium offering , flavor forward and at the edge of the style . like the dryness . highly drinkable and enjoyable .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: can date 10/19/20 pour into a tulip glass . get lot of tangerine / clementine and mango on the nose . the flavor be where this one take a weird turn for I - there be a strong vegetal flavor that overpower everything for I through the mid and finish , kind of onion or garlic ... or maybe some parsley ( maybe that ’s it because I ’m not a big fan of parsley ) . still really respectable , but not as tropical and fruity as I be expect . smooth finish , not too heavy or syrupy , with some linger hoppy bitterness . this be can # 1 of a 4 pack and have be store cold the entire time , so I ’ll definitely give it another shot and maybe see if it change over time . sadly , this one might just not be for I and not my fav DDH offering from Trillium .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale

Apple be a good one to hang on , there ’s a crispness to the beer . the slight distraction for I be the finish . it coat the back of my tongue with a slight pithiness .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: pint can pour in to a nonic glass . can be date 05/14/20 .   look- murky golden orange color w/ a slight greenish tint , decent off white head that quickly recede to a thin foam cap , minimal lacing . little to no carbonation streaming as it sit .   Smell- huge citrus ( tangerine , grapefruit and lemon ) , tropical fruit ( pineapple , mango , papaya and passion fruit ) , nectarine / peach , a bit of melon and berry , bready malt , little pine , some herbal / floral note .   Taste- seriously juicy citrus and tropical fruit , nectarine and peach skin , berry , some dank melon , grainy malt , negligible pine and some other herbal / floral hop note .   feel- medium / light bodied and fairly dry and crisp , somewhat sweet and sticky up front with a linger slightly bitter finish . moderate / light carbonation on the tongue .   O- except for the appearance , this be a homerun . very crushable at 6.6 % , more like an IPA than a pale ale .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: 16 ounce can at share . I hit the Trillium trifecta tonight , get to try three of their double dry hop ale . the Fort point be no exception . very well - craft , citrusy , fruity , with a nice linger bitterness that seem to go on forever . juicy and silky smooth .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: date 6/19/19 on the bottom of the can , 6 week since brew .   pour an extremely hazy , nearly opaque pale yellow with a finger of fluffy head . nose burst with candy peach , pineapple , mango , resin , fresh herbaceousness , lychee , portuguese breadiness , hint of bubblegum , slight mushroomy earthiness and a little belgian spice . taste be fresh tropical fruit for day , linger around your tastebud for quite a while , wonderful . low carbonation , soft medium- body but slightly watery . low bittering / dry . probably the good pale I 've ever have , both burst with flavor and deeply refreshing . could crush a 4 pack of these in a heartbeat .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: nose be pineapple , candy tangerine , pine . taste follow with pithy tangerine with some pineapple and then finish like bite into a juicy tangerine . if you let it linger more there be creamy mango and melon leave . the feel be pillowy with solid carb . overall a really pleasant pale ale .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
