product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: pour a murky yellow color . ton of citrus hop and tropical fruit , medium body and no bitterness at all . very easy to drink .   overall a very good pale ale ; not as hoppy as their DDH IPA ’s but very good .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: probably the good DDH NEIPA I have try to date , and although I may not have try everything under the sun that still include quite a bit of the good ! ! so incredibly well - balanced , amazing smell and perfect feel and finish . buy in Boston and drink fresh .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: finally get my lip on this one , an extra hop version of their now famous pale ale , and its predictably awesome . the thing about this , and about so many of the dry hoppy trillium beer really , be that they seem to know when to stop , and in some way , I like this as much for what it be nt as I do for what it be . its not green and vegetal and force , over saturated , harsh , or bitey , and that alone make it well than so many other out there in this style right now . soft yellow even light greenish in color , its mute looking , thin , and nicely bubbly . it smell awesome , citra all over this , but not modern day citra , like citra when it first come into vogue and nobody could get enough of it , so distinctive and fresh , lemony and lemongrassy , with a beautiful freshness to it that almost be as relevant as the aroma it contribute . light green tea , a softly starchy but dry grain base , and a level of refinement evident that I be not use to in these . the flavor be as good as the nose , pineapple and honeydew and lemon zest all come to mind , but this be nt intense for all the dry hop it have , they seem so well integrate , not just on the surface but fundamental to what this be , and that be rare . light bitterness at the end but enough for this to appear balanced . awesome carbonation make it feel really light , and the grain base be dry and simple but rustic enough to contribute something , and I really like that with the juicy hop in here . a really worthy beer , highly acclaim and for good reason .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: truly excellent well balanced and smooth double dry hop pale ale . salad hand of Citra with fruit flavor as well . great aroma . extremely well balanced beer and drink at 6.6 % .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: I be a huge fan of Trillium 's high gravity dipa and be n't sure what to expect with a Pale Ale DDH , but I be very impressed . great nose and look , very juicy in flavor and scent . the mouth feel be very light compare to their large ABV offering , but it burst with flavor through to the end of the glass . a great beer at an attractive price point !

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: 05/2015 - an absolutely incredible , juicy , fruity , dank , spritzy , delicious Fort Point variation . it be a bit danker , bolder , yet juicy version of its young brother .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: appearance - from thecan , the beer pour a cloudy orange color with a white head .   Smell - the nose smell of fresh orange .   taste - my first impression be tart orange with pulp . light pine and tea quality be present with the thick backbone . there be very little bitterness .   Mouthfeel - Talk about full - bodied , the beer have serious viscosity .   overall - I feel like this beer would pair well with a steak .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: even though I have to fly to Boston , and drive to Canton - DDH Fort Point be well worth it .   it be funny because I really , really enjoy the base beer - Fort Point - and have badly want DDH Fort Point for some time ... but when I plan my trip to Boston , I do n't think about that one particular beer at all . I 'd hope that Tree House might have a special release or something , but do n't give trillium a second though . Lo and behold , I end up get bottle and can of several Permutations - and finally have the joy of DDH Fort Point on tap .   the beer pour beautiful , a nice yellow - gold with a clean white head . it smell richly of citrus . I could n't believe how free of bitterness it be - just a bit of light dryness , and ton of juice . I 've occasionally scoff at DDH beer that just do n't seem any well than the base ... this be not one of those beer . DDH Fort Point be absolutely worth the wait . my only lament be that it be not available in can !

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: from a can date 4/26/18 , pour into a glass at home .   look like muddy apricot , virtually opaque . modest head , some lacing .   the smell be the high point for I -- so much hop , I feel like I be stand in a brewery .   initial taste entry be quite acidic and carbonate . taste level out to include citrus ( grapefruit , pineapple ) with a long , bitter -- but not unpleasant -- finish .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: CANNED on 04/26/18   pour a rather murky orange color with a loose foamy head that clump around the edge . bold fruity hop aromas like pineapple , grapefruit , lemon , and stone fruit layer with spicy herb , wood , and pine resin . hoppy fresh flavor : green herb , pink grapefruit , pineapple , mango , and a bit of a raw hop attack on the back end . smooth , medium body with frothy carbonation and a nice crispness . the sheer lupulin blast ( and ABV ) cut down on the refreshment factor - quality stuff though .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale
product_review: love the super dry finish on this . hazy , with a chance of juicy , a low amount of bitterness with a super dry finish make I a happy trillium drinker .

typical NE hazy yellow IPA with an orange tinge and a nice cream head . tropical nose of papaya , melon and pineapple with a racy grapefruit citrus note run through . palate follow nose very closely and the hop be nicely integrate rather than overpower and dominate . a really great beer .

pour a bright orange - yellow color . completely opaque , somewhat thickish . lovely three finger head form on the beer , linger , and then dissipate leave a thin layer of residual foam on top of the beer . Aroma have note of bright citrus , papaya , pineapple , with some light dank hoppy note . its really nice - balance of sweetness , fruit but with some bitterness .   taste follow the nose with note of citrus , orange rind , mango , papaya and peach - sweet but not overly so . a nice bitterness on the back end cut that sweetness down and balance it out a bit . there be some light straw note and a certain grassiness to the beer . feel be medium bodied , moderate carbonation , somewhat dry finish .   overall its a lovely NE style IPA and definitely worthy of the high ranking here . its not often these day that a NE style IPA impress I , but this one do .

can from Jeff , thank for the trade . thought I have rate this guess not . hazy dark lemon color with a decent sized long last bubbly white head . pithy resinous aroma with sweet bread . fruity pineapple and grapefruit with plenty of earthy pine and resin . nice Brew .

what an outstanding brew !   look : nice haze , typical with this style   Smell : I get citrus , slight melon rind and pineapple   feel : smooth with light carbonation   taste : Juicy and dank , golden promise be the standout , become one of my favorite   overall : an excellent brew all around . live up to the hype . an instant classic !

this be can 3 day ago ! ! ! !   appearance : look like a hazy IPA , nothing special in this department . yellow haze , thin head , small bubble   Smell : in a word , awesome , note in order of most to least : big citrus rind , big dank , big malt sweet , some pineapple , some melon   taste : even well than aroma . balance just the way I like , primarily hop forward but a solid malt backbone . sweet malt presence but way less than you would expect from aroma . big citru , big tropical , big dank , solid sweet malt , solid bitter , light bready malt , light pine / resin , no booze , finish dry   feel : medium body , creamy , dry finish , not astringent   overall : outside of appearance this be among the good DIPA 's I have ever have . while the flavor profile be common , this be just well execute than most . it balance the flavor in a way that suit my preference while have a world class aroma and feel . it be also worth point out how fresh the beer be , which certainly play a role here .

pour hazy yellow orangish . nice white head . have that citra cat pee smell- in a good way . tropical and green . also have some banana in there almost hefe like taste be clean and tropical with some flavor that follow the nose . finish be somewhat dry and nice carbonation great beer for style .

sweet orange / tangerine citrus , tropical hoppy , and mosaic dank nose on this one ! taste follow with a juicy and balanced , hoppy and citru bitter swallow . this be nice and soft / juicy on the palate ! this be good stuff !

Taste - Orange rind lead the way , which keep the beer from be overly sweet . a spiciness follow that cause a light warming sensation . the overall profile have a nice sense of balance . it be sweet , but not load with add junk .   Mouthfeel - the haziness parallel a thick body . it be not quite drinking juice without pulp , but it be thick .   overall - this be a great example of the style that be not overdone .

I have a draft of this at the brewery in Portland , ME . I have to admit , I be n't impressed . it taste mildly soapy to I . the IPA present note of pine and citrus and some mango be there for I but I just could n't get rid of the soapy note and it feel unbalanced to I .   the colour and smell be fine ... the mouthfeel be indistinguishable to just about any other IPA I 've have but there be just nothing overly special about this beer . I 'd rate it way below Sip of Sunshine or very Green by Treehouse . its clear this have some of the same note as a Treehouse IPA but overall it just do n't feel as balanced . it be like hear a HS Symphony band vs. the Boston Pops . I 'd rate this slightly under a King Sue or Greater Good .   overall , I just be n't a fan . as they say in the Bronx , it be just ' a'iiiight ' .

fresh can courtesy of SierraNevallagash from brewery ’s recent drop . 16 day old . l : pure light orange juice with white Fluffy head & soapy lace . s : stonefruit , grapefruit . t : stonefruit , orange juice , citrus Grapefruit resiny bitterness . touch of dank . f : juicy and fairly thick and creamy . overall : a solid neipa . from a 16 oz can date 9/29/20 into a pint glass . prop to Bissell Brothers for one of the cool can I 've see in a long time . all black with silver lettering and logo and with a beautiful black can top .   pour an opaque pale yellow with about one finger of thick , foamy white head . amazing retention and decent lacing .   smell of tangy orange and tangerine with a bunch of grapefruit and pineapple mix in . pick up some mango as well .   taste follow the smell . Juicy ! tropical and citrus fruit . also a decent tangy bitterness that show up well after the swallow .   soft mouthfeel . low to medium carbonation . surprising bitter aftertaste .   overall , this beer deserve it be place on the top 250 . great brew . thankful for a friend who visit Maine and be able to snag some of this .

can on 6/2/20   pour a turbid , deep golden mango hue and top with over two finger of fluffy , thick white foam ; incredible , last head retention ease down to a creamy finger of cap and a rich , fluffy collar , while moderate ring of lacing , along with a webby spatter , mark the side of the glass .   Aroma open with tangerine z , overripe tropical fruit rind , mushy grapefruit , and a slight tone of incense , steadily transition into an underlie yet encompass exceedingly dank hop note of redolent of well - execute Simcoe ; a vague mango cream on the close hint at a rounded sweetness .   taste feature a soft amalgam of pineapple , passionfruit , underripe kiwi , and light peach zest strike first ; a crisp , refined , and wheaty malt backbone be subtle but undoubtedly present to balance the fruity tone , while an increasingly musty herbal hoppiness shine calmly past the finish .   Mouthfeel present a deft , airy medium body bolster by a prickly , moderate carbonation ; subtly taut and resinous across the mid - palate as a gritty , well - disperse bitterness glide along the back end and into a semi - crisp , vaguely juicy finish .   though unquestionably a NEIPA in form , the structure of this beer enable an alternate experience where fruity sweetness , dank hop , and malty crispness all share an opportunity to shine ; essentially , a highly nuanced execution of Simcoe hop result in a sly , dank , and quaffable showcase of the more restrained aspect ( re : less sweet ) of the style .

swish pour a light and hazy , golden straw color with full , white , 1 - finger head and spotty lacing . the smell be mild with a dose of dankness and a juicy , sweet fruit include guava , pineapple , orange and tangerine with a hint of floral and onion . the taste be rich and sweet , juicy pineapple and guava up front with a bitter and dank , hop bite which balance out the sweetness as it finish with a hint of grapefruit rind .

absolutely fantastic NE style IPA . I ’m come to love this brewery . canned date 10/16/19 so this be incredibly fresh . pour a luscious yellow hazy color with great fluffy white head and nice ring of linger lacing that cling nicely . smell of ripe tropical fruity hop - tangerine , grapefruit , mango , guava , pineapple , lemon , papaya . also malt , creamy vanilla , bread and a little floral and herbal hop . taste follow the nose , very juicy and balanced and great depth . high ABV be very well - hidden . Smooth , sticky , luscious , soft mouthfeel that coat the palate and perfect amount of carbonation . an outstanding beer .

trade for this a while ago , even though I have no idea when since there be n't a date or anything else write on the bottom of the can . I have n't have much from Bissell Brothers but the beer I 've be able to sample from then have lead I to believe that they can brew a New England IPA as well as anyone and that be certainly the case with this beer .   the pour to this be decent as the liquid be golden , murky and top off with plenty of head . not a lot of lacing be leave behind as I work my way through this with much of it remain as the thin head along the top of my pint glass . the strength of this beer , as well as it be potency , lie in it be taste as the tropical , murky , and turbid nose give a hint of what be to come once I sip it . Melon , grass , dank hop , and overt overripe tropical fruit in the nose give I a hint of what be to come as the dry , chalky nature of the aroma give I a strong hint of what be to come . tropical fruit , soft juiciness , and soft hop hit my palate from the get - go and linger throughout my session , as they form the backbone of this beer . a light carbonation and moderate alcoholic presence allow the deep and dank note of this fully emerge on my palate , as this quietly linger and fully warm up to my tongue and ultimately to the rest of my sense ...   this have enough alcohol in it but that be nearly irrelevant to everything else that be go on . sure , lot of sediment be leave at the bottom of my pint glass but that pale in comparison to the impression this leave on I once the liquid fully go down . while not among the good New England IPA 's or good IPA 's that I 've have as of late , this serve as a textbook example of how wonderful this style could be . if you love brew from this neck of the wood or anything fron Bissell , seek this out . it will be well worth your effort !

BISSELL BROTHERS SWISH DIPA 4/23/19   can 3/7/19 . a month and a half old .   pour from the 16 oz . can into a Tree House stem tulip .   a ; opaque gold with a finger thick white head which recede to thin head and spotty lacing .   s : intense citrus / pine resin .   t ; follow the nose with some dankness , moderate hop bitterness and curiously strong initial throat burn for an 8 % ABV brew . later grapefruit note become prominent .   m ; medium , good body and carbonation tingle .   o ; a powerful - taste DIPA which nonetheless remain light enough to be fairly easy drinking .
pour a hazy gold . Smell great Tropical — mango , pineapple , taste be so satisfying citrus up nice round bitterness , smooth and silky mouth feel , I likey !

I think this be the second beer from Lawson ; thus far , I have enjoy their beer . the beer be bright and crisp with the right amount of astringency . awesome beer !

on tap at the Tavern Downtown in Hartford , CT .   this beer do not blow I away and so I think about why folk might be give it the rating that they do . in part , it be because this beer have a reputation as be one of the early great imperial ipa . for I what make this a great beer be that it have retain its original profile , which be certainly more west coast IPA than anything find in Vermont . the bitterness be not over the top , but its just enough to balance the 8 % ABV to make you think you be drink a beer with much less alcohol . pliny and Ruination be well , but this be a great beer .

taste 3/5/21 . pour from a can date 12/23/20 . a - pour rich golden color with slight orange hue . 1 finger of foam which do dissipate S - very nice aroma , citrusy and floral T - pick up some crystal sweetness at first which be quickly overtake by hop note - not just citrus but also some stone fruit ( El Dorado perhaps ? ) finish slightly dry with a pleasant residual bitterness . definitely a lot of IBUS in this beer . m - nice mouthfeel , some warming due to the 8 % ABV . this be a sipper ... o - lean more toward a traditional IPA than a NEIPA due to more bitterness and less juicy and hazy . a very good beer , but I would argue several beer match this one in the IIPA category .

I can still remember the first time I have this . what a perfect name , it really feel like a ray of sun shoot into you . fruity but not overwhelming , hoppy but not pungent , never overindulgent but never lack in character . a perfect beer .

presentation : 16 oz . can with the canning date print on the bottom . serve in a Lenox Tuscany IPA glass .   appearance : the bubbly , bright white , two finger head stay around for a while and leave behind some thick , patchy lacing . it be a hazy , bright gold color .    Smell : it be a beautiful , floral , hoppy aroma with some citrusy fruit show up in the background like grapefruit and orange .    taste : it be hoppy with note of orange and grapefruit . the mildly bitter , hop resin tingle persist throughout and it have a long finish . it balance out the strong , fruit sweetness nicely .   Mouthfeel : it be light to medium bodied and quite refreshing . it have a soft silkiness and medium carbonation with a crisp , dry finish .    overall : the beer taste great , smell wonderful and be very easy to drink . it be no wonder this be a New England favorite and one of the classic example of the style .

pour from a can ( 09jul2021 ) into a TH teku # properglassware   l : pour a glowing , totally opaque yellow orange with a huge , thick white head that ’s slowly fade . large , chunky lacing leave   s : really nice fresh and juicy tropical fruit nose . nice wave of mango , peach , papaya - some orange citrusy note as well . it ’ a bright , freshly cut fruit type nose - less of that overly dank aroma , incredibly invite . slight citrusy bitterness in the background , but mostly it ’ those peach and papaya note for I   t : I ’m a bit mixed on the swallow here . it ’ a light more fruit cocktail flavor than I expect , peach and citrus to open . Papaya come through in the middle , and would say I like the flavor more as it ’s warm slightly in the glass . there ’s a pleasant , light grapefruit bitterness that come through in the middle and carry through the medium+ finish . abv work well   f : medium body , medium carbonation . fairly smooth , slightly dry   o : delicious DIPA that certainly grow on I . find the nose inviting , first sip be a slight disappointment but the flavor really win I over as I drink more ( 8.2 % abv do n’t hurt haha )

haze vs very hazy side by side Haze 12 oz can , date 5/7/21 , pour into a teku   a- a bright hazy golden orange with a three finger white head 4.5   S- Citrus , mango , tropical fruit , some pineapple , floral , earthy . 4.25   T- Citrus , tropical fruit , papaya , some melon , mango , earthy finish . 4.5   M- smooth , slightly creamy , medium body . 4.5   O- a great and easy to drink NEIPA . not as bright and flavorful as Very Hazy , but still really good . 4.5   look wise I would have guess that Haze be the fresher beer , but everything else lean towards very Hazy be well . I honestly do n’t think the difference be a freshness issue since Haze be n’t show issue with fading . both beer be amazing example of neipa

( 16 oz can , 04/08/21 ; purchase at TH by my brother ; keep store away cold till today ... pour in stage into trillium fat tulip )   l : opaque , milky , pale , orange - amber liquid ; relatively tight , cottony foam cloud perch atop , last a good while ... steady , messy , thin cap , thin collar , and a few streaky ring of lace   s : floral - angle , fresh - cut orange flesh ( peel , pith , and meat , yet to be juice ) ; melange of tropical dry fruit essence ( papaya , mango , maybe some passion fruit and/or soursop ) ... hint of creamy cereal oat in the back ; soft , perfumy note of booze , but no overt ethanol presence   t : remarkably roll - off , subdue fruity hop character ; unclear , ' hazy ' expression ... bitter - lean orange , mellow papaya , maybe even a note of lime hull ... I do n't think ' peach ' until I read the can , but yes a subtle hint of that too ... the least ' sweet ' of the TH hazie I 've try ... whisper of peppery spice ... even the malt / oat character be relatively clip   f : incredibly smooth , from a booze standpoint , its edge its warmth roll off antique lo - fi ... mellow bite and flare of bitterness up front , which quickly fan out , wash away ... the alcohol gradually , gently stun the tongue ; stealth ... taper on the edge   o : the least treble - y explosive , flavor - wise , of the TH I 've try , but still maintain a certain characterful depth in hop layer ... be this an early experimental attempt that they just keep brew for some reason ? review 1528   I be stoke to consume this beer ! thank you WunderLlama for give I this beer . the beer be 44 degree and serve in a nonic . the pour of the beer create a magnificent three - finger head . the bright white foamy and creamy head leave lace on the glass as it slowly dissipate . the color of the beer be SRM 3 , pale straw with light golden color . this beer be hazy . the appearance of the beer be exceptional .   the initial aroma in the beer be citrus , lemon , papaya , and pineapple . nose far , I detect toasted bread crust , orange , floral ester , a hint of herbal , and a malty sweetness .   the flavor in the beer be orange , lemon , papaya , pineapple mango , bready , floral ester , a hint of phenol , a dash of herbal , and a subtle earthiness .   the mouthfeel of the beer be astringent and dry .   the body of the beer be medium , medium carbonation , and a full finish   a beautifully construct beer . the flavor and the balance of the beer be on point . this be what a NEIPA should taste like . excellent beer . I wish I have more .

look - fantastic slight whittish yellow thick color with a nice white head and sticky lace Smell - Lots of orange with some peach in there as well taste - LOTS of orange with that slight peach like the smell and maybe some more tropical fruit as well . slightly dank but not bitter Feel - medium full body with a slight crisp light carbonation overall - just fantastic !

haze from Treehouse . receive on 9/4/21 from @Rub_This_BBQ in NBW BIF # 13 . 12 oz can store upside - down at home at 42 degree . review 16/4/21 . note that I use DD / MM / YY protocol . undated can . serve at 42.4 degree in a hand wash and dry Jester King snifter . final temperature 53.4 degree . appearance – 4.25 . first pour – Pale Straw ( SRM 2 ) , murky and nearly opaque . body – straw ( SRM 3 ) , murky and opaque . when rear - lite , same . head – large ( maximum six cm , aggressive center pour ) , floral white , high density , average retention , diminish to a two to four mm crown and a thick partial cap . as the head collapse , multiple fragment of band of lacing remain above the crown . second pour produce a high density 0.5 cm head . lacing – good . head retraction and volume reduction leave a wide band of tiny to medium bubble . see also above . aroma – 4.25 – pineapple follow by pine . no malt , no yeast . flavor – 4.5 – begin moderately dank with some generic tropical fruit in the background yet somehow refreshing . no malt , no yeast . no alcohol ( 8.2 % ABV , as mark on container ) taste or aroma . a weak gastric warming occur . no dimethylsulfide or diacetyl . palate – 4.5 – medium , creamy , soft carbonation . final impression and summation : 4.25 ( after deduct 0.25 point for undated personal container ) please aroma and flavor , smooth and refreshing on the palate .

can @ monkish . cloudy golden - orange beer with a finger of soapy white foam . nice tropical fruit ( mostly pineapple ) , pine , and oily citrus on the nose to start . there ’s a bit of underlie sweetness here , but it ’s fairly mild . the flavor start off with a lot of citric hop character such as grapefruit and orange , but there ’ a pretty strong pineapple juice thing go on , too . moderate bitterness and a slightly oily finish . kind of heavy on the tongue .

for an IPA the smell and taste can not get any well . a lot of Treehouse beer fade into memory as taste a lot alike , great stuff but not individually memorable . however , Haze be such a unique standout . the ability to make hop taste both of peach and hop be amazing . by far my favorite Treehouse beer .

16 oz can receive as a gift from a friend . purchase directly from the brewery . can on 9/30/2020 with " I want haze you want haze we all want Haze " stamp on the bottom , so this be almost 3 month old .   look : pour a quite hazy yellowish orange color . look kind of like super unfiltered peach - pineapple - mango juice . small head with some lacing .   Smell : very pungent initially . a lot of over - ferment tropical fruit aroma include orange , mango , guava , dry papaya , and pineapple along with a significant green and dank finishing note . a bit of sharp , vegetal onion also . the nose be very sharp , before taste the beer I be not sure how much I like it on its own . a more pleasant pink grapefruit aroma come through later on , along with some spice .   taste : interesting in that this be bitter up front ( which you do n't usually get with these neipa ) , follow by sweetness and tropical fruit and lot of citrus rind , and then more bitterness on the finish . something taste a bit off about this beer to I , and I ca n't really place it . it could be because it be not the fresh ( almost 3 month old ) , or it could just be that it be not my taste . probably the big positive about this beer be that the 8.2 % ABV be pretty well hidden .   feel : nice mouthfeel . soft and pillowy . appropriately carbonate .   overall : my third Tree House beer . I wish that this beer be more complex - this could be due to the age . I look forward to be able to re - review this one when I can enjoy a fresher offering . the flavor of this beer have grow on my since I taste it initially , but it still seem a bit lacking to I . well - make for sure , but again I think that it ideally need to be enjoy fresher .

from a 16 oz can date 11/10/20 into a pint glass . message on can : R.I.P. A   pour an opaque yellowish orange with about a finger and half of frothy white head that linger forever and leave incredible lacing .   smell of peach , nectarine , orange , grapefruit and a bit of pineapple .   taste follow - very juicy with a moderate amount of piney / earthy bitterness on the back end of the sip . maybe just a hint of alcohol in there as well .   Mouthfeel be soft and smooth - unbelievably drinkable for 8.2 % abv . mild bitter aftertaste . low carbonation .   overall , another top notch beer from Tree House . although I enjoy some of their other offering a little more than this , I be not turn my nose up at it .

hazy yellow with a bubbly foam on top . some spotty lace down the side of the glass . Orange citrus aromas highlight a soft nose , just a touch of hoppy resin and booze detectable as well . the flavor have a lot of complexity go on with lightly fruity flavor . the can describes peach and papaya flavor , as well as orange juice and there be no arguing with that . there be also a mild hop bitterness that just take the edge of the sweet flavor so expertly . all those flavor be nestle into a medium carbonation and full body and create a balanced and extremely pleasant experience . incredibly enjoyable to sip on and reflect on just how expertly craft this beer be .

do the child have a good week in Mantucket ? be it a long ferry and drive back ? be there too much go on unload the car and get the kid into bed and put stuff away ? thank , haze . solid straw gold look , with a 1/4 " head on a soft pour and 3/4 " with a second hard pour in a tulip glass . lacy foam coat the glass during the 2nd overtime Dallas win ! nice citrus and sweet flavor come through , passion fruit or papaya . the hop barely come through and nicely control . the aroma be ne dipa all the way , citrus , peachy , papaya , mango . nice finish , on the dry side . double ipa ? you would never know it , not boozy and immensely drinkable !

can on 8/7/2020 , almost a month old which be fine by I . Orange , peach , candy aroma , juicy as hell . citru flavor , bit of mineral , tasty . overall I like the aroma more than the flavor but this be a good one .

can 7/10/20   this be one of the one I already have on the first night of get the mixed case , but I really be n’t think much of it as I drink it idly so I be n’t impressed . let ’s see how it perform under a watchful eye   pour a hazy , opaque pale yellow with 4 ( ! ! ) finger of soapy white head that fade very slowly and leave ton of lace   as much as this look like hazy pineapple juice , it smell like it too . tart pineapple , sweet blood orange , banana , and papaya . light note of pepper and citrusy hop   very juicy on the front end of the sip , with plenty of creamy peach , orange rind , and melon . mid palate bring more creamy and sweet tropical flavor . 2016 release - consume on November 12 , 2020 . pour a very dark brown . 1 finger off white head . for the ABV , the retention be good . the head dissipate to a ring around the edge of the glass . there be some decent carbonation rise in the glass that make the ring swirl about . no lacing on the glass . the nose be a sweet toffee aroma from the barrel . boy oh boy . you take an already infamous beer and up the ante by add vanilla and cocoa . gnarly . it be a beastly beer that be a true sipper if I ve ever see one . it be rich , dark , heavy , sweet and delicious . the addition of cocoa and vanilla add flavor to a beer that , honestly , do nt really need any help but somehow serve as an upgrade . great beer , share it with good friend , do nt drive afterward .

wow ! ! ! just taste this on tap at Brewski in Brisbane . one of the truly great stout , imo . would have love to try it alongside CBS , my favorite other stout to date . I would try to expand on this but word can not do justice to such great beer .

this be one of the fine imperial stout . taste like prune and chocholate with not too much sweetness . it also age really well . mouthfeel be think , but not too thick , and the ABV be off the chart .

pour black withi a still , oily look to it . head foam up to a finger in height , but disappear quickly . Foam be khaki in color . 2015 . 18.4 % ABV .   like with all the other Weekday pour , a dark brown color with crimson hue . small amount of ivory head that dissipate quickly and settle into the beer .   dark fruit and booze right away on the nose , with hint of roasty coffee and vanilla . lot of potent ethanol , with those expect note of oak and char from the Black Tuesday 's sweet , smooth base character . although there be that high gravity potency , even after 3 year of bottle conditioning , both adjunct be still very much present .   the vanilla and chocolate have hold up so well in the flavor . if you have a bottle of this from 2015 , now be the time to open it . predominantly sweet , with complimentary hint of dark fruit and subtle roasty coffee . pour a 2017 bottle from a 750 ml . bottle into a tulip glass . this beer , just like Black Tuesday , pour out way light in color than expect when pour a stout of this nature . medium - dark brown color with highlight all the way through . on the pour , as quick as bubble could form they would pop . eventually the carbonation get ahead of the disippation and form a thin light tan crown . the smell be quite demanding and confident with booze and alcohol . it burn the nostril and honestly do n't leave much else to show you along the way . the taste come in more inviting , show you smooth chocolate and vanilla , while still have a rather pronounce burn . pour from the bottle into a teku glass . b # 510 February 5th 2018 .   fleeting and sudsy tan head , that dissolve pretty quickly , to barely a thin collar . interesting body color though . opaque and dark but have this giant amount of purple to it somehow .   this be an interesting aroma . wine like fruit flavor mix in with an interesting cocoa bent . rich dust cocoa powder , almost husky and carob thick ripping on the nose . not sweet at all , but not much barrrel hinting character on this . impressive but not sure the angle this be go .   so down the hatch and what do we get ? big richness . light body but with excellent silky quality and maybe a touch of cut fizz , fill with rich flavor . light warm touch of raspberry and cherry like kirsch heat , mix with a dark decadent cocoa powder that blanket and even neutralize the sweetness so perfectly . rich dusting finish on the aftertaste , while large , do n't come off as a hot boozy mess . over the last year , I have have pour of the 2012 , 2013 , 2016 and 2017 batch . this beer age phenomenally , love the chocolate aroma and taste . will continue to buy and drink this lovely beer .

mixed opinion . have be wait to try this for year . buy 3 and will try out over at least 9 year . beer # 1 : Beer have outstanding nose and flavor , and be easily consider an excellent beer . appearance be fine and head / lace consistent with an almost 20 % ABV . very disappointed in mouthfeel ... have expect something full and rich and instead a bit hot ( understand ) , very thin ( do n’t understand ) and even a touch astringent . hard to believe it ’s a double be . almost a mix of Black Tuesday , Vanilla , nib ... and Sang Noir . it ’s not go to get any thick or creamy ... so much less excited about aging . a very delicious beer ... just not my style for body .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: pour a turbid pineapple color with a creamy , dense two - finger white head that provide minimal lacing . the nose be a cornucopia of citrus and tropical fruit aroma , with trip orange , grapefruit , pineapple , and passion fruit vie for attention , and there ’ an herbal note as well .   the taste mirror the nose , with the ripe orange and passion fruit most prominent on my palate , and the herbal flavor be significant as well , but it ’ the slightly creamy flavor that keep this beer perfectly in balance and dangerously drinkable at 8.5 % ABV .   the mouthfeel be the soft side , per the style , yet substantial enough to support a beer of this gravity . I would imagine when this beer be add to the database nearly four year ago , it knock the sock off of beer nerd everywhere and for good reason , because this stand up exceptionally well to the brewery in the Northeast like Tree House and Trillium that have perfect this style . world class stuff , IMHO .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: pour a cloudy orange juice . nose be of orange , a little hop pine . taste follows.with a juicy citrus fruit and a medium citrus bitter . feel be the viscosity of 2 % milk with a nice fizz . overall , let this beer breath for a minute and it open up into a great vibrant juicy beer .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: super cloudy OJ color with a thin half - finger of off - white head that leave nice ring of lacing .   Orange and passionfruit in the nose .   some of that citrusy , tropical flavor carry over to the taste , as well as some cream , but it ’s step on by strong herbal bitterness with hint of grass and pine .   soft , full - bodied feel with a little zip to the carbonation .   good , but the original be near - perfect . the extra hop in this version be n’t an improvement .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: appearance - the beer pour an orange - ish yellow color with a white head crown the glass .   Smell - the nose be hazy orange , as be most typical for a NE IPA . it do not profile overly sweet .   taste - Initially , I be surprised that this be not very sweet . I detect pine , citrus , fresh cut grass , and passionfruit . it be a little dank and spicy with a little bit of warmth at the end .   Mouthfeel - there be some viscosity in this beer with a high level of sediment at the bottom of the can .   overall - I believe I like the non - double dry hop version well .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: picture perfect hazy yellow body and pearl white head and lacing . have plenty of vibrant fruit like the original : grapefruit , lime , nectarine , orange , peach , with accent lemon with dank and dry hop . Taste add some mango yet the hop remain pretty dank and full yet finish dry and clean , impressive . feel be about as good as it get , hop be more than a one trick dry pony yet finish be bone dry , great hazy fruit , perfectly balanced and crisp . well than the orignal

I ’m not sure how much to de they . overall impressive , would recommend to any fan of hop+juice+bitter bomb .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: HO . REE . fawk ! I absolutely love this brew ! so Uber danky and pungent with bright citrus hop . this may well be my favorite " regular " DDH dipa bomb . can never get enough !

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: currently rank # 24 in the Top New England ipa and # 1 in the Top Louisiana Beers List . currently # 109 overall .   on - draught @ Avenue Pub , New Orleans , LA . $ 7 for a 6 oz pour .   APPEARANCE : no head . Pulpy yellow - orange body . not so much hazy as turbid and murky .   do n't look great . Alcoholic Odwalla juice capture it .   AROMA : pulp . Orange z . Papaya . Guava . wheat . pale malt .   do have some nice Citra - derive pulpy hop aromatics , but it suggest an IPA with no bitterness and limited hop pungency .   TASTE : match the aroma . suffer from shallow depth of flavour and poor hop pungency so it fail to showcase Citra hop as a result . citrus pulp , pale malt , floral hop note .   so brief , so simplistic , so shallow . I mean it be drinkable and enjoyable , but it do n't showcase its choose hop varietal well on a fundamental level .   texture : Smooth , wet , pulpy , uneven , refreshing , medium - bodied . I would n't call it juicy but it be thick and a bit chewy .   overall : hide its ABV impressively well . highly drinkable . but not a top tier IPA nor a great Citra hop beer . I 'd probably pick it up occasionally if it be available at $ 10 a sixer . far from great .   high b- ( 3.46 ) / worthy

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: 12 oz bottle   pour less than a finger of white head into my snifter . retention be average , but leave behind nice initial lacing . body look like OJ . look pretty good so far , for a hazy .   Nose have some punch to it , that ’s for sure . a load of dankness hit you right in the mouth . Juicy as well , grapefruit , mango , pretty standard . maybe a touch of guava . somewhat sweet . I mean it smell good , but I ’ve do this song and dance before , nothing new .   Flavor be interesting , definitely not as pungent with dank hop as the nose . have a pretty moderate start , small dank hop presence , mix with some light mango note , substantial grapefruit , finish smooth and creamy . it taste fine , just a little off , almost like I ’m drink grapefruit juice , it have a puckering quality to it .   the mouthfeel be part of the problem , while it be smooth and creamy , it ’s too much so . carbonation be too low , which I guess be " normal " at this point , but unwelcome . it ’s like grapefruit flavor milk , it do n’t work for I feel wise at all .   drinkability be ok , but it be pretty damn tart , not bitter , tart .   the appearance turn out really nice , lace be thick from top to bottom .   overall this be a good beer , but these small detail really hurt it , like carbonate your beer for the love of god .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: taste from a crowler . pour a super murky orange . look like orange juice . thick white head . Aroma be big time citrus . super juicy taste with citrus and some tropical note . minimal bitter bite . very crushable . excellent .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: have a crowler of this over the summer . share with two other people .   pour into a trillium tulip .... this be one of the hazy , most opaque beer I 've ever see . bright yellow orange in color with a white / off white head that linger . look " sticky " .   Aroma of grapefruit , orange rind and tropical fruit abound . not as assertive as I think it 'd be but I find that some beer with insane hop amount tend to be a touch mute on the nose .   Flavor .... be this orange juice ? stuff taste like it . it be like DDH Congress on steroid .... so much orange and grapefruit mix with tropical fruit . nice linger bitterness with a dry finish .   feel on this be " thick " . Super creamy and sticky . the lacing on the glass be impressive as it leave a ring that stick every single time I take a sip . very fill though .   overall , this be one of the more memorable hop saturate beer I 've ever have . super in your face with flavor ... just ton of citrus and tropical fruit on the palate . great beer !

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: really hazy yellow color with short live off - white head . Aroma have intense juicy fruit like ripe peach , apricot and mango . taste follow with sweet and juicy fruit note , some biscuit , a hint of vanilla , slightly astringent on the finish with a light bitterness . medium plus body with medium carbonation . true hop juice .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: opaque orange so I be tell - I be color blind but my wife and sister in law swear it look like orange juice . it smell like what nostalgia tell I five alive smell like : overwhelmingly citru with heavy orange and tangerine note . Mouthfeel be out of this world - velvety creamy . it be as if they use nitrogen even though I know they do n't . it be as hoppy as you 'd expect a double dry hop ipa to be , but super juicy with citrus throughout .   TLDR : it be a slice of fry gold

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: canned 11/14/18 and taste ~1.5 - 2 week later .   a : pour light orangish - pale with a smattering of bright white head . completely opaque haze . minimal lacing and below average retention .   s : bright orange and tropical hop , a bit of white grapefruit .   t : straight hop juice : mango , tangerine , a bit of dry flower and hay . finish with medium - light bitterness and a touch of sweetness .   m : medium - full bodied , fairly creamy , with medium carbonation .   o : a big and flavorful NE IPA that hit all the right citrus and tropical note .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: if citra be your thing , this be where you want to be . super juicy . an awesome example of this hop 's flavor , highlight it with a nice medium level of mouthfeel . the head be not overly eager and fade fairly quick to a ring around the edge of the glass . this be much smooth than the regular GITM and an improvement on that beer in every way .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: beautiful beer . pour a bright turbid straw yellow to orange . Thick bright white head on heavy pour . nose be sherbet like . Orange peel and juice . taste of citrus . note of orange , grapefruit peel , lemon z and peach . honestly one dimensional as in I really only get those citrus note . but they be huge ! and delicious . creamy silky body that ’s easy on the tounge . hoppy finish to close out this beer . ya no kid right ? 8lb per barrel so it well finish hoppy ;)

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: look perfect , gold hazy body that have a nice thick , creamy feel and light bitterness . nose be fruity , taste be juicy as you would expect just from look at it . one of the few that live up to the hype .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: 10/21/19 , from a can release late September ( ~3 week old ): ' taste ' rating up from 4.25 to 4.5 for a touch more creaminess at the front of the palate , and some incense / onion / herbal hop tone far accentuate the back end . balance to the point of understatement , but enable a level of universal approachability few neipa reach ( especially with a DDH treatment ) ; this beer sit casually at the peak of the style , with few other as level or refined .    come across this one purely by chance recently , and be pretty excited to dig in ...   bottle on 9/14/18   pour an opaque and glossy golden peach with a finger of fluffy white head ; solid retention and uniform lace stick around a good while .   Aromas of deep herbal grass , huge tangerine , orange , and citrus fruit , dank , green , piney , and spicy hop ; vivid and bright ; hint of creaminess form as the bouquet quiet .   taste bring a detailed , prickly hop balance , intensely herbal / earthy but cut slightly by juicy citrus note of mango , orange , and tangerine ; a level burst of flavor be consistent and the thoroughly enjoyable profile hold an impressive balance of weight ( consider it ’ DDH treatment ) that have it verge on sessionable .   Mouthfeel be pure silk on the palate , with level carbonation and a near - perfect medium body ; go down like nothing , with just slight residual hop on an earthy finish hang around to remember it by .   Damn impressive in its drinkability and nuance raw hop note . drain the Citra dry to find a beautiful medium between raw , intense , and juicy ; superior example of balance in a NEIPA .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: Simple put this beer be perfection . rich , creamy , smooth while burst with tropical juice goodness . the balance be perfect which be what separate the truly elite beer above the rest . Wish be be available all the time ....

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: absurdly opaque yellow - tan with a minimal , bubbly white blanket .   Smell be sweaty mango and peach with dank af cannabis and a hint of biscuit , while taste continue to bring on mango , mostly green , with a touch of pine , and even more juicy peach .   the medium - thin body have a smooth , crisp carbonation that expand to a filling froth before a bone dry finish .   an unbalanced treat , but I actually enjoy regular a bit more .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: 12 oz bottle with a date that be hard to read but it be there and I be pretty sure it say " manifest on 9 - 18 - 18 " ( or something close ) . totally opaque and surely the most NEIPA of any " NEIPA " I 've try to date when it come to the hazy train . Murky pale orange / yellow color ... hard to describe . 1/2 " white head with fall to a cap rather quickly . no lace . juicy with pineapple and berry aroma . orange too and grapefruit - the red type . orange - pineapple juice . it be good but that be what it be ... not much complexity . full bodied and round mouthfeel . very easy to drink and very little bitterness . some heat . a touch of a dry out of the mouth affect late . it be very good , but I be at a 4 ... no more .

product_name: Ghost In The Machine - Double Dry-Hopped
product_review: merky af , sludge status . bright white head be fluffy and leave some nice lace . pleasant aromas of lemon , grapefruit , mango , dankness , pine . palate follow with a candy fruit melange up front - peach , orange , mango , grapefruit come to mind . bitterness provide by grapefruity and piney bitterness on the back end , some herbaceous danky note . the mouthfeel be thick , pretty fluffy but borderline chalkyness as it warm .

this TIPA meet my expectation , which be high . I would highly recommend seek out this one .

this be an amazingly balanced triple . you do n’t even know you be get mule kick . have it in Waitsfield , and take a 4 pack home and have it a couple week later . I love the double well , but this be pretty special too

have Triple Sunshine pour from 12 - oz . can , bottom stamp " CANNED ON 07/07/20 , " gift from friend , into Teku tulip 3.0 .   pour bright gold with one finger of near - white head , which do n't last and leave only a little lace . give this one time . cold off the pour , it be pine - sol . as it warm , or if you start it close to proper temp . , it be floral and fruity , pineapple , tropical funk , and backing malt . on drinking , it be funky , brandied fruit , over big malt , with alcohol warm up the finish .

this be so extremely floral , feel like you be chew some flower . it be one of a kind , I never find anything that be like it . very sweet but you do n't feel it be overpower , on the other hand , you still able to taste all the other complex flavor . alcohol nicely hide . a beer that I 'll definitely miss .

12 oz can - date 07/?/20 - pour into an IPA glass at fridge temp . purchase at Novare Res for $ 9 per can ( ouch ! )   pour a fairly clear - slightly foggy deep honey golden hue , top with a finger of simple white head that quickly recede to a perfect collar , leave no lacing behind . no visible streaming .   Nose : a bed of pale malt with a touch of toasty caramel malt support a mellow tropical bouquet of lychee , mango , papaya , pineapple , peach gummy ring , tangerine , and green pear . some secondary aroma of grapefruit peel , fir needle , earthy boil Simcoe , and coconut sugar round it out .   palate : the beer greet the palate with a blast of sweet biscuity caramel malt , lend a flavour not dissimilar to honey , follow by candy tangerine , papaya , peach candy , apricot , and a touch of pineapple . the malt sweetness be quite intense , and take awhile to peak . when it do , it be still sweet , but lessen enough to allow some grapefruit pith , and pineapple - like acidity to cut through a bit . the finish see some pithy bitterness , some hoppy floral note , with a hint of pine sap , and that distinct boil Simcoe note . nice resinous pithy linger .   mouthfeel / body : the beer drink truly full - bodied , heavy , slick , sticky , and sweet - almost syrupy . sweetness cling and linger , perhaps almost cloyingly . effervescence be pretty low , which do n't help , and the only respite be the finish , which help dry it out slightly .   overall : this be a very highly - rate IPA , so it have a lot to live up to . unfortunately , I ca n't say that I can put this up with the very good of the good . it be intensely sweet , syrupy , and cloying , and oddly enough , I think it be under - hop . there just be n't any bitterness or intensely pithy , resinous bite to cut through that sweetness . it be barleywine sweet , and not IPA bitter . I find Double Sunshine ( very bitter ) to be superior , and Sip might be the good . a great beer to experience , but not one I 'll revisit . if you like very sweet and malty ipa , then you 'll enjoy this one .

12 oz can date 7/29/20 .   pour clear gold with s chill haze . a short head of white retreat quickly reveal a partial skim coat with minor lacing . pungently tropical and juicy in the nose . pineapple , mango , peach , tangerine , and apricot . medium body with a sticky , tacky mouthfeel . candied citru on the palate with light malt and some throat warmth . a fruit cocktail of pineapple , pear , mango , and orange pith . finish a bit sweet and bitter with linger tropical and booze .

can 20 Nov. Thanks , Rick .   a clear copper with a dense off - white head with good retention and lace this look great . the nose be boozy , bitter , pungent and unabashedly over the top . sweet ? yes . Honey ? be you do ask question or do I have to hold you upside down and smack you ? yes , maybe , yes and yes . sweet pineapple and melon be present along with some lychee . the palate open sweet , boozy and brash with pine and grapefruit bitterness with a lot of sweetness , candy orange , sweeten orange peel , orange marmalade , a little honey and a simple malt sweetness . date : November 10 , 2019 ... occasion : a good sport Sunday hope to end with a cavs win and the utmost Sunshine , courtesy of Brad ... GLASSWARE : Lindemans stem tulip ... this look like the heart of a sun -- a dense , opaque , brood orange body , complete with white solar flare turn to coral lacing ... a kerosene - like pine power , burn the nostril with pineapple , grapefruit , and stone fruit .... leaf and dank basement also mingle , but this be bear of a singular goal -- to crush the tastebud luponically ... first sip bend the lip to its will , thick and buzz with a near syrupy density ... the weight require this to be experience in slow , thoughtful sip -- this be somewhat crunchy , but the alcohol subtract some of the welcome punch of its other Sunshine iteration ... warm start to finish , settle into a fruity cordial - like memory at the throat ... the predominant flavor be grapefruit and pineapple , bold and juicy ... flower petal , light herb , and a stinging apple be its last trace ... I might enjoy the Sip or Double a bit more , as both engage with this flavor but also drink at an more efficient pace ... still , tough to throw dart at a beer this steep in the hop and this succulent to the palate .... Brad , one more time -- thank !

I take a smell of the beer , and at that moment I be assure by the USDA that I have consume my daily requirement of fruit , as this beer be big on fruit ! a smash to the head with passionfruit , follow closely by succulent guava , cantaloupe and mango .   there be no way that a stablemate of Nelson can be well taste , could it ? at time , I think that Keene Idea have climb Mount Everest to be with Nelson . while overall it do n't quite hit that stratospheric peak , Keene Idea be undoubtedly outstanding beer . the beer be not bitter , yet full of hoppiness and more . the taste of orange , passionfruit , and guava be unashamedly fantastic , and that alcohol level do not cross the palate immediately , far make my pint dangerously drinkable . it be full bodied and very smooth , and already be such a great beer , feel that this beer be not play fair . 335ml bottle - 2017 vintage ( 10/05/2017 ) - pour into a balloon glass at 50 ° F .   pour a deep , dark mahogany brown , sit absolutely inky jet black in the glass . a super short head of coarse dark tan bubble form , before quickly recede to a razor - thin , but , persistent collar .   Nose : definitely that Bell 's barrel - aged aroma here . much like BA Expo , which make up half of this , there be a big , dense fudgy aroma , with plenty of dark cocoa - like roast , caramel , and marzipan , with secondary note of american tobacco , vanilla , leather , and bourbon barrel . there be some sign of age here - mildly fade aroma , as well as some unique note - musty , a whisper of umami , with a hint of fresh spearmint , and a metallic penny note as well , the latter of which be slightly detracting , but only slightly .   palate : Black Note greet the palate malt - first , with a moderate sweetness . dark chocolate , caramel , vanilla , toffee , roasted malt , and a surprising fruitiness . big plummy dark fruit note - mainly prune , plum , dry cherry , and bourbon - y apple lend a bright fruity pop , with a touch of acidity . this dark fruit element cut through much of the malty sweetness , create a shortcut for the roastiness to come in . dark malt , barrel char , roast , and cacao nib begin to build a mild - moderate bitterness , and the bourbon character begin to bloom . at this point , it begin to dry out fast , roast take over the sweetness , and dark fruit fade , as the beer barrel towards a finish with nutty malt milk , hazelnut , cocoa powder , a bit of black roast , barrel char , and ultimately conclude with dry oak and a linger vanilla cream note .   body : I can not say whether or not this be the age , but this one be definitely thin . unlike BA Expo , or even Vanilla Black Note ( which be not a super thick stout ) , this one be definitely a little runny , lack any and all chew or viscosity . definitely some effervescence , and it be fairly full ( perhaps medium - full ) bodied , but it be very fluid and thin .   overall : with Barrel - Aged Expedition be a personal favourite of mine , I have high hope for this one . I be think maybe BA Expo be really just the good quality of this in one thread . it be a perfectly delicious bourbon barrel - age stout , with a particularly fine malt balance and unique creamy nuttiness , but with its subdue aroma , dry delivery , and ultra - thin body , it fall short for I . super drinkable , if that be what you want , but I find the Vanilla variant far superior , and BA Expo to be the ultimate expression .

Flavor be a touch milky to start ( somewhat thin ) , but then form a bit more character with tobacco , earth , and finally on the finish it all come together - bourbon , rich chocolate , oats , and leather on the aftertaste .   feel be thin to start , then begin a medium profile , and finally a thick juicy finish with a roasty dryness .   overall , this be the 2nd 2016 bottle I 've have this year , and I remember the first one be well . this seem to have some issue regard smell a bit vinegary and ashy , with the flavor really lack until the finish . I remember the first bottle be flavorful all the way through . sad , but I have one more bottle I can take care of yet before my 2016 stash be deplete .   rate with price in mind ( $ 6 / bottle ) .   4.25 / 3.75 / 4 / 3.75 / 4 = 3.93

pretty high bar to set , describe it as share quality with Expedition and the feel of double Cream . also a beer that I 've long want to try . but my first experience largely live up to the high billing .   Jet black body with cola - brown edge . not as viscous or thick as I expect , but it be certainly a big and bold look stout . handsome mocha cap of latte head that collapse quite quickly but leave a strong circumferential ring of chocolate foam that provide spotty lace down the glass . swirl of the glass produce moderate alcohol leg and renew mocha film that compliment the jet black coloring extremely well .   the aroma and taste profile be as expect , with huge burst of dark chocolate , roasty and toasty malt , divine dark fruit , exotic wood , licorice , brown sugar , and barrel char . the nose be masterfully layer , with no single note dominate and each whiff lead with something different . on the tongue you get an add streak of whiskey heat and molasse sweetness , with strong barrel personality -- toffee , oak , and a little maple -- stand out . there be perhaps just a tad too much black licorice for my liking , but that be pretty nit - picky . it be not a sweet stout , at all , but the semi - sweetness and strong bitterness balance each other out beautifully .   feel be thin than I expect and be hope for ( especially give the Double Cream reference ) , but it be incredibly smooth and silky with just a wee bit of stickiness . reasonably carbonate and very little boozy heat .

Phenomenal . near perfect Drinkability and finish . this beer be smooth and perfectly balanced . you will not get a traditional place punchbof hop like most imperial stout and that be not a bad thing .

after Flora Pear , this be my favorite Flora . excellent barrel character have be impart into the beer . pour a beautiful deep gold , big wine nose , effervescent with plum dance in the background . fantastic .

pour a straw gold . nose of plum , Lemon , hay , and traditional HF nose . taste follow with a well blend plum , lemon , hay , minimal acid . feel be light / medium with medium carb . overall , this be an excellent fruit beer that be well balanced with the base beer .

Alan , I can not thank you enough for this bottle .   375ml bottle - 2018 vintage - pour into a wide tulip at 44 ° F .   pour a clear , yet ever - so - slightly foggy true gold hue , with all but a loose ring of white foam form , that stick around permanently . some lazy effervescence be visible .   Nose : in classic Hill Farmstead form , the aroma be beautifully delicate and fragile , begin with subtle note of malt and wheat , with a rustic sort of grainy note about it . atop this , gentle acidity and beautiful minerality act as a conduit for a melange of bright vinous fruit in the form of lemon , pear , apple , nectarine , white grape , and gooseberry , and then this subtle , yet spectacular dark fruit note that be quietly jammy , sweet , and plummet , almost evoke a hint of grape juice and grape pixie stix . finally , thread of oak , hay , grass , attic , leather , parchment , wet moss , and petrichor stitch it a together . absolutely spectacular .   palate : immediately , the define note of the base beer - Florence , be beautifully showcase here , round by maturity . she greet the palate with the most restrained acidity with a hint of lemon - lime , and then that unique floral , fresh coriander - eucalyptus note peak through . bright fresh fruity note of pear , gooseberry , white wine grape , underripe plum , and tart plum skin all play together , surround by a racey , vibrant minerality that sparkle over the palate . there be a subtle thread of funk , lending damp earth , moss , hay , wet oak , white grape pomace , river stone , and a whisper if dusty brett , before the lemon - lime and exotic fruity floral note resurface . a slight minty / camphoraceous element cool the palate , and then the oak come in to dry out the fruity bit . Flora Plum finish dry and clean , with a faint hint of grain , and zero acidity .   Mouthfeel / body : delicate , light , and crisp , yet manage to avoid be watery or lack in any way . perfect gentle acidity , which be compliment by a zippy , sparkling minerality , and lively , but delicate effervescence . perfectly dry with just a hint of fruity sweetness and plum - skin tartness . subtle dry oak , and as clean as you could imagine .   overall : this be a truly spectacular farmhouse ale . I think blueberry be divine , yet I believe this exceed it - and I be a sucker for blueberry . it be just so delicate , elegant , and tasteful , while truly convey all the character of Florence , soften by oak and time , and deliver this subtle , but beautiful fruity plum influence . there be a reason this beer be so highly revered . practically flawless , and utterly Hill Farmstead .

display a unique color of lightly foggy pale orange or even crayon peach , a moderately dense white blanket settle down to a curl , quietly active ring .   the nose have faint , mildly dusty oak pair with a pleasantly subtle floral perfume that be just hypnotizing .   uniquely and cleanly juicy , a lightly herbal , drupe - influence sort of pear character with just a kiss of tartness be dreamily weave throughout the zippy effervescence of its satisfyingly palate massage medium - light body before come to a vanish semi - dry swallow . Hill Farmstead Flora Plum   I ’ve be very excited to try this beer courtesy of   by way of background I ’ve never have a fruit beer from Hill Farmstead beer , and I ’ve never have the base beer , Florence .   look : the first thing I notice be the beautiful color of this beer . it ’s pour a translucent and slightly hazy appearance . the color match what be describe as the pale , pinkish orange color on the inside of a plum . if I have to name the color in would say " pink champagne . " bone white head that settle to a thin layer across the top , a thing ring of bubble around the edge . one of the prettiest , and most uniquely color beer I have ever see .   Smell : Fruity , acidic , funky , all in unison . Peach and plum fruitiness with lemon and white vinegar acidity . the funk come through as body odor and hint of plastic . sweet , floral aroma . a touch powdery . some light berry note include strawberry and raspberry . there be a dry , crackery , wheat - like component to the beer . the most complex aspect of this beer .   taste : on the tip of the tongue some lemon z and juicy plum sweetness . then the tart acidity take over . tart , unripe plum , plum skin , lemon warhead . the beer dry out quickly . there be not really any funk come through on the flavor profile . I assume the wine barrel use for this beer hold white wine as oppose to red wine .   feel : low carbonation and very light on the palate . very dry with tart acidity hit the jowel .   overall : a delicate and highly drinkable beer . it ’ not the most intense or complex saison that I ’ve have , but it ’ right up my alley with the fruit and acidity . it ’ a beautiful expression of plum . it have some funk on the nose , but the flavor profile rely exclusively on the fruit and acidity . really excellent . clean and crisp .

insanely tart and funky , bright acidity , lemon , white grape , ripe ripe berry quality , hay , oak , barnyard character , spicy pepper note , just really complex funky sour quality . its aggressive but so perfectly execute .

2018 release .   a : pour a very light pale , hazy , kind of berliner - like , with a cap of bright white head which quickly fizzle out to a sharp ring . nicely effervescent . minimal retention and no lacing .   s : moderate sour plum and grainy wheat , hefty amount of barnyard funk and a hint of spice .   t : rich juicy plum and wheat , light earthy funk , finish with a crisp medium - light tartness on a fairly lengthy finish .   m : medium - high , somewhat sharp carbonation . light body .   o : Tasty , refreshing , drinkable , and exceptionally well balanced . the sourness be restrain and the fruit be delicious .

03/2016 - I want to like this more but the nose be just unpleasant to I - it smell like plastic , basically . thankfully , the palate be chock full of plum , nice oakiness , juicy fruit , with a touch of tartness in back ; the finish be creamy , tart , and have a solid acidity .

pour from a 375ml bottle into a HF bulb . batch 2 . thank Ryan for share this .   pour a pinkish - purple hazy body with a one finger frothy head . do n't leave much lacing or retention . pour from a 375ml bottle into a perennial wine glass . pour the color of ruby red grapefruit juice with some soapy white head which die down to form a white collar around the glass . smell of fresh plum , lemon and grapefruit plus oak and a tinge of white wine . it have a much lively acidic nose than most HF . taste be citrus and plum with lemon and oak . not really sour at all . refreshing and super easy and enjoyable to drink . mouthfeel be full with a nice amount of carbonation . not overly so but enough to give it a lively spritziness . overall , the well fruit flora I ’ve have and one of my favorite HF saison .

I have the great fortune of share a bottle of Flora Plum with a close friend when visit Cape Cod in the summer of 2018 . quite possibly the good sour I 've have . beautiful color and such delicate flavor , worth the money ( which be substantial , I think this be the most expensive glass of beer I 've be lucky enough to enjoy ) , truly spectacular .

Flora Plum batch 2   pour a hazed peach pulp color beer with a dense , stable head to it .   have a floral barnyard characteristic on the nose , consist of wet hay , wild flower , fresh plug mushroom , lemon pulp , leather and in this case fruity , sour plum . the plum get an awesomly intriguing appearance on the nose , with a soft stone quality come through , together with a sweet note , result from the plum skin .   very silk on the tongue , this provide a soft , acidic drive plum richness from the start till the end , with a pleasant , fruity sweet note cut through the tartness .   taste of hay and a stony mineral quality together with a lemony , funky tartness , reveal dust and leather , but also a flowery aspect . plum get detectable once the initial , pungent tartness die down by reveal an enjoyable , bright fruit pulp sweetness among prickly lemon and an aqueous softness . finish with more lemon , a late plum pulp sweetness and its initial flowery quality .   come well together with an enjoyable plum presence , bring quite a few facett to the foundation of the beer , without dominate the taste . light body , very tart and aqueous during the finish .

juicy ripe plum pick and appropriately time to perfection in this beer . incredible nectar and plenty of gleeky - sourness to it without the harsh finish , very smooth on the way down . this be hand down one of the very well fruit saison I 've ever have the pleasure to try . the pour be a hazy yellow trillium ipa with minimal lacing around the edge of the glass . bottle share by Curran on my wedding day- thank a ton man .   this pour a hazy orange - ish color , with a small head , and a bit of lacing .   smell like tart and super juicy plum , with lot of oak , a little bit of citrusy funk , and plum skin .   this be absolutely delicious . there be so much wonderful barrel oakiness that permeate everything . this be very very tart , and pretty sour , with lot of citrusy and typical HF like funk , and also lot of fleshy and juicy plum . it be hard to find fault with this one .   this be lighter bodied , with a crisp , juicy mouthfeel , and a nice linger sourness .   Awesome , awesome stuff , and one of Hill Farmstead 's definite good entry .

product_review: very good head production , and good retention . body be a deep , dark hue , close to ebony .   absolutely huge nose , swarm with tone of chocolate and vanilla ( and I be not even sure chocolate be add to this beer ) . bourbon be fairly restrain , but add a nicely sweet mash . no real coffee note . deep and rich malt base .   similarly thick , rich , and sweet on the palate , but with plenty of bourbon and oak , last all the way through the finish with some boozy heat . absolutely delicious , with a crazy amount of vanilla , rich chocolate and brown sugar tone , and plenty of coffee , all wrap in a warm , lush blanket of bourbon . the boozy heat announce the high ABV , but it be incredibly smooth , thick , and drinkable .

Light - moderate pine , herbal , floral , grassy bitterness ; and yeast spiciness on the finish . linger note of milk / dark chocolate , cocoa , caramel , brown sugar , coffee , vanilla , bourbon , coconut , toasted oak , and dark / brown bread ; with light note of molasse , toffee , and yeast / oak earthiness on the finish for a while . fantastic complexity , robustness , and balance of dark / roast / bready malt , vanilla , and bourbon barrel flavor ; with an amazing malt / bitterness , and bourbon / oak spiciness balance ; with no cloy sweetness after the finish . medium carbonation and medium - full body ; with a VERY silky , velvety , and slick mouthfeel that be fantastic . minimal warm alcohol for 13.4 % . overall this be an amazing BBA imperial stout . all around amazing complexity , robustness , and balance of dark / roast / bready malt , vanilla , and bourbon barrel flavor ; very smooth and dangerously easy to sip on for the huge ABV . a highly enjoyable offering , and amazing style example .

most recent batch . thank , Sam !   a clear light orange with a dense white head with excellent retention and lace this look great . the nose be super ripe , fruity , floral apricot with a lactic saison adjacent base . delicately floral fruit note , probably from the Pinot Noir cask , be present , though this do n't have a real red wine character . Vanilla to go with ripe apricot . Awesome . the fruit expression be sublime .   the palate open with a blend of lactic tartness , mildly yogurt like with lot of fresh apricot . just ton of it , though in a nuanced , delicate way rather than the unabashed abandon that be fou'foune . no real funk here , this be fruit and acidity in perfect harmony . Vanillin , delicately fruity Pinot Noir , a nice tannin character be all present . dry , lactic , fruity on the finish with lot of linger apricot . tannin and a little grain round out the finish . SARA beer aspire for a high ideal in the mouthfeel category , and this beer deliver . light , airy , parfait - like with ton of fine carbonation , just enough to lift the fruit heavy beer but not so much that it be anywhere close to be foamy . Gentle , coax , prod , this be a truly excellent beer .   in contrast to the fresh Fantasia I have a couple of night back- this have more fruit , more sourness but less funk and less depth outside the fruit . they be both equally good interpretation of the style , and I can see my preference flip flopping .

get a chance to try this brew during beer taste with a friend . as always , Anchorage not only impress with the content inside the bottle , but also outside .   A&S : appearance be maybe the most lacking characteristic of this beer . unsurprisingly for a high ABV beer , it do n't contain much head ( head at all actually ) . the color of the beer be a muddy brown - black . thick look even when pour . the aroma be boozy upfront , after time become super sweet . other note include caramel , molasse , vanilla , and plum ( in no particular order )   T&M : incredible build over time . it be hard to predict what your go to get because this beer be constantly change even long after sip . these be some of the flavor we be able to identify ( in no particular order of dominance ): marshmallow , dark fruit , current , macaron , molasse , vanilla , and plum . the mouthfeel be impressive because it be simultaneously thick and carbonate . super tongue coating , keep the taste hang around and evolve on your palate over time .   overall : first off , truly mind - blow ! this beer clearly stand out as special even in a tasting that include Abraxas ( which also happen to land in my top 10 of all time ) . when rating beer , I try my good to consider my personal bias toward certain style and not give a high rating to particular beer because they be the style I like . barleywine be definitely one of my favorite style , and this beer be excellent for that style . this beer be also unique in that I could n't stop think even day after try it . only a handful of beer have have such an impression on I . highly , highly , highly recommend this beer even for the high price tag .

I be not always a big fan of barleywine , but this one absolutely knock my sock off . everything about this big boy be , paradoxically , in your face , and yet , very nuanced . lot of candy molasse , toffee , caramel , drambuie , cognac , orange and lemon z , kiwi , strawberry , date , vanilla , oak , and even a touch of the kind of tartness one might find in a world class lambic . 2019 vintage - pour into a wine stem at 45 ° F .   pour a bright , translucent ruby stone red , with half a finger of pinkish - white head form , and then immediately settle to a thin collar . simple , but very pretty .   Nose : soft grainy base , with raw wheat and dusty grain silo , beneath a very bright , vibrant fruit layer . this be n't deep , saturate , sweet grape , but young , fresh , and juicy . some underlie jammy note of red currant , blackberry , raspberry , peak through , with a deep red wine note come in and out of focus . some gooseberry , pear , and lemon note lend brightness and fruity acidity atop a very restrained , young funk presence , with hay , stable , leather , wet oak , petrichor , grass , and topsoil .   palate : Saint Lamvinus greet the palate with a mildly tart spark , pair perfectly with a thread of sweetness . I believe both the grain * and * the fruit be lend some sugar here . bright , yet musty grape , with a touch of red berry , abd then the bright note emerge , showcase lemon , gooseberry , white grape , and unripe stone fruit . with this , the tartness increase , become fully dry , with high minerality open the door for classic Cantillon funk - sea shell , salty air , old wet oak , hay , damp soil , and an almost brie / bloomy rind neutral musty note . some significant oak tannin emerge , alongside a subtle , tonic - like bitterness . tartness disappear , finish with red wine cask , grape skin , and grapefruit pith .   Mouthfeel / body : this seem to have find its sweet spot , with 7 % ABV balance between enough grain to lend presence , but not enough to advance from the background . delicate and fluid , but enough body to lend a softness . effervescence be extremely fine and gentle , but still fairly fizzy . not pucker - tartness be keep in check , and allow for a progression of dryness . balanced tannin .   overall : a delicate , expressive , and definitively Cantillon Cantillon . the grape presence appear simple at first , but unfurl with some subtle but complex depth , pair with just the right amount of complimentary funk . the subtle suggestion of sweetness be beautiful , and the lambic proceed with these little " chapter " of flavour . remarkably balanced and approachable , with an elegant simplicity .
