can on 10/9/18   pour a bright , deeply hazy orange with over a finger of semi - thick , pillowy white head ; decent retention with fair bit of lacing trickle around the glass .   Aromas of creamy orange , candy pineapple , melon , bit of fresh grass and light , plush herbal tone ; the citrus punch to this bouquet be level , pointedly hoppy , and incredibly enjoyable and easy to nose .   taste be juicy orange , apricot , peach , guava , faint grass , light hop , and a delicate malty sweetness ; consistent profile pack with citrus , tropical , hoppy , and slightly creamy note all in the right place .   Mouthfeel bring slight creaminess , a balanced carbonation , and an excellent , big body that betray itself coolly with a consistent softness on the palate throughout ; light bitterness from the mid - palate to the finish add a refreshing hop prickle .   excellent example of balance in a NEIPA . everything be on point , with a consistency never neglect flavor while still maintain a calm synchronicity with a varied mouthfeel . never overwhelming , and the type of NEIPA I could drink repeatedly . very well - do .

have this on 2018 - 10 - 31 in Columbia , PA from a 16 oz can on 2018 - 10 - 09   a - very hazy orange with a 1/3 - finger white head and good lace .   S - Melon , pineapple , peach , orange , biscuit , mildly dank . sweet and invite .   t - Pineapple , apricot , orange , melon , biscuit , onion grass and herbal spice . Orange z and pine bitterness in the finish be just the right amount .   M - Medium body and light - medium carbonation . smooth , soft , chalky and pleasantly resinous with a mild prickle at the end .   o - a step up from Melcher Street . really a first rate brew with an aroma and flavor profile that work well for I .

pour an opaque orange with nearly two finger of white foam . head retention be okay . Aroma be orange , papaya , pine , dank , and tangerine , mingle tropical fruit juice with bite Northwest hop . Wheaty , biscuity , toasty malt shine through in the middle . flavor profile be orange , tangerine , papaya , peach , pine , and light dank . aside from the abundant hop , wheat and biscuity malt show through . mouth feel be lightly effervescent with a chalky , grainy texture . it have a medium viscosity . overall , flavorful and dense , bit less juicy and smooth from other trillium offering .   serve in a 12 oz snifter from a 16 oz can .
3 day old   Frothy and hazy . sweet citrus , honey , resin - juicy . taste be sweet with ton of light malt . Grapefruit and honey . hardly any bitterness   Legitimately one of the good ipa I 've have

pour from the can into a Spiegelau IPA glass . Canned July 30th 2018 .   Frothy and sudsy off white tall reach nearly four finger tall head . slight swiss cheese bubble in its makeup , and a slow dissolve . mild turbid body , a bit brown dull with a hint of lifeless sense to it and dull lemon yellow as well . faint soapy cling to the glass .   Aroma be dank earth and a soft sense of malt . hint in the weedy range quite easily but be rather one dimensional but a good simple one .   Palate be fairly tasty but not break any major ground . juice nicely but stay away from tropical or citrus and some how make a nice earthy levitation . rich amount of dank and almost weedy / woody smoke like flavor . control nicely , and within a very good abv range that be right in the perfect spot for consumption . a good touch of light white sugar malt on the finish , but dust light sweetness for a contrast , but also not much roaring bitterness either .   very unique dank angle , almost dank rich and I want to say tropical but without the fruitiness which be nice . there be an interesting chewy component to this as well , but strangely this be a brew I would think seem like another dank take that be n't really that groundbreake or mindblowing . however , there be much great balance and zone in that it rate overall very highly . quite and odd duck I must say .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: I have to differ from the crowd on this review … I find this to have a so - so taste nondescript smell and a somewhat disagreeable pine aftertaste . maybe it be a bad batch . got it on April 25 , 2020 from the Canton brewery .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: pour a slightly murky starburst dark orange with a finger and a half of white foam . head retention be good . Aroma be earthy , citrusy , tropical fruity hop with a sprig of bready and earthy malt . together it net out a modestly sweet aroma . flavor profile be tropical fruit and citrus pack in front of a lightly rindy , earthy , herbal hop blend . hop be stack on top of bready and earthy malt . mouth feel be medium in thickness with a very soft carbonate texture . overall , fun and playful with slightly rindy earthy , citrusy hop that keep it drink smooth and balanced . not a typical juice bomb .   serve in a 15.5 oz Speigalau tulip from a 16 oz can .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: from a 16 oz can date 11/12/19 into a pint glass . pour a very murky , nearly opaque brownish yellow with about a finger of white head . not much retention or lace to speak of . strong smell of pineapple and grapefruit . taste follow the nose , mostly pineapple with some hop bitterness and citrus tang . pretty soft mouthfeel . overall , another great brew from Trillium !

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: 16 oz can , date 7/11/19 , be in my fridge since then   hazy , mostly opaque medium yellow color , foamy white head . aroma be nice well rounded fruity hop aroma - orange , papaya , mango . taste be similar , somewhat sweet , but with an underlie medium bitterness . medium bodied .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: this beer pour hazy orange with moderate white head . not super thick hazy like some NE style . but you ca n't see thru it . big smell of that vegetal onion mosaic pineapple that be typical from that hop . the flavor follow the nose . all Mosaic . kind of disappointing because the dry hopping over power the entire beer . it be a mosaic bomb unfortunately , and I do not love that hop . love the Galaxy version of this

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: can on 05/06/19 and pick up at the Fort Point / Seaport brewery . nose and flavor be invite and delicious , with lot of those Mosaic quality . Pine , pungent citrus fruit like mango , and fresh spring grassy goodness . Soooo smooth and creamy in the finish and feel . one of the fine example of a properly - hop APA with everything you look for in the style and in a craft beer in general . one of those beer you could drink every day without complaint .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: yeah , this be old as the date on the bottom of the can read 10/4/17 and yes , I have a ton of beer to get through here at my house . with that be say , I be n't sure why this be rate so high . maybe it be the name on the label or the nature of the hopping but overall , this be an average beer that do n't stand out in any particular way to I , even if there be hardly any sediment from it be in my basement for all this time ...   not a bad pour to this as the liquid be a deep apricot with enough fluffy head to top it off . quite cloudy , only a bit of sediment float in it and hardly any light get in around the edge . very little soapy lace be see along the back of my pint glass as I work my way through this , which be a bit of a surprise . load of Mosaic , dankness , grass , and forest in the mute nose as they all come through in the taste . nothing heavy here and the Barley stand out more than anything else in the taste , as this feel quite full but uninspire at the same time . a lack of easily discernible bitterness stand out to I as this go right down and although it be n't bad , it need quite a bit more to stand out from Trillium 's other offering that I 've have .   not a lot of booze here either as this be the epitome of what a generic American Pale Ale be , in my eye . I need to get a fresh can of this but give how well their other offering have hold up well over time , this one be a bit of a letdown . I prefer the regular Fort Point and know that it be I , and not they , when it come to how low I rate this . need another go before I fully write it off !

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: I 've be on and off with mosaic for a few year now - I be a fan of how soft it make a beer , and Fort Point be no exception . this beer also exemplify the mosaic effect - it be quite green and grassy , and while that be great , I be not sure that I get the hype . the beer be quite drinkable and tasty , but it be certainly no Citra - hopping .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: kid ! always bring back trillium when you visit Boston ! like you do n’t know that . 16 oz . can date 10/4/18 .   the pour be thick , phlegm - like yellow that smell like grapefruit perfume cut with pine . not bad .   Mosaic Dry Hopped Fort Point lean hard enough into grapefruit it might fall out of the car . Grapefruit for kilometer , kiwi , spring floral , touch of mint , with a nice bitter finish . Dry . easy enough to drink , which might be its calling card .   I ca n’t speak for the masse ( but I will anyways ) , but this appear to be a classic case of " this be Trillllllium!”-itis . a good , solid beer , but nothing to rise above many other , especially with all the genuinely excellent beer in their portfolio .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: thank you Jon for hook I up with this one !   Pint can date 10/04/18 pink dot . pour into a tulip at 44f   pour a pretty hazy , rich honey golden , with a fluffy , two - finger ever - so - slightly off - white head , slowly slink down to small patchy island of film , and a little collar . some spotty lacing . absolutely beautiful color .   Nose be dank dank dank Mosaic hop . that dark fruit / berry aroma , with a big impression of passionfruit and over - ripe mango . some Meyer lemon action in there as well . sweet , dank , and tropical fruity . very Mosaic .   Palate be very dank . there be a fragile malt backbone , provide just a touch of sweetness , but the hop be the star of the show here . the malt here be just enough of a platform to securely showcase the huge Mosaic dry hopping headline . big dankness . that passionfruit be much more muted on the palate , with more of a berry / starfruit / mango vibe . it be still fruity , but the scale be tip way in favor the dank side . a very restrained bitterness come in towards the finish , take this fruity dankness , and dry it out to chalky proportion . balanced . uber hoppy . this drink way more like an IPA than an APA .   Mouthfeel be crisp , but medium bodied . it have some good heft to it . a lot of body for the ABV . it be soft and super juicy up front , and then the dryness come in on the finish , dry it out very fast . carbonation be medium and strong , and give it a little bit of lift .   overall , this be a fantastic pale ale . it have so much flavor . I do n't think you could make this anymore flavorful . the Mosaic dry - hopping be great . the quintessential essence of Mosaic . the nose be to die for , and the feel be great . Absolute Mosaic flavor bomb . my first offering from Trillium , and I be impressed . score a touch low , because I still have some killer beer to review ( Galaxy Cutting Tiles ) and I do n't want to over - rate myself into a corner . this be fantastic . if you love Mosaic like I do , you need this .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: another winner from Trillium , this look good , smell delicious and have a ton of citrus note that showcase grapefruit , clementine , guava , orange peel , lemon , tangerine , biscuit , toasted grain , faint caramel and piney note . well balanced and smooth , delicious as usual .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: very nice APA . slightly pinkish in color and very fruity , with melon and passionfruit stand out on the nose and palate . nice soft texture . Delicious and quaffable , though it escape I why this beer be rate high than many of their other ipa and dipa on this website .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: can from the brewery in Fort Point in Boston , MA , whilst in town for EBF . pour a hazy bright orange with a white fluffy head and soft lacing , smell like guava - peach grape must and pine resin dip citrus candy , taste be biscuity malt sweetness with hint of nectarine and tangerine , finish with a mildly bitter white wine mustiness , light bodied . a dry and fruity pale ale .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: this beer pour a cloudy , deep golden orange color with a creamy , frothy , bright white head . retention be excellent and there be many webs and ring of lacing leave on the glass .   Smell be grapefruit , herbal earthiness , lemon , tangerine and mango .   taste follow suit , but the fruit mix with the herbal , earthiness and bitterness seem to get muddle a little bit . it be still very good , but not as robust as the smell suggest .   feel be light and crisp with a dry finish . there be a slight stickiness on the finish as well from the hop oil .   overall this be a very good beer . not my favorite version of Fort Point , but still very enjoyable .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: Canned 11/15 . a nice murky honey - tea color with a tall , tall poofy head of 3 finger . ton of gob of lace leave behind .   such a refreshing nose . should be make into a summer candle . effervescence of pear , spritzer , honey , apple , melon , and lemon float up to the nose in an ocean wave - like wafting . ever so slight dank at the tail end of the nose .   Flavor be juicy , although I can tell it have fade just a touch as there be some note that I can sense the shadow of but not quite full - on . nice pineapple , banana peel , orange , bubble gum , starfruit , and mango all form together for a soft but easy profile .   feel be creamy and soft all the way , and have a nice resiny touch at the finish .   overall , I 've have more than my fair share of trillium beer and they possess a softness and supple quality that no other brewer have yet to accomplish . such a treat . love my trillium .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: a : hazy yellow gold with nice white foamy head and sticky lacing . n : hop , citrus , floral , and biscuit . t : follow the nose , very clean and refreshing Pale Ale . m : medium o : this be a very nice APA , clean and load with flavor .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: can on 11/15/17 open on 12/6/17   pour out a rather sexy orange hue gold with yellow highlight . hazy ... practically opaque with a white , bubbly foam matter that fizzle slow . only the slight scattering of foam andva minimal but present ring around tge edge of the glasd remain .   the nose be overwhelm by dank hop .... freshly crush up whole cone hop , very earthy .... wet forest on a mid july morning , herbal and spicy , hefty grain of the harvest , lightly sweet fruity note , grandma 's spice rack and a sweet , but light honey bite from the malt . Extraordinary .   this Pale Ale certainly give many ipa 's a " run for the money " in hop - complexity . a very freshly harvest hop flavor prove to be impressive , green , leafy veggie , mango , starfruit , pineapple juice all seem to be within the earthy and herbal dominate hop affect . spring water and herbal malty flavor seem rather odd .... herb , veggie and hearty grain make up the pale malt flavor . tangy wheat malt with seriously sweet and sour fruit and herb sum it up well . a very low ... almost void - of bitterness style hop edge seem just a bit strange . Thr hops seem very fresh , but also mild in the finish , perhaps an effect of tge mosaic strain be the dry hop choice ?   layer of flavor 's from the hop happen in subtle way , from tropical juice of starfruit and pineapple , to earthy , sour herb . the layer be also obvious in the mouthfeel , juicy medium body , dry and peppery middle with a long , malty and juicy finish .   favorite aspect be the seriously fresh tasting hop complexity , with earthy and non - bitter tropucal fruit note . a very melliw vibe with multiple layer of complexity . odd and interesting .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: thank you to my friend at Carmine Street Tap Room . I will always patronize an establishment that just does't sell beer , they love it .   there be something pleasant about balance the undeniable greatness of bitterness . this be something that trillium might do well than any other brewer . bitter be the quintessential taste that complexity find in mastery . well do .   l : Thick like honey appearance S : Tropical almost cherry serve the middle of a grapefruit t : great fruity upfront , linger to bitter rind of melon , to a hint of dough , to the last drop of squeeze by hand creme brûlée grapefruit finish f : light than I expect , almost session like . clean , with dank undertone o : trillium be a masterful brewery , this mosaic dry hop Fort Point pale ale be a highlight in my beer repertoire .   a special note : somehow , trillium with their simplistic use of generic canning , with a stick and peel label , win the packaging award of 2017 .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: 16 oz can purchase at the brewery date 11/15/17 . hazy orange color and a fruity / hoppy nose . flavor such as peach , mango , pineapple and a touch of grapefruit come through . a very tasty , smooth and enjoyable beer with very little bitterness on the finish . one of our favorite trillium offering .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: thank you canconphilly for this 16 oz can , date 10/4/17 , pour into a teku   a- a hazy golden orange with a two finger white head .   s- really big and abrasive hop , tropical fruit , citrus z , mango , grapefruit .   T- Citrus / citrus z , tropical fruit , piney finish , kind of weak compare to the other Fort Points I ’ve try .   M- smooth , medium body .   O- a solid beer , but fall short of a lot of other beer trillium brew .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: taste from can . pour a hazy gold with white head . Aroma be lemon , herbal and some tropical note . well balanced . flavor of citrus , a little pine and some melon and other tropical note . awesome pale ale .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: hazed dark orange with a finger - and - a - half of antique white head . thick lace . Mango , peach and a peppery - burn - herbal thing in the nose . similar tasting with a sweet tea impression on the back end . medium body with heavy carbonation . not my favorite in this series . 10/4/17 can on date .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: go to Boston from Alabama with the express goal of get the New England IPA experience ( this be an APA I know ) . almost every IPA live up to their hype ; however , I must say this one be ride trillium 's hype train . that say , everything else from Trillium nail it . look : moderately hazy dark orange with several small floatie . only trillium beer try with any distinguishable sediment . still a very pretty beer . smell : citrus and earthy flower . no grass or weed . taste : Citrus with significant bitterness . not the juiciness find in their other beer . feel : great light body for an APA . almost heavy enough for a light IPA . overall : definitely a great beer . no doubt there . I must say , after have their other beer , trillium offer significantly well . one issue be that there be no date on the can , but it be buy directly from the brewery so assume a couple week old maximum . if anyone in the Southeast would like to know what this be like , go grab a can of Tropicalia from Creature Comforts . that be what come to mind while drink it .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: a : body be a very orange juice color body . there be n't much head or lace in the beginning . enough carbonation to keep a small head and a light lacing while drink . Color be good but head / lacing be lack .   s : big fruity smell out of the can . Grapefruit seem to be the predominant smell . also pick up some orange and lemon . very good aroma .   t : the taste mimick the smell well . however , the orange seem to overpower the grapefruit .   m : very soft mouthfeel . easy drink beer . the carbonation have a slight tingle / burn feel to it . flavor of this one hide the booze well .   o : very good beer . only thing miss be the head / lace on the appearance .. everything else about the beer be top notch .

product_name: Fort Point Pale Ale - Mosaic Dry Hopped
product_review: from an undated can ( which I buy at the brewery 2 day ago , so assume it be very fresh ) , pour a deep , hazy orange . minimal head and lacing . Smell be incredibly complex , with a big blast of strawberry , follow by passionfruit , orange , tangerine , lemon and mango .   Taste be initially a huge hit of fresh pink grapefruit , like fresh - squeeze juice , before transition to a parade of other citrus and tropical fruit . earthy note , a hint of malt . big , dry , wonderfully bitter finish . feel be on the light side . of all the beer I have from a recent trip to trillium , this be my favorite . wish I 'd buy more .

375 ml cork and cage green bottle , Cardinal Pub & Bar , Stavanger . ABV be 6 % . the cork pop out as son as the " cage " wire be open . the glass fill completely with white foam , and the slightly hazy golden beer appear slowly underneath . intense and lovely aroma of farmhouse kitchen , white wine vinegar and oxidise cider apple . smaken er intenst sur og snerpende , med preg av sitron og brettanomyce , og en merkbar bitterhet I avslutningen .

l : Golden / orange with a touch of haze , thin head , and little lacing .   s : Honey , flower , apricot , a touch of vinegar . funky note intermingle as well , some classic Brett barnyard character . Bready malt .   t : very tart and tangy , apricot , honey crisp apple , honey , and some citrus flavor . some bready malt on the finish , but stay fruity and sour the whole way through .   f : moderate body , fine carb but nice crispness . Dry finish .   overall : an absolute pleasure of a beer . not super sour either , even for a vintage from 2018 . I highly recommend this to any fan of the style .

22 March 2020 - beer # 55 - BA Top 250 Alert !   Corona Day # 10   price : $ 59.99 at Healthy Spirits 15th Street in San Francisco   appearance : 5 - a glow apricot orange . thick bubbly head for day .   Nose : 4 - yeah , it be a Gueuze for well or bad . for some reason I always get a briny kind of smell on these , like vinegar or pickle . here be one : you know what your piss smell like after you have asparagus ? this .   taste : 4 - not as good as the Cuvee Armand & Gaston , which be my favorite Gueuze . hefty vinegar / pickle here . intensely flavor , though . action pack .   Mouth : 5 - tremendous . extremely effervescent . the sourness and acidity make my mouth water even though it be already wet . impressive . that be a pretty great description , so I copy / paste from the Hommage review .   overall : 4 - an excellent example of the style , and one I be glad I got to try . wish I have go to the other store that have the half size for half price , but hey , you only live once .   cheer !

season 16|17 Blend no . 51 - drink November 2nd , 2019 while clean out a few bottle of lambic . what truly stand out to I about this blend be that it be quite absent the typical apple that define many geuze - the tart and sour note be far more present , and the beer do n't have quite the same body . lot of oak note dominate as well . it be funky , but only lightly so .   quite a terrific beer . I be not sure that I 'd rate it significantly superior to Drie Fonteinen 's standard Oude Geuze though ( that be say , I absolutely adore the standard geuze ... it amaze I that it be a shelfie in certain part of the country ) .

pour a clear , deep golden amber coloration with a small , fizzy head . Smell be dominate by quite rich , musty , blue cheese funk and tart and fruity yeast ester of green apple , pear and gooseberry , as well as some lemongrass , hay and musty oak . taste be a superb balance of quite rich and nuanced musty , moldy , cheesy funk , expressive , tart , fruity and slightly spicy yeast ester of green apple , pear , apricot , white grape , gooseberry , lemongrass , clove and white pepper as well as a distinct earthy , musty oak presence and light note of hay , white vinegar and sulphur . finish with a medium tartness and some rich funky and estery note linger in the aftertaste . Smooth , effervescent mouthfeel with a medium / rich body and medium / strong carbonation .   what really stand out here be the rich , complex and quite nuanced funkiness that range from sweaty , musty note to moldy blue cheese and mushroom , be back up and balance by an assertive , but not overpower lactic acidity and tart , estery fruit , with quite an array of fruity note and light spicy accent as well as a not too heavy , but distinct earthy , musty oak presence , make for a quite a rich , complex , yet superbly balanced Geuze , with no aspect of the flavor profile feeling overpower while still mainte a tremenduous depth of flavor . without a doubt the good and most funky Geuze I 've ever have , with a superb complexity and sublime balance .

funktastic old bottle that I split with my dad and two guy from NYC that we meet at the tasting room outside of Brussels , Belgium . beautiful atmosphere for a one of a kind sour . definitely acquire taste but if you like the style you be in for a treat .

2014 vintage ; drink 6/22/19 @ Golgi Apparatus .   a delightful , fruity , balanced geueze that showcase the brewer 's art to the nth degree . have this in a share with a lot of heavy hitter , and it be my favorite . ca n't wait to have another ...

2014 vintage pour a medium gold with great carbonation . ton of tart , barnyard aroma and funk on the nose . same in term of flavor along with a stone fruit that I ca n’t put my finger on with a soft mouthfeel and low acidity and a crisp dry finish . absolutely love this beer .

I 've have a few Geueze before but I believe this be the one I like the good . full of flavor , tart , oak , yet smooth and easy drinking at the same time . it be delicious .   look : semi - clear golden - amber with a thin fizzy white head   Aroma : green apple , lemon , orange , oak   taste : green apple , lemon , orange , white grape , champagne , oak , a tad of yeast .   feel : light and somewhat bubbly , champagne like

pour and unclear golden straw color , with fine , fizzy head .   Smell be tart and citrusy with hint of funk and mineral , along with lemon peel and a little bit of grass .   taste be bright and citrusy , mainly Seville orange and lemon . hint of funk , champagne , some mineral and just a perfect acidity . sourness and acidity be both strong , but never overpower or mouthpuckere . complexity be sublime .   Mouthfeel be thin and sparkling , very champagne - like .   overall , an absolute world class gueuze . perfectly balanced and so deep and complex without be intimidate .

big fizzy foamy head , good lacing , semi clean tan orange   Nose load of awesome gueuze , good funk , tart , little fruit like , barnyard grassy hay   taste more of the same funk , grassy barnyard funk , hay , little fruity like , just a great gueuze blend   Mouth be me bod , ton of carb

this have be a beer I ve want to get into for a really long time , I know it change from blend to blend , but I be able to have the 2017 vintage that have some honey in it recently , I believe the first time golden blend have contain honey , and there be a cute little bee on the label to designate this vintage , still comprise of 25 % 4 year lambic . its incredibly effervescent in the glass to my surprise , fizzy like a soda , and even have some lemon and lime soda aromatic to it . I get the floral polleny raw honey element in the nose as well , not sweet , but obviously and distinctively honey to I , with a very mature lambic character , wheaty , more puckery than some other I have have from these guy , and with a great musty danky funk to it as well , bright and woody at the same time , musty and fresh at the same time , earthy and clean at the same time , its crazy stuff ! for how little honey be actually in here , I be surprised how well I can taste it through the layer of various lambic in this blend , I get a nice acidic pop up front and at the end , with a more wheaty malty middle and some decay oak , vanilla , orange z , green apple , champagne , and wet grass in the morning . the integration of the different vintage be awesome , and the sort of concentrated funkiness from the old lambic be really evident . this really be an amazing expression of their fermentation profile , more distinctive here than in any other of their beer I have have . I know this one be pretty new , but I love what the honey do to it . it make I that much more excited to open the super old one that exist in my cellar ...

shimmer burn honey amber with a large , fuzzy white foam that cling in very large ridge .   this 4 or more year old blend be very crackery and toasty of sesame seed character with a super mature , mild sourness that at first contribute lemon , grapefruit , and complex spicy funk that be far more balanced and mellow than a young blend might be . as it come to temperature , crack black pepper and apple cider develop , bring this to a very comforting , old world delight .   Golden Blend have a medium body with a light froth and a tingly dry finish .   what a fantastic brew !   ---   have a blend 37 from season 19 - 20 in September 2021 , I be find this mind - blowingly , startlingly clean . this be relative not just to any old 3F gueuze , but even to my past review of Golden Blend -- of which I be not sure the vintage , but it be definitely a paper label 375 .   it be just insanely clean and fluffy -- and bright -- exhibit characteristic of apricot , white wine and pear . it be as if fruit by white wine grape , while far less acidic than you would expect from a fruit 3f. and clearly , it be not actually fruit . still , it be all the white grape .   I ca n't get over its super drinkability . my 4.36 score be get upped .

2014 vintage . pour from a 750ml bottle into a Drie Fonteinen tumbler glass . thank emily for get this for my birthday !   pour a deep orange , lightly hazy body with a big , frothy off - white head with a yellow ring around the head that stick around for a while .   Aromas be funky and musty , with oak and damp cellar , lemongrass and hay , citrus , lightly grassy and a tad skunky . on the tongue it be lightly tart with barnyard funk but not overly funk , oak and citrus , yeasty , a little bitterness on the follow through , dry aftertaste . lightly carbonate but super easy to drink , medium - light body .   this be fantastic - complex and balanced , so flavorful . 4 year do it well !

a summary of " all " of my FEB 2011 bottle that I 've open since ~2013 :   bottle 1 : can see the potential , inferior to A&T. Bottle 2 : slowly develop , stray from A&T to Core . bottle 3 : the same trend , head to a stunning batch of Core . ..... bottle 9 : Worlds collide and form the perfect Geuze some time between 2015 & 2016 , at or around five year since release .   the good Geuze be Golden Blend ( if after Fruit Tingles + always carbonate ) , Armand & Tommy ( if after the epitome of that classic 3F style ) , and the Seasons ( if after a stunning funk - f ) .   all remain bottle be now only pop for special occasion ( must have one per year though ! ) . if you see a Batch # 1 Golden Blend , buy it .

file this review under : really expensive beer that I hate because it be so delicious .   pour a slightly dark color of gold than your average gueuze . Super thin 1/6 " white head . batch 4 , bottled 5/21/2015 .   appearance - pour a pale straw yellow that be slightly opaque , but you can vaguely see through it . it be golden hue resemble more a glass of Chardonnay than beer , but the narrow , dense , snow - white head give it away . what the head lack in height it more than make up for in retention , as it never fully dissipate ; even when it finally sink , it coat nearly the entire surface with a thin film of foam . bubble of carbonation lackadaisically rise to the surface every now then , but they be sparse .   Aroma - the aroma be a blend of fresh - cut grass , lemon peel , nectarine , subtle graininess , and finally a burst of white grape at the end . it be altogether cohesive and summon and subtle tartness that tie everything together . the fruitiness of it make it infinitely refreshing to smell , and the acidity couple with the almost tropical - like fruit blend be nearly flawless in execution . the barrel be integrate seamlessly , with wave of oak , vanilla , and finally the wine itself wash over the other note without overpower they .   taste - after my first sip , I be surprised at how acidic art actually be compare to what I perceive in the aroma ; to be fair , in contrast to other beer it be n't overly acidic , but it come across more than I expect . after a few more try to acclimate , it be easy to swallow . the grape - lemon z combo be still king and why not , since it be so good ? Lemongrass and the grain come next to light the load , before finally the fruit emerge again to carry this to the finish . the tartness kick the flavor up to a whole new level . the wine be a bit more present here and it contribute a slight booziness that ooze into the other flavor to give they that barrel - kiss feeling . the vanilla fall away here , leave the oak to drive home the barrel note .   Mouthfeel - the mouthfeel be probably the only thing I can fault art on , in my opinion . I be expect more carbonation base on the style , but it fall pretty low on spectrum , and a bit more would 've make this even well . otherwise , this be very nice . it be light on the palate and be just dry enough to make it super refreshing .   Closing argument - as my first foray into Hill Farmstead 's barrel - aged program , and really , to the brewery itself ( I 've never really try many of their beer even though they be always on my radar ever since I have Ephraim way back in early 2011 ) , I do n't know what to expect with art . happily , I can easily proclaim this be near the top , if not the top , of my saison list . it be flawless in almost every way besides the carbonation , and I could drink this endlessly - especially in the summer heat .

huge thank to Steve for this one . this have be on my radar for quite some time .   750ml bottle ( vintage ? ? ) pour into a classic tulip . refrigerate for 5 day - allow to warm up for 10 minute .   pour a brilliant honey straw golden colour , top with a quick - to - dissipate finger of off white head . excellent unfiltered clarity , and plenty of visible effervescence rise up to create a sparkling top . minimal lace after swirl .   Nose : rustic saison grain , likely a good amount of wheat . Crackery . plenty of classic saison yeast aroma of wet hay , peppery spice , green apple , a faint hint of bubblegum , a whisper of clove , some woody spice , fresh cut grass , wet wool , petrichor , some delicate farmy funk , a hint of leather , and a wonderfully restrained acidity lend a big shroud of lemon . a beautiful saison aroma .   palate : Bernice greet the palate with what be likely the most balanced acidity I 've ever encounter . this be not a " Midwest saison " that make you pucker up from top to bottom . a gentle tartness akin to unripe berry start thing off , while this delicate grainy sweetness follow . beneath this sweet - tart balance be note of lemon , apple , Bartlett pear , fresh grass , white grape , unripe berry , starfruit , fresh nectarine , white plum , a hint of phenolic black peppercorn , and dry orange peel . there be quite a bit of dusty brett , lend some light funk , wet wood , a gentle earthiness , ferment stone fruit , and a gentle peach pit bitterness . there be subtle grassy floral note from some very restrained hopping , which be greatly appreciate . the finish put particular emphasis on these grassy floral note , along with some dusty brett funk , and a gentle black pepper bite . the ale finish beautifully dry , with zero linger tartness , and a gentle , clean aftertaste of cracker saison grain , with the faint whisper of tannic fruit pit .   Mouthfeel / body : the ale be medium - light bodied . Crisp , refreshing , and ultra snappy with the malt provide just enough body to provide a subtle softness . effervescence be lively and fine , without be scratchy or seltzery . gentle acidity upfront provide a balanced tartness , conclude with just the perfect degree of tannic dryness . highly attenuate .   overall : this be maybe the perfect all - around saison . it be absolutely authentic and beautifully classic in nature , with the most balanced amount of acidity you could possibly get in an ale like this . not puckering , but enough to just nudge this into sour ale territory . this be everything you could ask for in a saison . authenticity , perfect grain balance , gentle tartness , excellent yeast complexity , belgian influence , crisp , refreshing body ... it be wonderful . you wo n't find the complexity of the heavy hitter sour in this , but if it be the perfect saison you be look for , Bernice will take you there . Privileged to be able to drink this .

330 ml bottled , blue cap stamp well by 12.07.21 , so about a year and a half old . bring back from Belgium about a year ago and cellare since   pour a dark brown , with big foamy khaki colored head . pretty good head retention , eventually fade down to a thin covering , but that stay to the bottom of the glass . aroma be earthy , leathery , some dark rum , burn sugar , and tobacco . taste have similar flavor , but very dry . medium bodied , carbonation be fairly high when I first start drink , but it mellow out .   now I swirl the yeast from the bottom of the bottle and pour in . the aroma be a bit more estery and herbal . and the taste be a bit more bold and a touch spicy .

the beer pour a foamy and heavy head with a light brown note to it . the beer itself be a dark brown color that be opaque and look very nice . the smell be pretty good . it have an earth floral hop note upfront that mix well with the dark and roasted toffee note with a fresh plum note in the finish . the taste be roughly the same but a strong and more bitter hop note with a light burn belgian sugar towards the end but end with the hop note . there be a light toffee note with a bit of berry underneath all of the hop note though it do get bury at time . one thing to note be that the note change as the beer warm up . when it warm up , the hop note recede into the background a bit and bring forth the malt and toffee note . the feeling be pretty good . it have a nice silky and cream texture to it even think it come off as watery on and off . the carbonation be light and soft . there be a slight dryness in the finish . overall , this a pretty good beer and worth drink . it be a simple beer that manage to be pretty good without have to turn into a Frankenstein 's monster with different ingredient .

Drank at the source Brown color with a thick thin beige head with short retention . aroma with note of prune , caramel , mild fresh floral hop , a bit of pine , nut , and some chocolate . flavor with note of floral and medicinal hop , some cocoa , mild candy sugar , prune , pine , nuts , spice , wood , orange peel , coriander , berry , fig , vanilla and green pineapple . Dry aftertaste with a decent bitterness . medium body with somewhat effervescent carbonation . alcohol of 8 % be completely absent . Aroma be a bit disappointing , but the mouth be quite nice give the fresh hop and complexity make this Dubbel as attractive as it can be . sure , it do not compare to its big brother the 12th ( unfair , different style ) , but I have to keep raise the grade once it warm up .

l -- pour a lovely mahogany - brown body with a massive , pillow , three - finger off - white head produce with gentle pour . fabulous retention and good lacing S -- Brown bread , honey , banana , fig , prune , raisin , gingerbread , slightly oxidize herbal hop T -- largely follow the nose . a little bit of an almost saffron - like character , which be cool . the malt and yeast really work together nicely F -- medium mouthfeel , medium+ carb . fluffy , soft mouthfeel and immensely drinkable o -- not quite of the caliber of Westy 12 but still damn good and a classic example of the style . dock a quarter of a point for the high price point , even in Belgium   89/100

Aroma of tart cherry , spice ( clove , something vaguely like gingerbread ) , lightly phenolic . like sniff a spicy holiday cake with some prune or raisin bake in . thin persistent off - white head , faint lacing . Colour be an opaque cola brown .   Flavour be rich -- bready -- but with noticeable hop bitterness . a bit sharp than Westmalle Dubbel , my personal favourite . More spice here , not overly sweet up front but a little sticky in the finish , aftertaste have a pleasant dry astringency that avoid the cloy character of some other ( mainly domestic / north american ) belgian beer of similar appearance . alcohol be not overly present , but be hard to miss . it be a warming brew , to be sure .   the fruit character be tilt towards the plum / raisin / prune side of thing . carbonation be noticeable but not excessive , have an almost creamy mouthfeel .   all in all , a very interesting , subtle and complex beer . the standout feature for I be the balance of malt / sugar - derive fruit character and hop bitterness .   I actually prefer Westmalle Dubbel , but this be an excellent beer on its own . I be not blow away , but it be enjoyable and worth try . I would n't go out of my way to sample it again , unlike fresh Westvleteren VI , which be well worth the effort .

right up front I get the classic dark fruit . plum , raisin and fig with a touch of dark cherry . the malt have a deep earthy and somewhat nutty quality with a very mild molasse like sweetness and bitterness play off each other . this be a beer I have be hear about and read about for what seem like forever , so it be awesome to finally get to try it , one of those beer of lore , always wonder how much well than everything else can something like this really be , and the answer be that it probably be considerably well than whatever anyone else be do with this style when it be first introduce more than a decade ago . now , it kind of just seem like another one . that s not a knock against it of course , it be clearly a pioneer beer and more of a trend setter than these guy probably could have imagine , less clear than what be popular at the time , but certainly not hazy for the sake of it , although this could be credit at least partially with make room for such thing . I love the hop complexion , I get the columbus way ahead of the galaxy , its so hoppy that I can almost taste the pellet , the greenness , the vegetal element not just the compound we desire in the beer . its juicy and its kind of sweet from the pale barley malt too , but there be a lot of orange juice , grapefruit z , and pine needle character here , very northwestern to I , slick and oily feeling and dense as can be , almost woody like lumber , and with a lot of body too , its a big one for sure , perfectly appropriately name . the bitterness be all after the swallow which be cool , its a long trajectory of flavor . citrus abound as well later on , a honey taste and richness in the middle , and very good , although possibly not as well refined and distinctive as I think it would be after all the hype over the year . I think , like pliny or something , that the rest of the field have catch up enough where this be nt as mindblowingly unique as it probably once be , but that do not diminish its excellence ...

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: 16 oz can , date 03.29.2021 , pour into a stemless wine glass .   the beer pour a very hazy and turbid orange color , amber hue with a foamy white head , about two finger tall with good retention and excellent lacing . the aroma be pleasant , lot of fragrant tropical fruit , pineapple , mango , berry fruit , tangy citrus peel , some dank weediness with a nice bright floral bouquet , pale dough , lactose sugar and sweet yeast . the flavor be good , very bright and tropical , lot of orange and grapefruit , pineapple and mango puree , a bit of creaminess , berry fruit emerge as it warm with a nice floral quality , soft dank and weediness , mild earthy bitterness with lot sweet yeast , mineral water , and soft pale dough . the mouthfeel be good , coating , creamy , fluffy medium body that finish easily , sweetly , and lightly dry .   verdict : a nice NEIPA from other half . super tropical and fruit forward with nice floral quality . it border on be too sweet for my palate , but there be just enough earthiness and tanginess that let this one toe the line fairly well .

Smell be mango and tropical but muted . not jump out of the glass taste be balanced . citrus tropical . ca n’t pony any specific flavor . finish slightly dry with a touch of sweetness . super easy to drink . great beer

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: big thank to VaTechPhilly for send this one ! review from note . pour from the 16 oz . can into a J. Wakefield OG Club teku glass . I do not make note of canning nor consumption date , but do note that the can be about three week old at the time of review . batch be from early 2018 .   a : turbid gold with orangish highlight , with a half - finger of white have that have decent retention . low visible carbonation , but be almost opaque .   s : tropical fruit for day , orange - forward citrus juice with a touch of ruby red grapefruit . pineapple and mango and some melon . some dank and herbal hop as well . light cracker malt . this be really juicy , but more melon pull through here than some other NE ipa – not a ding against it , but maybe not my preference . nice .   t : taste follow the nose pretty closely . juicy tropical fruit , melon , and citrus . Mango , pineapple , and perfectly ripe tangerine . milder dank earthiness , a mild citrus pith bitterness , and then more juicy citrus and melon . a light cracker malt body underneath , but the hop be obviously the star of the show . maybe a touch of fullness and soft breadiness from the oats , but it ’s not pronounce . mildly bitter in the hang with an orange juice - like fruitiness .   m : a medium body but this do have a creamy mouthfeel from the oats . this be accentuate by the relatively low carbonation sensation , but it fit this beer quite nicely . alcohol presence restrain .   o : really tasty . I think this be my second other Half beer , but the first that I ’ve have a full pour of - and it be really enjoyable . maybe a little more melon than would be a perfect hop profile for I personally . but very tasty .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream

Deep and layer hop aroma , punch in the nose of fruit / earth / resin .   layer of tropical fruit flavor with resinous , grassy , earthy hop . Citrus z and rind .   moderate carbonation and medium body , soft .   great mosaic flavor .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: a touch on the sweet side but this be a smooth and soft beer , delicious . not much head despite an aggressive pour but beautiful deep orange body . sweet citrus nose , light carbonation .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: L - Hazy , cloudy ...... 1 inch head ........ color be like an autumn leaf ....... not brown not yellow but somewhere in between ...... not very attractive   S - Aroma be faint ...... some tropical hop ......... mostly mango   T - great tasting ........ flavor be bright ....... orange , lemon , mango , tangerine , passionfruit ....... lot of fruit juice   F - Less than medium ....... slick ....... carb be moderate ...... ABV undetectable   o - great tasting brew that taste much well than it look ........ would buy again

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: 16 oz can pour into a tulip   a- pour a slightly hazy orange color with a one - finger foamy white head that reduce to a ring around the edge   s- herbaceous and load with tropical fruit on the nose ; mango , guava , pineapple , passionfruit , cantaloupe and grapefruit z . undertone of milk sugar and vanilla   t- bold tropical fruity hop up front with flavor of mango , pineapple , passionfruit and ripe melon , follow by a zesty citrus note of grapefruit and tangerine . mid - palate bring out some herbaceous note , along with a hint of milky lactose that add an element of vanilla . the finish continue with a onslaught of tropical fruity hop and linger of citru z , mango and hint of lactose sweetness   M- medium body with moderate carbonation lead to a foamy mouthfeel that turn into a creamy , crisp finish   O- an outstanding showcase of the mosaic hop that explode with tropical fruit throughout

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: pour a medium yellow color , hazy . amazing hop aroma - lot of tropical fruit : pineapple , guava , citrus . Wallop of dankness . very flavorful , I get lot of pineapple , dank guava , light pone , lemon z . carbonation be appropriate , kind of thick feel . overall an outstanding DIPA .   9/12/19 16 oz can , no date , prob 6 week old - thank Dave 4.25 rating

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: pour into a snifter . an opaque acorn yellow color with a medium sized soapy head . blueberry , papaya , and tangerine on the nose . the taste be typical Mosaic ( to I ) with all the above flavor . slightly sweet and the malt be restrain . the beer have some heft from the lactose , but not at milkshake level . creamy , smooth feel . outstanding .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: cloudy vibrant orange with a finger of yellowed head . thick ring of lacing .   Clementines , light white pepper , vanilla and herb in the nose .   light tasting than expect . water orange citrus and dull , piney , somewhat - chalky bitterness show the most when cold . as it warm , there ’s a hint more vanilla and herb .   medium bodied , relatively slick , with moderate carbonation .   very pretty look and decent - enough flavor , but it come across dull and water - down for an 8.5 % beer .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: pour a murky yellow color with a medium sized head , receede to a small ring of lacing .   smell of a profound , herb accompany lime quality , freshly dry kush and blueberry . this be quite remarkable on the nose , bring up a kiwi fruitiness , as well as dry green apple and pomelo , all help to enhance the profound lime impression .   have a full body , exhibit a creamy mouthfeel with a low , well fitting carbonation .   taste of a sudden lemon bitterness , inherit a noble , old world vibe among wet grass and blueberry . turn a little more refreshing then , although the mouthfeel seem to become even creamy with some kiwis and ice - bonbon cut through . finish with even more intense flavor of herb , lime and ice - bonbon with a light , last bitterness .   this taste and smell equally intense of mosaic , highlight by the beer‘s great mouthfeel . very convincing on all level , with just the right amount of bitterness in the end .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: pour a hazy golden orange with two finger of tightly form white head . the head fall fast than I expect . smell of orange , tangerine , some vanilla . taste follow , orange and tangerine , the sweetness be n't too over the top but just enough to give it an orange creamsicle taste . medium to full body , creamy texture , good carb level . overall a wonderful beer , well balanced , hop and sweet cream combine nicely .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: hazy yellow with a soft film and thick collar .   this be a milkshake IPA in disguise . Vanilla and Orange Julius flavor come through a creamy body that have a soft but tingly carbonation expand softly on the palate . this be accent by green eucalyptus and wild weed before the semi - dry finish bring out some smoothing oat , brighten Smarties and kiwi .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: pour from can /OH Roc release 4/19 . brief but beautiful plump fluffy head . dissipate quickly but excellent lacing . nose be quiet but noticeable rich orange / tangerine with some bubblegum . taste be rich . orange creamsicle with Mosaic on Mosaic . round with mild tangerine peel bitterness as beer finish . lactose evident ... milk / cream - sweetness . feel be SO Smooooth . Easy sip / swallow with reasonable brightness in otherwise soft carbonation . just about perfect for a DIPA ... to my preference anyway . notice when this sell out fast ... so heightened expectation . Oat / lactose contribution more in my wheelhouse , and swing this as more enjoyable than another fav ... TH Julius . now I know why . just a great IPA .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: decant from a 16 oz ( 473 ml ) can into a Captain Lawrence custom taste pint glass ; can on 4/16/19 . a : pour a cloudy orange - yellow color , with a no more than one finger , white head , limited retention , and nice complex ring of Brussels lace . s : Aromas of tangerine , tutti - fruity , grapefruit , and caramel predominate with a very light pine and oregano note . t : surprisingly dry , certainly at least semidry in my estimation . flavor be cracker with fruitiness more in the lemon , lime , white grapefruit end of citrus , some very real and pronounced graininess ( which add ) , a vegetable piece ( celery , oregano , dare I say cilantro ) and a cumin - like bitterness that be really , really interesting . m : medium to full bodied with moderate carbonation . creamy , juicy , and luscious . o : fascinating that an other Half " oat cream " NEIPA really be n't that sweet . not a criticism -- more an encouragement , keep experiment !

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: recently can , and it feel even well than the one I have in the brewery on tap a couple of week ago . and it be the same batch . for some reason , I think individual can be generally well than keg . quite hazy orange and peach juice aspect with a thick head with medium retention and leave lace . fresh tropical aroma to die for with note of mango , ton of stone fruit , passion fruit , pine , fresh squeeze orange , natural grapefruit and melon . flavor with note of mango , pine resin , melon , white pepper , oat , faint but perceivable milk powder , grapefruit , pineapple , papaya , tangerine , onion , biscuit , lychee and guava . Dry aftertaste with a strong bitterness that apparently feel . it make I sneeze after my first sip . alcohol of 8.5 % be very well disguised . medium velvety body with perfect carbonation . Delicious DIPA with beyond expect tropical note and green dank resin . great complexity and wide range of flavor match perfectly . at some point , I have to stop to far look for flavor . this have sit for 2 week and it sure well than the one I have from the same batch on tap in the brewery . I be start to think that we should drink the style fresh , but not that fresh .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: DDH double Mosaic Daydream have be on my wishlist for some time now - I be quite happy to try it when a fellow BA reach out to set up a trade . the can be quite fresh - less than two week old - and the beer be taste fantastic . pour in to a teku , the color be a lovely golden orange with a thick white head . Carb be light and the mouth feel be very pleasant - just a bit creamy , quite rich , and the finish be decently clean . it be quite definitely on the sweet side of the spectrum , and once it warm up , and trace of bitterness virtually disappear .   it be not a particularly balanced beer as far as hop go - it be definitely a very sweet IPA - but it be damn fine for what it be . that milk sugar be certainly present in the creaminess and sweetness ! I would n't want to sit on these beer - I ca n't imagine they will age well .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped Double Mosaic Daydream
product_review: * * 10/20/18 on tap at oh .   * * 10/23/18 can to wine glass .   big difference from Dream to Daydream be less citrus , more grassy .   result in less nose and a bit of offputting flavor in the finish . still excellent ... just take a backseat to the real " dream " .   * *

pour a turbid murky orange color - be very reminiscent of OJ . nose smell of OJ / citrus with a honey sweetness and a mild bitterness on the end . taste follow the nose , sweet citrus , follow by some bitterness but end with hop burn / resin that remain for a bit - the can be roll before opening . feel be viscous and think for an IIPA , but have very good carb . overall , this smell incredible and initial good taste , but the hop burn overtake the palate . maybe the hop need to dye down some - but this can be around a month old at this point . have two other can , and will open in increment over the next month . will update if the taste increase .

pour from a 16 oz . can into a trillium Willi Becher style glass , this beer pour out like a cross between mango and orange juice . form a thin crown that dissipate to only an outer ring , attach to the glass .   the nose bring a beautiful citrus mix with a very natural , sweet honey . wow . the way the two mix be amazing . Mango , orange , peach , honey and caramel all back by a dank background .   the taste come in with those dank , pronounce layer of citrus tangle through sweet layer of honey and caramel ; slight bubblegum want to come out but never do with much pronunciation , just as an accent . there be some floral note , but not too pronounce .   fairly clean with little to no sharpness ; slight bitterness but overall smooth and creamy on the mouthfeel .   overall , I love the way the honey and layer of sweetness interact with the pungent , citrus , earthy hop . it ’ a smooth , enjoyable brew .

16 oz can , break in the new trillium snifter . bright hazy golden yellow body , one finger frothy and thick latte white head , plenty of retention , lot of lacing . look positively appetizing . Smell be massive Galaxy aromatics- tropical fruit , grapefruit , mild herbal spice , floral note , mild caramel . the honey be n't really present here on the nose , but on the palate , it be there in spade at the end and finish , for sure . it be a wonderful mild honey sweetness that linger for a while . mild - moderate spicy bitterness , otherwise big but relatively balanced galaxy and caramel malt . this be pretty delicious , and the honey finish be really , really very nice . medium fuller body , good carbonation , silky smooth with a slight dry floral and herbal resin that be supplant by a mild linger sweet honey .

l : super thick , and crazy dark orange with complete haze . the head fade in less than 1 minute . this look like while fruit purée . s : a citrus bomb ! whole fruit with peel to add a touch of dank be a d balance . t : just awesome . it ’ all whole mango purée . juicy sweet with Rhine peel in the finish to make the back of my mouth clinch and want more ASAP F : so thick , creamy and smooth . usually word I use for ba stout with huge abv ’s , but this be right there . impressive

canned 8/16/18 ; drink 8/26/18 @ Harvest Hop Haus .   opaque yellow appearance .   Minimal white head ; minimal lace .   Pineapple , peach & faint dry grass note in the nose .   Medium mouthfeel .   Pineapple , peach & fresh spring water flavor up front ; faint dry grass note on the finish .   Refreshing & pleasantly dry ; delicious !

pour from a 16 oz can into a Willi Becher pint glass . l - pour a hazy orange with a white head that dissipate slowly . S - Smells of pineapple and mango . t - taste of tropical fruit with a nice bitterness . F - Medium body and carbonation with a little prickliness on the finish . o - excellent double IPA .

pour like orange juice with a finger of white head . smell sweet , honey , citrus , a bit of bubblegum , light pine . taste start with the resinous pine , turn to sweet fruit , peachy , honey , faint bubblegum note linger . medium to full body , smooth , amply carbed . overall a great beer !

l - 1 - finger offwhite head atop a glimmer orange juice body .   S - tropical fruit , honey . very invite .   t - grapefruit , melon , tangerine , with just a hint of honey sweetness . earthy middle . moderate bitterness . low sweetness . low booziness .   F - medium - full , creamy body with low than normal carb .   o - I be worried this would be too sweet , but it ’s perfectly balanced and a joy to drink .

can on 10/11/18   Pours opaque , glossy honey gold with about a finger of pillowy , white foam that recede pretty quickly in favor of thin layer of sticky lacing .   Aromas of raw honey meld with dank hop for an absolutely pungent bouquet form note of herbaceously sweet sugar cane and light note of rubber ; powerful stuff , and definitely an aroma I ’m find personally polarize .   taste bring plenty of herbal hop to start , build slowly in honeyed sweetness and saturate further tone of hop , pine , grapefruit z , and mango to an effect similar to the aroma .   Mouthfeel have a medium body with well - balanced carbonation , and actually reveal a certain level of prickly hop to the finish ; little to no bitterness , and surprisingly trend toward light on the palate .   maybe the most polarizing NEIPA I ’ve try to date ; I tend to like ipa on the pungent side , but the honey really bring this to a new level , one that be equal part confidently herbaceous and dramatically too dank .

one of the rare review I 'll do , not from stream - of - consciousness , but rather from note I write down . I drink this can in the mountain a few hour ago , in silence , save for the rushing river next to I . an experience .   a world of thank to Jon for this can .   Pint can date 10/11/18 - pour into a tulip at about 45 degree .   pour an unbelievable glowing neon orange juice color . completely opaque . creamy , milky , turbid , murky , all of it . haze for dayz . almost literally glow in the dark .   Nose have an undeniable dankness to it , and some exotic floral note I can not place . creamy and musty with round , yeasty note . very unique hopping . overall , the nose be mellow , but what it have go on be unique . truly smell like a hop galaxy , if that make any sense . I know it do n't .   Palate be earthy eucalyptus , lavendar , manuka honey note , vanilla , and some exotic floral accent , that I have not experience before . moderate to decent sweetness in the middle , and finish with ZERO bitterness . some Douglas fir ( piney lemon ) dryness , but absolutely no bitterness . finish floral , pine , eucalyptus , and yeast note . Vanilla linger extremely long into the finish . get what I can only describe as a birthday cake note . Cake batter . flavor profile be very round , full , floral , earthy , and impression of sweet thing without the sweetness .   Mouthfeel on this be truly divine , and even go toe to toe with Julius . Luscious , pillowy , soft , round , full . the word in a nutshell be fluffy . this be a fluffy beer . excellent carbonation give it a touch of lift , but do n't sharpen it . world class feel . amazing .   overall , this be a phenomenal beer . a truly delicious and pleasing beer . satisfy . exotic hop give unique floral impression that I have n't experience before . must be unique to Galaxy . restrain , balanced , and soft spoken . it do n't come out and demand you acknowledge it be presence . it remain quiet , mysterious , and alluring , and wait for you to come to it , recognize its greatness on your own . I enjoy every last drop of this beer , and will seek it out again at all cost . you should too , because it be a fantastic beer , with a fantastic feel , and some very unique character and nuance . Special .

Galaxy be not one of my favorite hop - I 'll be honest and just throw that out there .   that be say , there be thing about galaxy that I do like quite a lot . when combine with other hop , it tend to be a smorgasbord of sweet , clean , rich haze . cut Tiles deliver in spade - it be almost too sweet , but it do n't quite cross that border in to syrupy , which be good - I can not abide that in an IPA . the beer be still plenty drinkable and do n't have that fill quality that I hate . the bubble gum / cotton candy tasty that many attribute to galaxy be not all that forward - it be there , but not offensive or overwhelming .   I 'd generally prefer a Fort Point - but this specific variant of Cutting Tiles be quite good .

this beer be a beautiful expression of galaxy which I ’ll admit I ’m a galaxy fanboy . this be so tasty and the honey only smooth out the edge of the pine and sweet resin from the galaxy make it even well . perfect execution . the only tweak I would make to make it my number 1 beer ever ( beat be infinite by monkish , a DDH all galaxy imperial IPA ) would be to double dry hop this beer with more galaxy to bring out that grapefruit and grassy taste to the next level . phenomenal . well trilltive ever and it ’s not close .

Creamy - look dark OJ color with a thin finger of off - white head . nice lacing . huge aroma of weed , earthy smoke herb and nut . they carry over the taste , couple with orange juice , lime , pithy and piney bitterness and a peppery alcohol bite . some hop bite , too . full body with a prickly feel . there ’s a lot of depth and ton of alcohol in this one , but the nutty , smokey quality when fresh be n’t to my preference . I be interested to see how it change with some age .
08/2016 - while I enjoy the base beer , the Galaxy usage be top notch in my opinion . that say , the honey do a nice job balance the Galaxy ; tasty , refreshing , and super flavorful .

have on tap at the Trillium Garden on the Greenway a month or so back . super hazy and golden color . huge flavor of peach , citrus rind , honey , and resin attack the palate . it be very chewy and sticky in the mouth , a bit heavy in the stomach but still so very drinkable due to the flavor . this beer be incredible and the blend of wildflower honey with Galaxy be near perfect .

can . white head . super hazy golden sunset orange . look like juice .   this be one of trillium 's good beer and one of my favorite NE dipa . it be so soft with no bitterness or burn . tropical juice . Orange , pineapple , and mango . the wildflower honey must do something here , because the feel be incredible . this beer be way too drinkable for a double .

one of the good ipa I ’ve have . would put this just below Perm 32 for I . I remember have Mosaic Cutting Tiles last year , and think it be a mess . the new fermentation for these beer not only make the hop flavor pop , but also smooth they out and they look great in the glass . really , this be possibly the well look IPA I ’ve have . it ’s look like a puree of pineapple and orange , and have a thick , sticky head . the taste be like 32 , but a little more bite that I really like . they ’re knock these beer out of the park lately .

pour a very hazy , cloudy orange body with a two finger white head that reduce to a layer and leave spotty lace .   Aromas be heavy citrus and pillowy clementine , fruity and Inviting . taste be lightly sweet honey and pulpy citrus , tangerine , pineapple , almost no bitterness . creamy mouthfeel - very soft and easy , I ca n’t believe this be 8.3 % .   this be a real winner . Delicious and so flavorful , yet balanced and delicate .

date 5/18/18 on the bottom of the can , one week since brew .   pour an opaque soft pale yellow in the glass with a finger of dense white head . huge pungent citrus aroma upon crack open the can ; follow by a light earthiness , fresh pineapple , fresh apricot , summer flower , honey and a light wheat cracker . taste match the nose , think of a citrus marmalade w/ honey on a wheat cracker . at the end of the taste I get a little bit of ruby grapefruit pith and pine resin . fantastic ! I be a big fan of honey add to ipa and this really hit the spot . if you 've have Buzz from Night Shift , this be that brew big sible with a PhD. Super refined and smooth . Mouthfeel be a smooth medium with a little bit of prickly carbonation , low dryness but a medium- bitter kick at the very end of the sip . not the stereotypical fruit smoothie , it be get both a detectable honey sweetness and ruby grapefruit bitter kick . I wish I pick up more of these can during this batch !

this beer have the beautiful yellow appearance of egg white , which might be tacky if it be n't back up by an excellent smell of citrus and peach and a delectable taste of tangerine and brown sugar . trillium be on one with this masterpiece , which have a texture that feel thick , bite nicely , and finish crisp . this be one of the good , and I be very happy to be move to Boston next year in large part of the guy at Trillium .

I cansider myself very fortunate to have be the lucky winner of a buncha can in a recent lottery on a different social medium site . I merely have to pony up the cost of shipping , which be modest , in return for a buncha can for the CANQuest ( tm ) ! I have hear of & be certainly aware of Trillium B.C. , but I have not be trade in a while & so I do not give they much thought . I be now interested in drinking & review the entire Small Bird Series , especially Pipsqueak Penguin & Stumpy Duck since I have an affinity for the former & a rubber form of the latter who oversee my drinking & will be in an NBS pic later .   nowt to report from the stark grey & white CAN . 8= (   my last of the day for NBS ( Week 659 ) begin with a Crack ! follow by a gentle Glug , reveal yet another deeply cloudy , unfiltered beer . hmm . a vigorous in - glass swirl raise a brief finger of soapy , foamy , tawny head with limited retention , quickly reduce to wisp . Color be a milky , murky , cloudy Yellow - Gold ( SRM = 4 - 5 ) . nose smell of both tangerine/ sweet orange and honey , but it also have a bready yeastiness , like rise dough , that might have be avoid with some filtration . Mouthfeel be medium , but light for the style . the taste be kind of an oddball admixture of flavor , range from earthy , freshly - turn soil to sweet clover honey to rise bread dough to tangerine / sweet orange to a light alcohol heat that tingle my sinus cavity . phew ! it be certainly attention - get , but it also have a graininess that leave my mouth feel like it be coat in powder after each swallow . I cannot help but wonder what even a modicum of filtration might have do for this beer . Finish be dry , but not overly bitter , more citrusy than anything else . I be glad to have try it , but I be not as big a fan as other seem to have be , base on the overall score .

[ from Notes | consume 8/13/17 ]   @ trillium ( Canton )   glow cloudy orange color with minimal head . Aroma be thick with fruity hop dankness ... ripe passion fruit , fresh peach , pineapple juice , and nectarine . heavy fruity hop flavor , Galaxy bring deep juicy apricot , passion fruit , and tangerine . the underlie spicy , oily pine sap and herb dankness helps cut through the fructose . fullish , creamy , fluffy feel with a dry finish . big juicy awesomeness .

a 1 pint can , can on 26th July 2017 . pour into a lost Abbey teku glass .   appearance : a hazy dark yellow orange colour with a one finger white head that dissipate fairly quickly and leave only sparse lace . pour a golden hazy orange with a two finger head , quickly dissipate . smell of peppery hop , stone , earthy , with citrus . taste be a bitter bite into tropical fruit , juicy and sharp . linger bitterness on the end , little bit of booze burn . Mouthfeel be nice and chewy . not get much of the honey . this be likely my favorite of the cut tile hop variety . good beer .

really enjoy this . much less sweet than anticipate and have a nice chally baker chocolage predominace . the apple brandy taste genuine and natural whereas I feel I lot of prairie beer be try hard and artificial . namely vanilla noir which be awfully fake .   its not terribly complex . taste like a very simple , basic , strong old school RIS with roasty note layer with oak and yesz apple bransy . quite thick and very hot .

I have never really be a fan of the apple brandy BA stout . the apple character have always be an odd mix for I . I get this bottle for retail on the shelf mostly because I love Prairie and I know people flip for this beer . upon open it , the smell be very distinct and I just do n't like it ! it smell the way it be suppose to smell , it be just that the apple brandy barrel of off put to I . now on the tongue , it be a completely different story for I . the apple be there but distinct and really appealing . a tiny bit tart ? the stout 's sweetness work well with this barrel . it also help for it to be a bit warm too . a great beer that change my mind . I 've never have a beer with a smell that I do n't like end up be enjoyable before , so a really fun beer .
a spectacular stout ; as the previous reviewer explain the taste follow the nose - apple , malty , boozy . you must let this warm to experience the full flavor profile .
pour a Pitch black no head or lacing . 4 oz pour . apple brandy aroma . very mild roasting . More roast on taste . heavy on the brandy . apple on the end . medium body with moderate carbonation .

a beer that live up to the reputation . I ’ll get to the appearance at the end of the review , mostly because the smell and taste be the two most important part of this beer and for one other reason . Smell be boozy barrel up front with a healthy amount of warm apple to round it out . taste be more balanced , with the apple slightly lead the way and the boozy oaky barrel subtly surround it . feel be medium bodied , neither oily nor thick - a perfect example of " just right " . mouth watering , drink more like a non - barrel aged 9 or 10 % abv than a big bold 12 .   my only problem , however , be evident right off the open and pour . I open it and got hit with the apple and brandy before the cap come off , but I do n’t hear the usual noise one expect open a beer , because the one I have have little to no carbonation . it have a nice dark hue with some brown edging , but there be no foam and very little lacing . if they date their beer with the first three number be the date , this be bottled 9/26/18 . do a little online research , in October of last year , there be a release by Prairie that some of this beer be infect , so I do n’t know if that ’s the case here . but if this beer infect just mean the loss of carbonation , I ’d take an infected version of it over a lot of other beer out there . because this be phenomenal ! long time want , glad I get it .

12 oz bottle pour into a snifter . opaque dark brown with a thin tan head . aroma : chocolate , bourbon , vanilla , and subtle apple brandy . really nice . taste : follow the nose . great balance between the stout flavor , barrel , and apple brandy . Delicious . feel : full bodied but not overly sweet . overall : world class . live up to expectation .

12 oz , bottle purchase in OK . pour into Kane chalice and allow to warm .   l : small light tan head . leave no lacing but do have a persistent cap and ring . beer be dark black .   S : apple , brandy barrel , roasted malt , chocolate , floral and citrus hoppiness   t : well , this be something different . a big shot of apple brandy up front ( as a NJeyan , I be very familiar with Laird 's and this hit the mark ) and that flavor persist throughout transition to chocolate , roasted malt , and floral / citrus on the finish .   f : not quite full - bodied , but in the neighborhood . very lightly carbonate . construction be so very well - do , as these be difficult flavor to merge . balance be not quite there yet ; it could use more aging to round thing off .   o : very high degree of difficulty and it pull it off pretty nicely .

l : pour from a bottle to a snifter glass . have a jet black color and a thick , opaque consistency . there be a quarter inch of foamy , tan - colored head that quickly dissipate . average lacing .   s : a very enticing aroma of apple , wood , chocolate , roasted malt , hop , and toffee .   t : taste of a mild amount of hop ( mostly in the finish ) , a lot of chocolate ( a big component ) , a bit of toffee ( it hang around the edge ) , some roasted malt ( present throughout ) , and a lot of the apple brandy ( and its barrel ) . a complex , slightly subtle , well do flavor . it be not as aggressive as Prairie 's other stout , but it be definitely tasty stuff .   f : a so - so amount of carbonation with a silky smooth finish . medium - bodied .   o : a wholly enjoyable stout . drinkable .

can on 1/22/20   pour an oily , jet - black cap with ~¾ finger of fizzy khaki - mocha foam retreating from the center outward almost immediately to a consistent foamy collar , sporadic spatter of tight lacing , and an uncapped surface with a persistent effervescence .   Aroma show a heavy hit of creamy lactose opening into a peanut butter tone equal part roasty and creamy , as well as vanilla and a light espresso backing ; milk chocolate quickly grain a prominence firmly in the background as a bit of roast engage mildly over time .   taste bring espresso and lactose at the forefront , with a very passive peanut butter nuttiness barely perceptible in the background ; dry cocoa and swiss Miss shine on the mid - palate , while an aged lactose - espresso linger persist though the semi - sweet finish .   Mouthfeel offer a slick medium - heavy body with a delicate fizzy carbonation spread along the palate ; oily and increasingly sticky , but more subtly so against a steadily encroach dry roastiness into the finish .   a promising harmony ot peanut butter and espresso upfront fade rather quickly to a more mundane , though competently do , sweet stout profile ; the depth be there , but the note remain muddled and the promise peanut butter an afterthought . still , the late integration of roastier times leave this a relatively satisfying , if not top - tier , take on the style .
