enjoy out of a brown 750 ml bottle with a sticker denote it as be bottle on 9/13/2016 . consume as part of a small bottle share on 4/22 . pour into a teku style glass .   Appearance ( 4.25 ) - pour a vibrant yellow with just the slight twinge of orange give it a depth of color . not really terribly hazy , but it be also not completely translucent either -- likely from the fact that we have no lambic basket handy to keep the yeast confine to the bottom of the bottle . the dreg look like straight juice . not much of a head -- just a little bit and pretty much no lace to speak of .   Smell ( 4.5 ) - wonderful aroma of fresh - cut , ripe peach flesh be accentuate by underlie acidity and brightness from the wild bacteria . honestly , there be not much to write about the aroma because it be so simple and straightforward . the peach flavor be front and center , even though it be be seven month since bottle .   taste ( 4.5 ) - the flavor very much follow from the smell here , with the juicy flavor of fresh peach lead the way . provide support be a nice lemony , citric tartness that be enough to counterbalance the sweetness of the stone fruit . hide in the background be a bit more complexity , with shade of funkiness and a woody mustiness .   Mouthfeel ( 4.25 ) - light bodied and moderate to light carbonation . finish have just enough pucker to give your cheek that little pinch of sour .   Overall ( 4.5 ) , a fantastic beer and one of the most true to the flavor of peach that I can recall having try . I suppose I should n't be that surprised when two of the heavyweight of brew sour beer with fruit put their head together on a recipe . would be really curious to try the Side Project version .

batch 2 - 10/15/16 - enjoy at Casey .   just think about this beer make my mouth water . have it side by side with the Cut : Peach and the look of the Leaner be hazy and look more like a peach color than the much more bright yellow ( and also delicious ) Peach Cut . upon smell it you get the sense it be go to be intensely sour , and it be , but amazingly the peach flavor still shine through and it seem to be a perfect balance . as the Cut series be 5 % ABV , I be shocked to realize after I have a few sip that the Leaner be 8 % . the name be apropos , it taste like the most sour , juicy peach you 've ever have squeeze in a glass . killer beer , amazing to have in such close proximity with the westly , which although be apricot and not peach , make a great side by side . the beer be similar in some way , but this be much more interesting on the yeast front , much less sour , equally fruity . peach rule this one , drippy and ripe just like the namesake , aroma and flavor be the peak of ripeness , hardly sweet at all , just juicy and true , fuzzy and woody and awesome . soft yellowish orange beer , hazy and heady , well carbonate , dry , and who know it be so strong on the booze ? you do nt taste it in the least nor feel it at all . brett out in front of souring culture in this one for I , funky and layered and real mature . this must have spend quite a bit of time age , ferment all this fruit out . the peach be insane , yellow and burst out of this . in some way , the sourness take over the apricot in westly a bit , here , the fruit lead the way and be merely accentuate by the yeast . still plenty of acid , but a lot of nuance to it , maybe less wood , but more interesting I think . I like this as much as I like either westly or fuzzy from side project in isolation , and think if they make more of it , it would have to be one of the most hype beer ever . its immediately in that range with stuff like fou foune , cascade , allagash , and the other great peach or apricot lambic out there . lot of wheaty body , even oaty , fluffy and expansive , inviting , micro bubble be very active in it too . I could nt imagine this improve in any way , its a truly beautiful beer . thank to claystation for share it with we , a real treat , and a new high water mark for casey , and that s really say something if you have be keep up with their release lately ...   edit : leave my original score in place , but we drink a batch 1 from age ago this weekend and it really have change . acidity ramp way up , peach fade way back , and just a totally different brew , still compelling and complex and delicious by any standard , but a far cry from what it be when it be new and the fruit character be so explosive in here and the funk be on par with the sour . maybe not mean for extended cellaring ...

750ml bottle , first blend from the Casey side of the collaboration . serve in a stemmed glass .   pour a beautiful , hazy medium yellow body , one finger white head , great retention . pretty much identical to Side Project 's version . Smell be dripping with peach juice . it be more aggressive on the nose . but also more aggressive be the lactic acidity , which be a bit surprising as typically it be the Side Project that tend to have a reputation for be more acidic . a bit of cheese , fair bit of oak , mild dusty funk , but the nose be drive by peach , and there be peach for day ! Flavour be a bit more skewed in favor of the acidity . heavy lactic acidity with a touch of lemon seem to be the main theme here . same big peach flavour , but it be slightly overshadow . dusty funk , oak round thing out . Mouthfeel be medium bodied , good carbonation , but as say before , it be pretty heavy on the lactic acidity . I do n't mind it certainly , but I be wish it be dial back a bit so I could get even more of the peach on the background of oak and dust . that be say , I enjoy this one a bit more than the Side Project version . everything about SP 's version that be so well do have be amplify up to a 11 . so I guess it depend on what you be look for and what your preference be .

strike the difference between robust , decadent and drinkable land the double barrel aged version of Evil Twin 's imperial stout in no one 's land , but also everyone 's land .   double Barrel Jesus pour with an oily layering into the glass . like syrup , a patient swirl release a short statured but densely pack froth . Aromas of caramel , chocolate , coffee and sherry all align on the nose with a sultry sweet and savory scent . rich with malt , the early palate accept a lush taste of those promise chocolate , cake , caramel , cream and vanilla that sit in anticipation of flavor .   as the stout open up , its high sweetness only recede slighlty . Chocolate fudge , espresso , heavy cream , vanilla , molasse and brown sugar register soundly on the middle palate . moderately bitter , the internal woodsiness of the beer trend oaken , spicy and await a boozy kick of sherry , bourbon and peaten scotch whisky .   Decadent in taste and texture , the absolute fullness of the stout become marshmallowy , milkshake - like , and trail with a long , savory and woodsy nuttiness .

pour from a bomber into a tulip . the true motor - oil black pour . thick and black as can be . the nose be pure chocolate fudge - in fact , it smell identical to a chocolate ganache I make last week . the palate and mouthfeel be what really propel this beer to greatness . chocolate ganache blend perfectly with appropriately subtle barrel aging , and dark fruit start to emerge only as the beer warm . in term of mouthfeel , this be perhaps the thick beer I 've taste . it be an incredible tour - de - force of the style , and one that do the chocolate side of Imp Stouts in an appreciably fresh way . excellent .

this be my personal white whale . I 've be try to get my hand on this beer for year . even More Jesus be my favorite stout and I 've be die to try the BA version .   this beer pour a thick , dark than midnight , jet black with a late form , dense , dark brown with a tinge of maroon color head . it recede quickly to a sliver of a ring around the edge of the glass , and there be just a few spot of lacing .   Smell be chocolate fudge , bourbon , vanilla , toffee , brown sugar and sweet dark fruit .   taste be the same . start of sweet but definitely not cloy , with a nice mix of chocolate , vanilla , raisin and fig . that transition nicely into brown sugar and toffee mid sip and finish with a wonderful blend of bourbon and oak .   feel be thick , decadent , rich and velvety smooth with a slightly sticky finish . very low carbonation which make the body feel that much more full .   overall an excellent beer . the bourbon compliment the other flavor wonderfully and be not hot at all . my one complaint be that the subtle , smokey char that I love so much in emj be not present in the BA version . still an awesome beer , but I slightly prefer the original .

pour pitch black color with a 1 finger brown foamy head that be pack with tiny bubble , dissipate around average time but on the fast side for an imperial stout . it settle into a layer on top and leave minimal spotty lacing .   smell of dark chocolate , hot fudge , soy sauce , toffee , brown sugar , bourbon , light oaky or char wood note , cocoa powder , molasse , dark fruit like raisin and date , vanilla , piney hop , black coffee , milk chocolate and then booze like a dark rum or smoky bourbon . it be sweet but not cloy or over the top , allow the bourbon note and hop to straighten it out for a degree of balance - a beer this big be suppose to be roasted malt and booze dominant and it be , but the fruit and chocolate nuance make it wonderful to inhale .   taste simple , rich and maity yet at the same time very complex with dark chocolate , hot fudge , soy sauce , toffee , brown sugar , bourbon , light oaky or char wood note , cocoa powder , molasse , pumpernickel bread with raisin , dark fruit include fig , raisin and date , burn coffee grind , vanilla , black licorice , espresso , tobacco and some herbal / earthy note . fair amount of bitterness which blend well with the general malty and barrel influence sweetness , char and rich boozy flavor . the bourbon be not dominant like Founders KBS or Goose Island Bourbon County Brand Stout , but it be involve with every aspect of this beer and add a positive bourbon barrel influence across the board .   Mouthfeel be super smooth and velvety , with mild carbonation , a heavy body and feel that be almost thick and viscous . a meal in a glass if you will , this have a very mild bourbon burn , a kiss of bitterness and then a ton of fruity , roasted malt and chocolate sweetness which fade with woody bourbon note . to I it be perfect for such a big beer at 12 % ABV .   I have be seek this out for a year or two and finally get my hand on a few bottle , and this bottle live up to the hype even at this early stage of it be BBA stout life . I wish it have some more in your face bourbon , but the subtleness of the bourbon as be now be a wonderful accent which keeps jump out like a ninja . a fantastic imperial stout , I love it .

Smell : the nose on this beer suggest that it be decadence in a glass . up front - chocolate galore . rich , dark baker 's chocolate . all of the adjunct meld so well together with the imperial stout to create a fully integrate , rich aroma . the finish be warm cinnamon and vanilla . it be hard to pick out the ancho chile in the nose . it be a bit fruity on the front end , so maybe that be come from the ancho chile which foodie describe as a " spicy raisin " . the aroma on this beer remind I of a spiced chocolate cookie . what I find so entice about the aroma be that it have a creamy richness to it . there be a nice nuttiness in the aroma also - remind I of candy cinnamon almond . a touch of alcohol on the nose .   taste : it be so tasty , complex , and delicious . it be really not very sweet , yet from the list of adjunct one might jump to call this a " pastry stout " . very malty , the flavor be reminiscent of ovaltine or an adult hot chocolate ( mexican hot chocolate flavor , for sure ) . the finish be bold and robust , the slightly bitter roasted malt flavor linger long on my palate since the beer have such a full mouthfeel . there be a bit of acidity on the finish , and it work just fine here ( perhaps welcome ) . and there be warm spice on the finish from the cinnamon and ancho chile . touch of black licorice on the finish as well .   feel : the mouthfeel be luscious . this be the kind of thickness that imperial stout brewer dream to achieve . carbonation be spot on .   overall : an extremely well make adjunct imperial stout . you can tell that their base beer must be amazing , adjunct aside , because the adjunct can only enhance the base beer and can not be use to cover up potential flaw . 11.5 % ABV be extremely well hidden . how do they achieve such a thick mouthfeel ? I use my champagne bottle stopper to store this back in the fridge for a day of two long .... if I can not drink it fast enough , can I make a super delicious beer ice cream with it ?
big fan of Perennial and their stout . I like the vanilla and coffee variant more , but this one be great . just enough cinnamon to smell / taste but not overpower .

Abraxas and Barrel - Aged Abraxas might have be amazing beer a decade ago , but they both seem rather mediocre these day . if they be attempt to do a mexican chocolate inspire beer , then this be definitely lose on I . the only thing that really impress I about this be the mouthfeel .

sample a 2017 vintage 12 oz bottle at cellar temp and pour into my snifter . the beer have be in its box in my cellar since I purchase it . the beer pour a dark mahogany color with some ruby highlight when I hold my glass to the light . a fizzy and short - live beige head of 1 cm foam up and fade to nothing after the first few sip of the beer . the aroma on this be rich and malty with dark chocolate , toffee , prune , raisin , and plum mix with a bit of red grape and maybe some port wine character . no hop presence on the nose , with only a little bit of fusol alcohol note to remind I of the 12 % ABV . first sip reveal a medium body with sticky mouthfeel and fine tingly carbonation . the beer be a bit of a sipper due to ABV , but the stickiness coat my palate and lip and slow my consumption as well . flavor be again all malt with toffee , prune and raisin with more brown sugar and molasse than I get on the nose . I also get a little bourbon , but again the hop be absent here . Booze come through on the finish with some warming down my throat on the swallow . this be a sip beer and I really enjoy the complexity and texture . the dark color make I think this could easily be in the old ale category as well and the ABV make this take almost all night to finish my glass , but as I state , I enjoy this one a lot and find the complexity enjoyable . get fresh bottle and age , or trade for vintage if you find em .

pour out dark brown . some light penetration . not completely opaque . half a finger of head that fade quickly .   Smell be huge and delicate at the same time . bourbon , brown sugar , banana , bready malt , cinnamon , raisin , toffee , a tiny whiff of the soy sauce character that appear when you mix strong malt and barrel aging . some savory nuttiness on the fade out . these all mix so well , without a strong presence of booze .   taste be everything that the nose be . drink this I could guess why they call it Stickee Monkee . it be like a Sticky Pecan Bun and Monkey Bread all at the same time . the cinnamon , brown sugar , and nuttiness match with the sweet glazed flavor of banana and raisin pack baked bread . all balance on a razor 's edge .   fine bubble create a very smooth mouthfeel . but the consistency be a little on the thin side .   I can see why a lot of people rave over this beer . compare to Sucaba and Parabola this beer hold a smooth delicate quality over those two . Parabola be aggressive and strong , not to be take lightly . Sucaba have robust and complex flavor that could be dissect for hour . Stickee Monkee say forget all of that . it do n't assault your sense , but rather lure you in . and if you follow where it take you , you will be reward .

another beer courtesy of   Firestone Walker   Stickee Monkee Vintage 2017   look : the beer pour black . a finger of beige head settle to a thin layer across the top of the glass . the beer be opaque and there be no visible carbonation . a couple spot of lacing but nothing to really speak of . as I drink the beer down the light bring out some ruby and burn sienna tone . season 17/18 , blend 57 , bottle 5/22/18   time to crack open my first 3 Fonteinen ! this be currently the 7th high rate Gueuze , and the 185th highest rate beer overall . 375 ml cork and cage bottle . serve fairly cold into pint glass . 2018/19 vintage with a good before date of late 2038 . cost be $ 14.25 cdn . one buy to celebrate a house close , the other for some event in the future . list at 7.1 % ABV . Super stoke to get a couple bottle from this world famous ( 2nd most famous ? ) lambic creator . Blend 13 .   appearance - hazy rich coppery gold brew with a small half finger of white head that fizzle out in a minute or two . even some reddish hue to this brew .   Smell - Complex ! start with hint of balsamic vinegar , but there be a woody and smoky undercurrent . orange marmalade fit in there . there be a mustiness and something like rich leather . some earthy barnyard funk fit in there . other fruit , maybe apricot or peach show vaguely for an instant . a lot go on , but it be like a pleasant journey with the sense rather than an assault . as it warm ... something perfumey or floral that I ca n't quite put my finger on .   taste - hint of vinegar again , orange marmalade with a light smoky flavor . leather mix in as well with some sweetness from apricot . a sprinkle of white pepper at the back end and all this wrap around a slightly musty and earthy body . kind of surreal with how much be go on . overall , tart but not overpower .   Mouthfeel - medium - light bodied , bright expressive carbonation . Booze quotient be invisible until it hit the back of the throat , then you realize there be some booze here . light tingly sensation . initially moist but then finish quite dry .   overall - wonderful brew , super duper complex . this be n't a style I have ton of experience with nor be it a favorite style , however I can certainly respect and enjoy ( some of ) the complexity and nuance of this brew . while gueuze have always be a complex style full of nuance this Cuvee blend by Armand & Gaston ramp it up to a whole new level . definitely worth the purchase and I very much look forward to drink the second bottle some year into the future and provide a comparison . what a brew .

2015 purchase online from HOTD . age at least 3 year in bourbon barrel . the taste note on their website say there would be no carbonation but I do get a few big bubble .   Adam from the Wood come across as age ( two syllable age - ed , not one ) and venerable . he be ponderous and methodical , slow to get to the point . he be perhaps a bit past his prime , flabby in the midsection with thinning hair .   try to stay youthful , Adam wear a lot of leather these day . it still smell faintly of the cigar he give up year ago . he can usually be find at a fade bar nursing a watery bourbon on the rock with the ice long melt and munching maraschino cherry , ponder what be and wonder if it will be again .   if you ever get the chance to spend some time with he , do it . he know a lot of good story and have a hell of a good sense of humor .

revisit with the 2018 bourbon barrel Adam June 07th , 2021   Murky , dark brown body ; no head . big earthy aroma of oak with a twinge of bourbon ; cocoa . richly sweet taste ooze with cocoa , molasse , and muted whiskey . heavy body ; slick and oily ; slippery ; bold residual sugar coat the palate ; sweet mouthfeel overall offset with a low - key boozy warmth .   I find this version of Adam to be very similar to the 2015 rye version . perhaps because I be a bourbon man , the taste really appeal to I a tad more . regardless , this be one beautiful monster of a beer .   pour at 55 ° F.   --------------------   original review rating for rye 2015 version : 4.0 4.0 4.5 4.5 4.25   originally review June 06th , 2021   Dark , murky brown body ; initially no head then a thin wispy ring circle the glass . rich smell ; dark pit fruit , anise and leather ; mild earthy spiciness . outstanding taste ; like a rich port ; cocoa and plum plus raisin with a subdued booziness . heavy body ; slick and oily ; coat the palate with a slippery sweetness .   the old bugaboo with high ABV beer have little head retention exist here ; but then , it be nearly six year old . otherwise , the taste and mouthfeel be exceptional for the style . the beer be rich and complex overall . late note : I see on the bourbon bottle that Adam be produce with no carbonation , so I bump up the appearance score from 3.5 to 4.0 and up the overall to 4.25 .   serve at 54 ° F ; rye bourbon barrel version ( 2015 )

2018 vintage . really excited to find this at the brewery while visit Portland . as expect , absolutely no sound when the cap be take off . zero carbonation , which immediately seem strange . pour a gorgeous dark brown . the nose be incredible . remind I of a 30 year old english barleywine . ton of oak , caramel , alcohol - soak cherry , leather , sweet molasse . this , to I , smell old and delicious . taste be crazy . immediately pick up strong nutty flavor . the lack of carbonation convey a syrupy taste . pick up lot of dark cherry , blackberry , toffee , burn wood bitterness , leather , rubber , oak , and maybe a hint of soy sauce . mouthfeel be creamy and thick - very bold . overall , this be a mesmerizing beer with a deep hierarchy of flavor . absolutely fantastic , and an experience I wo n't forget .

2018 batch from a 12 oz bottle .   as advertise , the pry of the cap ... nothing . as expect with an HotD special release , this be still . burn chestnut brown border black . not a single bubble reside above , yet Adam from the Wood be beautiful .   despite a lack of pressure , the ability to deliver aroma upon relief of the cap be impressive . all the glorious element that make up Adam ( tobacco , leather , molasse , brown sugar ) , be meet with a perfect , non - overpowering level of barrel influence . lightly char wood and decadent vanilla elevate Adam to the next level .   Booze definitely play a major role in the flavor . fig wrap in sop tobacco leave , flash char , then lightly coat in milk chocolate . Oak and leather baseball glove tie that you 've chew on while play right field for the last 6 innings ling in the end . but then , long after sip , a refreshingly light implication of Maraschino Cherry only add to the complexity . like I say , Adam kick up a notch . the flavor sear into the taste bud .   this be the weird and most wonderful aspect of this beer . it feel watery , almost too thin , like a sip of actual whiskey in fact , but only for a split second . I 've never feel anything like it . it transcend into a silky , sweet , puckering mass with a blast of alcohol warmth . it coat everything it touch and stick like glue . but then , full circle , the oak aging do a wonder of strip the silkiness away .   what can I say ? it be phenomenal and a real treat . add complexity to an already outstanding world class beer . something I 'll never pass up on give future opportunity . I 'll leave it at that .   cheer .

12 oz Bottle   2018 vintage   big , huge , giant thank to Phil for this beautiful son of a bitch . Adam from the Wood be the darkest of brown , border on black . it be much dark than the original . it be also still , like many of the new hotd special release . a hard pour produce a couple fleeting bubble here and there but this puppy be flat . it be work in past iteration so let 's see where it take we here .   the nose be off the chart . I love regular Adam , it be complex and dense . the wood aging put this one over the top . old dry leather and tobacco kick it off . a little soy add umami . handful of prune and date and fig . the tobacco be sweet like grandpa 's pipe tobacco . what the 3 year barrel aging do be wrap that whole , beautiful complexity in a big giant bear hug of oaken vanilla . it be comforting and rich and elegant and decadent and perfect . this stuff smell absolutely amazing .   nothing can touch that nose . with that say , the flavor ai n't none too shabby . that sweet pipe tobacco get thing start and be meet with the prune and date . they soy be fleeting but there . the leather be old and well worn . quality cocoa powder linger on the swallow . again , all this be surround by a rich , luxurious , oily oaken vanilla . there be so many layer of flavor and they be all in such perfect harmony that it be mindblowe .   though this beer be flat I think that bubble would actually ruin the experience . and an experience it be . this beer be full bodied and plush with a velvety feel . as full bodied as it be , the tannin from the extended aging dry up with finish and leave very little residual stickiness . as robust and decadent as this beer be the alcohol be almost non - existent . it be a sipper but one that gets sip often .   Adam from the Wood be just about as near perfect as you can get . the barrel aging have add amazing quality to an already amazing beer . this beer be as comfortable as old slipper , as a roar fire in a winter cabin , as a snifter of cognac on a bearskin rug , old well finger book , a labrador with your nightly newspaper .

no date on the can , but this one be pretty fresh . really excited to finally get to try this New England Classic .   pour a deep , hazy orange with gob of white head that rise up to about two finger above the beer . as it settle , huge amount of froth cle to the inside of the glass , while its weak counterpart slip helplessly into the beer itself . as warn , I get my fair share of sediment in this can as well . no harm no foul .   Sweet , dank nose on this . ton of herbal , grassy , piney hop compliment an abundance of grapefruit aroma . really great contrast of sweet citrus and pithy hop , with a complex aroma that really embody every great quality of a true , " old school " American Double IPA .   a re - emergence of similar quality that be find on the nose ... sweet , juicy grapefruit , herbal hop , and some awesome fruity undertone reminiscent of pineapple . this beer be so incredibly well - rounded and be able to achieve an immense juiciness while also retain a punish hop presence that linger in all the good way with that pithy , bitter tail .   surprisingly soft mouthfeel , with a low , almost forget carbonation that sneak up on you a little more with each sip . a subtle boozy warmth accompany a great residual mouth - coating and a smooth , crisp finish .

no canning date ( purchase at brewery on 3/8/19 ; presumably can within a week of that time )   pour a hazy dark orange huge top with a thick , verge on creamy , white head . great retention leave plenty of soapy lacing , a faint , frothy cap , and an ample collar ; all the appearance of a great - look beer despite the sizable chunk of sediment float around .   Aromas of ruby red grapefruit and peach skin be intense straight away , while back note of orange pulp , blackberry / blueberry smoothie , and dank eucalyptus round out a bouquet that be every bit fruity as it be saturate ( albeit subtly ) with herbal and ' sweet ' hop tone . amazing exposure of hop diversity and depth .   taste profile turn , with overripe peach now take over and red grapefruit z come in not far behind alongside a dose of pulpy orange and herbal hop ; light note of blackberry and blueberry add further depth to the fruity profile ; ample malt backbone burst through intermittently , especially toward the finish .   Mouthfeel be quietly creamy , with a light body but a stiff , bitter crispness and great juicy character . slightly oily bitterness on the finish , which only add depth and smoothness to the juicy character ; effortless , elegant , unbelievably drinkable , and really just a beautiful aspect of this beer .   not your typical New England haze bomb , and certainly not your old - school IPA ; this be a tweener in the good sense . overwhelmingly hoppy and unique , this embrace the good of both world , with an incredible balance tie it all together . just spectacular ; I could drink this again and again .

a huge thank to Nick for this one . you be far too generous .   355ml bottle - no date ( ' 18 or ' 19 I be sure ) - pour into a balloon stem at 48 ° F .   pour a thin , mahogany brown with amber highlight , sit basically black in the glass . when hold to the light , the beer appear clear , deep garnet red , with micro suspend particulate . a finger of very light , foamy tan head form , and recede fairly quickly , leave a nice collar .   Nose : compare to so many maple beer out there , two thing stand out here . one , the maple be strong - balanced , not overpower , but very forward . two , the maple be very organic - like a pot with dark maple syrup reducing . note of maple fudge , chocolate chip pancake , fresh , light roast coffee , and a very subtle smokiness underneath it all , that I would attribute to smoke malt . no bacon , but I could definitely see maple sausage . it really do smell like a chocolate chip pancake breakfast with coffee .   palate : the beer greet the palate porter - first . it be n't pastry , and constantly remain real beer . a very nice porter base , too - roasty , but lightly so , with very little malt sweetness , and no char to speak of . a touch nutty , with a bit of cocoa and toffee . the maple be ever - constant , lend a faint background sweetness , while the coffee stay restrain , taste not like ground , but a smooth lightly sweeten cup of light roast . the coffee note open up towards the finish , as the maple slowly subside , let a bit of meaty emptiness come through . it be n't quite * bacon * , but it be a nice touch , and I can pretend . the finish be light coffee , subtle cocoa , a trail hint of maple , and a kiss of smoke .   Mouthfeel / body : it be a 6.4 % ABV porter . there be no reason to assume this will be thick or chewy , and it be n't . it be medium - bodied , fluid up front , but with some of that porter heft to it . it be n't thin , nor thick . it be right where it should be . drinkable , not watery . effervescence be medium - gentle , with fine , soft bubble . semi - sweet , with a moderately dry finish with linger maltiness . an iota of stickiness .   overall : this take everything that the breakfast stout have make famous , and deliver it in a small porter format . the maple be beautifully integrate , the coffee be top notch , albeit a bit restrained , and there be a nice subtle smoky element thread through . the porter itself be fantastic , with the perfect malt bill and great attenuation . it be bold , balanced , and deviate from the norm . all of the breakfast stout quality in a small , drier , drinkable package . simply put , it be really a great breakfast porter .

" and sample on 12/26/18   note via stream of consciousness : first off , this be label as " 2018 " and yet they package it in 2017 . so they actually sit on it for a year to age it ? interesting . it be pour a typical porter / stout appearance with a black body beneath a creamy head of khaki color foam . the aroma be fantastic , it smell like a coffee liquor . it meld sweet maple syrup with black coffee and chocolate syrup , and for whatever reason that be take I for a moment back to my day in the Boy Scouts . it be clean and bright and enticing although I have n't really find the bacon yet , just a suggestion of it . ok , on to the flavor ... more coffee , basic , but good , just like a regular cup of Joe black coffee ... more maple syrup as expect , and kind of sweet ... chocolate syrup ... some vanilla ... but I be still not find the bacon . I be n't really expect bacon , but maybe some apple smoke wood maltiness ... ? or be I miss it ? I get coffee , maple , toffee , almost burn but not sugar , vanilla , medium to dark caramel , some background fruitiness , and a bit of ashen roastiness . be it smoky ? I do n't think so , not really , there be some in the far away background but I would n't consider it smoky . still , it be good . it be nice and rich without be overly so , and sweetish but not too sweet although some of that maple sugar do ling on the palate . it be not really a dessert beer though , or be it ? it could certainly be use as an ingredient in a dessert but it be rich enough to be a dessert beer on its own ? ahhh , maybe . so , ok , what else ? medium bodied and gently crisp then smooth . 2019 vintage   original June 30th , 2021 rating for the 2016 vintage : 3.75 4.5 5.0 4.75 4.5   the appearance be the same . the smell be way more subdued ; heavy sweetness and dark , pit fruit . the flavor remain outstanding , but like the smell , a bit more low - key ; heavy sweetness ; spicy ; raisin and fig . the mouthfeel be also heavy , slick and oily .   perhaps the aging of the 2016 version fine - tune many of the aspect of the beer . the 2019 version be still pretty remarkable and invite itself , but it just do n't reach some of the extraordinary level the old version do . then , too , this beer start off cold than when I have the 2016 version , so that may deaden some of the beer 's highlight .   pour at 50 ° F   ------------   2016 vintage ( fourth release )   flat and still , murky and deep , dark brown body ; no real carbonation or head note . old , smokey wood stave on the nose ; ancient dark pit fruit , fig and date . an immensely deep and sensual taste ; raisin , date , fig , cinnamon , anise ; cerebral note of heady spice and rich , succulent malt ; boozy yet subtly subdue . heavy body ; oily ; slick and slippery ; huge residual sugar note ; warm and coat on the palate .   this beer exude fig newton quality , but deep and more divine in nature . this be a godly liquid that ooze spirituality .   pour out at 65 ° F.

I think that ’s what be intend .   s : Chocolate , fruit , smoke , in that order . the chocolate be semi - sweet , like chip perfectly melt into warm cookie . the fruit be quite bright , and waver between apple / pear and citru . cherrywood smoke round thing out . it smell simultaneously old and lively , complex and focused . really special .   t : everything from the nose come through , plus add note of tobacco , parchment , and spice . layer upon layer , all rich with a consummately old - school aesthetic that I have n’t encounter in a beer this fresh in year . the finish be tingly with alcohol , but hardly overbearing . so , so good .   f : soft , medium - full body with extremely delicate carbonation . not quite as rich as the flavor could support , but solid for sure .   o : wow . this be the good beer I ’ve have in a long time , and be probably the good Strong Ale I ’ve ever have . it typify that style for I , as it do everything most barleywine do and then some . so complex , so layered , so well - structure . magnificent beer .   cheer !

2019 bottle into a Hair of the Dog tasting glass .   muddy water , minimal carb but smell and taste much well than the appearance . fig , dark fruit , caramel . smoke and bourbon barrel . Vanilla . a bit hot but pleasantly so . thin for style . overall very enjoyable .
pour a dark amber black . Minimal foam . incredible aroma , cherry and campfire smoke go together . incredibly smooth with a long finish . this beer be make to be sip .

essentially no head production on the pour , although there be the slight amount of build up - perhaps 1/16 " at well - as the carbonation rise to the surface . deep , purplish - brown body .   incredibly boozy on the nose ; ton of liquor , in particular bourbon and apple brandy , but also a port / sherry - like mild oxidation . load of dark fruit , nearly juicy in their expression , include date and prune , along with raisin and red grape . wave of brown sugar , caramel , chocolate , molasse , and licorice .   incredibly potent on the palate , a melange of dark fruit , bread , bourbon , oak , molasse , smoke , and oxidation . without question a sip beer ; not something you can really dig into quickly . it do n't just reward patience ; it demand it .   Thick and syrupy . undeniably boozy , but not hot or painful . very little carbonation .

Bottle , 2019 release : these still hotd offering have trouble look overly entice through no fault of their own . a dark than medium brown , it appear somewhat opaque . as state no head , so no lacing .   Nose have the aroma of a dry after dinner wine without the acidity . the base earthy wooden note get a little accent of fig and date . there ’s a bit of smoke as well , but more like what would be in the air after a night ’s rain dampen the previous evening ’s bonfire .   Taste also start with a slightly tannic dry wine , but the fig come it quickly to turn this towards its true beer nature . a little sweetness come next , follow by a grow smoke and a brief interlude of a bold red wine and leather . the smoke come in as if the dark fruit spend a little time in the smoker .   the ending be moderately dry , with a little bit of stickiness allow the last flavor to linger into the aftertaste . the lack of carbonation be almost not miss , though I think I ’d rather have this still than with even moderate carbonation .   a true treat where the smoke gets integrate so well into the flavor of the beer to lift it from really good to great .

this one pour a very dead looking and murky purplish brown , with no head and no lacing .   this smell very much like apple brandy , with boozy fruit , caramel , and more booze .   this be absolutely hinder by the complete and total lack of carbonation- I guess I be not sophisticated enough to appreciate something like that . it be get some interesting flavors- like smoke , prune , chocolate , tobacco and ton of apple brandy . it be super flabby however , and just feel unfinished- I ca n't get fully behind it . it feel so thin and flat .   the mouthfeel be obviously a weak point here- even just a little bit of carbonation would be so helpful .   this be very intriguing but I just simply do n't enjoy it .

all of the beer we have at hair of the dog be highlight , so its hard to single out this 2008 matt as the standout , but it be pretty darn impressive . no idea what it taste like fresh , but some time in the bottle have really do it well . one of the few beer I can think of that could stand up over time like this , not a lick of oxidation or staleness in here at all , just a smooth mellow well integrate brew all the way around . rich syrupy viscous dark dark brown pour , still with a little bubble head on it . note of campfire , black licorice , cigar , brandy , raisin , and dark chocolate all waft out from the glass slowly and patiently , weave a complex aromatic tapestry that be entirely unique . burn leather and bourbon come through the dark english or german malt , rauch type smoke have mellow some , sticky bread pudding , root beer , then they apple grappa stuff in the finish . man be this layered ! it do nt quite have that roasted barley stout quality to it , it do nt go that deep , but in its bitter absence , there arise this space for other flavor usually lose to it , and I think this land perfectly in the middle of all of they . I be amazed how this have do over time , I expect more of a novelty at this age , but that be nt the case at all . rich and velvety on the palate , the warm alcohol seem necessary too . brilliant beer , what a treat !

product_name: Double Dry Hopped All Citra Everything
product_review: a : med gold with a touch of pastel that lighten it to maybe a dull yolk color . evenly distribute 1F of white head with 2 - 3 min of retention before fade into faint wisps .   s : do n't brighten up the room on first crack of the can , but bring in the nose to take a sip ... yeah , it be definitely a brash , citra forward aroma . sweet citrus , Buddha 's Hand , sweet and earthy lychee , custard apple , mango , floral orange blossom honey .   m : it be soft and med body , but not Dream thick . a superfine carbonation keep it smooth -- not crisp -- and keep it fairly drinkable for the ABV .   t : start with copious amount of melon and mango lassi accompany by a fruity caramel lead into pineapple jolly rancher ; fresh cut grass x key lime pie jelly bean . sweetness subside a bit for some dry tangerine San Pellegrino and ruby grapefruit gus drink to set in , which be both pithy while carry a semblance or sweetness . finish with a floral bitterness accompany by note of black cherry .   o : in a crowded market of citra ipa this one indeed stand out . fruity and sweet on the nose than on the palate , it do help the bitterness slide down . only once do I get a minimal medicinal , Vitamin C tablet - type vibe .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped All Citra Everything
product_review: pour produce a common frothy top that befit many a cloudy beer . the coloring fit on the paler yellow end , lack ay orange hue that some hazie bring to the table . the aforementioned head have some stickiness to it and provide a fair amount of lacing .   I be not get a burst of aroma from the nose , but the aroma I be get be pretty standard for the style . start out I perceive a bit of the malt and alternative and a somewhat muddle citrus note . I then get a little sweet melon thread through grapefruit and tangerine . the aroma be whisper that this beer might actually have some bitterness , and I think I be get a familiar yeast note , as well - though I could n't say why .   ok , the opening start like I expect with the m / alt lay down a dry gray / hay base . Citra fruit pith come next , but there be also a sugary sweetness peek out from the corner . it be mildly distract but do n't drive out the note that I be enjoy ; in fact the sweetness fade and meld into the raw / bitter citrus rind note to bring out a bit of tropical fruit flesh . what I take as oat / wheat in the hazy NE ipa I get next . it seem to help carry the citrus rind through - especially the pith and the bitterness that bring be the last thing I be leave with as the beer enter my gullet .   a very good IPA that bring some fruitiness but stay ground with some back end bitterness .

product_review: so excited to find this brew at Canal ’s in Berlin NJ . top notch super hazy murky deep golden look with an offwhite head with some staying power . wonderful fruity and sweet Citra nose on this puppy . ooh that ’s tasty . very fruit drive and sweet with a dry gentle grapefruit and pine bitterness . product_name: Double Dry Hopped All Citra Everything
product_review: can on 2/3/2021 so review at 2 week . pour into a snulip glass . it pour . a murky , dirty tangerine color with a half finger of creamy , milk - white head and thick soapy lace . a bright , fruity nose feature lemon , lime , grapefruit , pineapple , mango , and soft floral hop . the taste be huge and fruity . it open with tart lemon peel and grapefruit rind that be quickly match by sweet note of pineapple , peach , mango , and lychee . you wo n't find a well showcase of Citra hop . they provide lot of fruit up front and clean bitterness at the finish . this ale have a plush , pillowy mouth feel with pleasant carbonation , and a punchy 8.5 % ABV that give it substance without overpower . overall , this be an exquisite New England DIPA that merit its lofty rating .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped All Citra Everything
product_review: typical bright orange pour . thin head .   the nose be heavy tropical citrus . Peach , tangerine , sweet and sticky .   taste be big and bright . you get the tropical fruit note , more pineapple flavor in the taste than the smell . this one be just through an through bright and fruity and really pretty sweet . like tropical Starburst in the good way . not an especially long or complex finish though . not too much boozy flavor . it kind of blend in and enhance the sweetness .   Mouthfeel be a bit sticky but when the flavor be so good , you do n't mind . nice carbonation that enhance the brightness of the tropical fruit flavor .   this be a pretty solid NEIPA . seem like this one be available fairly often and its a pretty reliable choice . I 'll drink it anytime .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped All Citra Everything
product_review: thank to my friend DW for provide this 16 oz can .   fairly pale golden color , hypercloudy . pour a nice white head , creamy and linger .   big dank hop aroma , funky orange . an intense fruity hop aroma .   Combination of malt and fruit sweetness up front , flavor a bit more subtle than the aroma . carry some orange flavor into the finish . bitterness be very soft . flavor be very rounded and smooth .   medium body and carbonation . a bit of a tongue coater but not hop astringent . alcohol be well control give the strength - minimal warming .   an intensely hoppy beer , but well do . have a smooth flavor profile that be consistent from beginning to end . a bit dangerous give its strength .

product_name: Double Dry Hopped All Citra Everything
product_review: can on 3/3/20   pour a turbid light honey gold body cap with a finger and a half of creamy , white foam ; solid head retention yield an expansive frothy collar and vague , paper - thin cap , with chunky ring and light , soapy spot round the wall of the glass .   Aroma open with soft but assertive key lime cream douse with hit of mango and a passionfruit edge ; orange pulp develop across the middle as a dank , earthy tangerine accent the close .   taste bring out orange and grapefruit pulp before a passionfruit and dirt - cover papaya tropical z highlight the core of the profile ; a faint note of creamy tangerine along with dank herb fade into the backdrop .   Mouthfeel offer a moderate verging on dense body support by a mild but fluffy carbonation ; a pithy mid - palate feature a rise hop acidity become a touch juicy over time , though primarily highlight an easy hoppy grit and dry into a resinous finish .   recall burst of other Half 's signature creaminess and harmony of tropical dank and raw earth , this DIPA manage a more raw spread of individual element fall just short of real cohesion . highly enjoyable in spite of miss the character to bring it to the upper - tier of the style .

good head production and decent retention . the body be wonderfully dark , as be the dark brown head , while it last .   the aroma on this be powerful and decadent . from the moment of the pour , to sit in the glass foot away , I be get strong note of chocolate , molasse , and bourbon . up close , it be even sweet , with vanilla , syrup , honey , and brown sugar join the mix , along with cinnamon and chilie . the nose be , quite simply , wonderful .   despite the sweetness of the nose , the brew be quite roasty and bitter up front . light but noticeable pepper heat . ton of dark fruit flavor , blackstrap molasse , oak , and bitter chocolate ; slightly vegetal . last prune and raisin , along with bourbon , on back third , lead to chocolate and cinnamon on the finish .   Thick and full bodied .

500ml bottle into a snifter vintage 2021   a : pour midnight black and somewhat viscous in appearance . immensely dark head of 1plus finger width dissipate at a moderate rate . leave only a few patch of lacing . 4.75   S : Aroma be , my god . massive cinnamon , big chocolate , vinous dark fruit , luscious bourbon , capsaicin peppery heat , red wine . barrel note be moderate in strength and compliment the beer wonderfully . some base beer note primarily roasted malt . fire roasted marshmallow round it out . goodness gracious . 4.75   t : taste be also excellent , albeit perhaps a bit less voluptuous . I again get huge vinous and red wine note up front , hell be actually taste like it ’s red wine barrel aged . next come the cinnamon and rich , fine high cocoa content dark chocolate . on the finish there be roasted malt , char oaky bourbon note , some balancing bitterness . this be just wave after wave of flavor and it ’ quite frankly just impressive . 4.75   M / D : Mouthfeel be full bodied and thick . ABV be not noticeable which be impressive . drinkability , however , be quite limited . the combination of the heavy / thick feel and adjunct laden flavor profile make 500mL of this feel like 3 gallon ( and this be come from someone who drink Bourbon County all the time and even old school 750ml Black Tuesdays without any trouble ) . 4   o : overall , this be quite the beer . normally beer this adjunct heavy can be not really my thing , but this one just pull it off wonderfully . probably more appropriate as an 8 oz pour as oppose to a 500mL solo bottle , but still , well do Cigar City , well do . 4.5

Flavor bring heavy alcohol , soy sauce , dark chocolate , tobacco , bourbon barrel , and piney hop . there be some chili pepper in there as well somewhere .   feel be hot , burn , scathe even , and thick with a delicate creaminess that disappear as soon as the heavy carbonation come forward .   overall , I be hope my 3,000th beer would be something really special , and this one come a little short of it . pour pitch black in color with a big , bubbly dark brown head . pour a pitch black coloration with a medium , creamy , dark brown head . smell of rich , dark chocolate , cinnamon and chili pepper , with a hint of vanilla , oak and quite a hot bourbon note . taste follow the nose , be dominate by rich , bitter chocolate , roasted malt and spicy chili pepper , with a good amount of vanilla and light note of cinnamon , dark fruit : fig , raisin , some oak and a light earthiness . there be also quite a hot , boozy bourbon note to this . it start out a little sweet , with the chocolate and vanilla stand out the most , but turn more a lot more bitter and warm in the aftertaste . finish with a medium bitterness , vanilla note , and some heat , both from the chili and booze , linger in the aftertaste . smooth mouthfeel with a rich body and low carbonation .   this thankfully do n't have that odd , floral chili note that normal Huna have , the chilie feel a lot more sharp and spicy . a little less earthy and bitter as well , with more vanilla sweetness and a lot more booziness . slightly rich dark fruit note as well . one of the jester king beer that I have be unable to track down until now , highly acclaim and on my list forever , stoke to finally have source it . its definitely one of the good apricot wild beer in the game , so intense and so natural at the same time , in a lot of way remind I of when I try cascade apricot for the first time , and just realize that there be no more true expression of apricot in beer than that , this be the same , but much less sour , and with the classic jester king funky yeast mix that make their beer so distinctive all the time . a pulpy orange hazy look to this one , under a short but last white head . the nose be incredible , the good feature of this for I and where I really appreciate the apricot most , fuzzy and real , fleshy and juicy and sweet and ripe , their absolute essence . some high level bacterial acidity evident here too , but all in service of the fruit . nice oak to the flavor , give it a richness , and a light wine and vanilla thing in the flavor , beautiful with the pale wheat malt and the sugar in the fruit , its funky and sour and also kind of desserty , a little more left at the end of this one than in a lot of their beer , especially these small bottle fruit release , and I love how long it linger . more sour than other too , especially at temperature , but it all work so well together . epic expression of apricot in a really amazingly funky and mature wild beer , up there with the good of jester king , and certainly worth all the hype !

2019 bottle . 12 oz , 11 % ABV .   the pour be dark and viscous , pour cold so allow room to warm , so not much of any rise head or visible carbonation . a thin beige ring surround the top of the beer in the glass .   a huge chocolatey aroma remind I of brownie batter , with a nice underlie complexity of molasse and dark fruit . there be a roasty malt character to this as well , but that initial chocolate dessert sweetness really win the day on the nose .   a fantast contrast in the flavor profile bring out a ton of barrel character , as well as a much strong emergence of those dark fruit and molasse characteristic . the barrel bring out additional flavor of vanilla , oak , and bourbon , and roasty dark coffee begin to grab a good bit of influence as well as it warm far . in the finish its all bourbon , with a familiar boozy spice on the tail .   warming , smooth , viscous . as it slip down the back , there be a good level of residual mouth - coating , and do well to accompany a boozy burn down the hatch . definitely would consider a full - bodied beer , and drink like more of a 14+% BA stout , in all the good way possible .

really slick and tasty and do everything I ’d want for a bba Stout . there be a nice caramel sweetness and the nose that really persevere through the line . this be a sweet beer all thing consider . but I appreciate the well construct layer

ok , so I recently pick up some of these down here in Milwaukee . never have it before , be on my want list for several year now .   pour a dark near black . smell heavily barrel forward , and not cheap barrel at that . taste like the nose ; barrel forward with the beer itself compliment the note of the barrel . barrel linger in the mouth for a bit then fade to the base beer .   if you want a BA stout that be nt barrel dominant , this be n't for you . interestingly , though , I usually fall in that camp and I absolutely love this beer and be hoard all I can find of it .

2019 vintage . have have most of Lift Bridge 's offering and find they to be good but not exceptional ; Silhouette be the latter . pour pitch black with some light barely visible at the top edge in my Spiegelau stout glass . delicious meld of coffee and bourbon on the nose . flavor profile go together perfectly , not too much bourbon but the perfect amount IMHO and not too boozy but just right . nice full body but not too much either . this be fantastic and give the choice of this or some of the well know BA stout like BCBS , CBS or KBS I 've enjoy , I 'd pick this over they .

pour pitch black with a medium mocha colored head . smell great with note of barrel present but not overpower . taste like a lot of chocolatey goodness and roasted coffee . very rich feel and taste . great barrel taste and balance . think this remind I a lot of BA Expedition .

thank you vidblain for this 750 ml bottle , 2017 , pour into tulip   A- black with a small tan head   S- bourbon , chocolate , char oak , molasse , hint of vanilla   t- bourbon , chocolate , dark fruit , molasse , vanilla , oak , touch of coffee bitterness in the finish , very well balanced   M- smooth , medium to full body   O- a great , well balanced barrel aged RIS that be n’t over the top with the ABV . very enjoyable and easy to drink .

on tap at Republic . pour an opaque , jet - black color with a small , brown head of foam . it smell of bourbon , oak , vanilla , coffee , dark chocolate and toffee . rich bourbon taste with dark chocolate , vanilla , toffee and a roasted malt .

pour from 750ml bottle into glass . 2018 vintage . black colored body , with slim dark brown back light highlight . partial finger head upon pour result in a scenic show of rise bubble replenish the scatter island and thin ring . leave behind a few scatter , small spot of lacing . Aroma of dark roasted malt soak in bourbon , which bring out smell of coffee , chocolate , toffee , and dark fruit . taste be robust and layered , with bourbon soak dark roasted malt , chocolate , molasse , and prune . the coffee aspect be there but weak . medium plus mouth feel . slightly oily . good carbonation . very solid barrel age stout , with balanced expression of nose and flavor . make sure to allow the beer to warm up to recommend temperature . this allow for a full sensory experience . really taste like bourbon soak prune .

Outstanding BA stout . it ’s get ton of chocolatey sweetness and a very pronounced , but not dominate barrel character . the bourbon blend perfectly with the big malty flavor of dark fruit , and chocolate . the mouthfeel be super thick and coating , perfect for the style . overall I ’ll be make the effort to get this again , it ’s great .

very good barrel aged russian imperial stout . do n't meet the hype , but do not disappoint either . the body do meet the hype , with a roasty , thick , and boozy feel all the way through the glass . the taste be a bit smoky , with the bourbon and malt lead the charge with aftertaste of dark chocolate , oat and tobacco . very enjoyable , would have again on a cold winter night

2017 vintage .   a : pour a brown - tint black , and manage just a thin ring of dense tan head with an aggressive pour . exceedingly persistent . a few long streak of lacing .   s : Sweet baker ’s chocolate in the forefront , alongside vanilla , bourbon , and oak , with a hint of roast that ’s almost char - like .   t : Rich , sweetish chocolate be balance slightly more with some roastiness ( nearly burn ) and dark coffee , but the balance be still towards the chocolate . pretty well integrate bourbon , oak , and vanilla which round out the flavor and last through the finish .   M : full bodied , chewy , with a sharp medium carbonation . warm with a slight alcohol bite .   o : very respectable barrel aged RIS . do n’t quite have the complexity or depth of other example , but tasty and well execute . I could do without the char - like flavor , though .

2018 bomber , and I be very excited to be able to try this one . pour black and moderately thick but not syrupy , with very little head that eventually burble up from below . the nose be a bit subdue , with cacao nibs , vanilla , red wine tannin , and malt ball , plus a tiny hint of black cherry and plum on occasion . big bourbon note on the tongue that amplify the aroma and provide some spice . punch above its weight class at 10 % abv . a nice , moderately full mouthfeel and boozy finish .   I will definitely try to get another bottle of this to put away and age . I love it .

pour from a 22 oz bomber into a snifter glass . thank Ryan for share this one .   pour a medium - dark brown body , translucent on the pour but black in the glass . small brown ring of foam .   on the nose be roasty malt , dark fruit , fig , whiskey and light chocolate . not a super potent aroma .   on the tongue , it ’s pretty whiskey - forward but a little thin with chocolate / light coffee flavor , dark fruit on the follow through and a very roasty aftertaste which I enjoy . Mouthfeel be light for an imperial stout . medium carbonation .   overall enjoyable to drink but be maybe expect a little more , especially in the mouthfeel department .

2017 bottle pour into a teku . dark brown with a subtle head . Aroma be nice ... barrel , vanilla , toffee and chocolate . subtle hint of molasse and dark fruit . taste really let I down . minimal barrel , slight booziness with some dark fruit and molasse . feel be onthe thin side . want it to be more viscous . overall , good beer but do n’t see the hype .

Brew : Trillium Brewing Company – Affogato   Intro : 750 mil . pour into a tulip glass . share with a friend   appearance : Dark virtually black color . ample head , maybe 2 inch . moderate lacing as we drink   Smell : coffee in the foreground follow by chocolate and vanilla .   taste : follow along with the smell . coffee be not overpower . the chocolate lead up the flavor profile .   mouthfeel : medium mouthfeel , medium carbonation .   drink : very well rounded . very enjoyable .   conclusion : easy to see why this be one of the top American Imperial stout . be a very enjoyable experience . would not hesitate to pick up more if it present itself .

750ml bottle .   Pours opaque , oily black with barely a trace of brown head .   Espresso , chocolate , vanilla , and fudge in the nose . full body with an viscous , chewy mouthfeel . sweet , rich chocolate cake batter on the palate with warm booze , vanilla , and coffee . finish intensely rich with boozy chocolate and coffee .

2020 release . release a month or so ago .   a : pour black , kinda thin , with a smattering of dark brown head that recede quickly to a razor thin ring . no lacing or retention to speak of .   s : medium roast coffee in the forefront , modest amount of dark roastiness and vanilla bark , a bit of cola and chocolate .   t : moderately sweet milk chocolate and coffee , sharp almost tannic roast , a bit of vanilla extract . not much complexity , really .   m : a bit on the thin side , with medium , sharp carbonation . light alcohol burn .   o : decent effort but nothing to write home about .

take from notes- Feb 2018 750ml Bottle pour into a snifter   pour deep black in color with a creamy khaki head that have good retention . smell of bold roasted aroma , give note of earthy and herbal coffee , toast nut , crack pepper and dark chocolate . taste be initially sweet , with note of vanilla cream and caramel , follow by bold roasted coffee that give note of dark chocolate , toast walnut and earthy green coffee . linger of vanilla cream and espresso . medium body with moderate carbonation lead to a slightly creamy mouthfeel that continue into the finish

coffee black , albeit opaque , with a short but dense creamy mocha head that retain as a thin but fluffy blanket until die to just a curl ring .   the super round , lusciously fluffy medium - full body deliver creamy fresh vanilla whip swirl into the smooth presence of medium roast coffee exhibit big punch of dark chocolate morsel all glide along a tingly carbonation that recede into a just semi - dry finish . the long I dig in , the chocolatier and fluffy it get , develop further hint of mocha liqueur and crystalized toffee or even peanut brittle , while also become a little sticky on the lip .   there be a little bit of a char brown sugar element you might experience in mexican coffee , and as the lactose build on the palate it become tough to drink , even split the bottle with my old lady .   I just could n't wait to duo dome this bottle with she as fresh as possible after this b2 release , and it be not a disappointment . there be no question why this beer set off Trillium 's pastry stout odyssey , as this b2 be no slouch and still the good pastry stout they 've put out ( with Biscotti & Coffee and BA Affogato be my other top ) .

this be a review for the 2020 version that be drop for a day . I be sure this will get great review as with everything trillium but I think most good brewery brew well . perhaps this age well .   look great . dark , creamy , little head that dissipate soon enough . for an " affogato " it set some expectation .   smell good . yes , you get the coffee , chocolate and vanilla but the smell give you the first hint that this be go to be a disappointment . stout with less alcohol smell well and there be many good coffee and chocolate stout out there .   first taste be really good . the smell have mute your expectation . the vanilla be there , the coffee not so much . I be guess they do that to get a well audience but this be an " affogato " with a blend of coffee . there be more of chocolate note so that be a plus . the aftertaste be too sugary though . by the second sip , a pint seem like a lot but I have be serve at the brewery and the taste do n't live up . probably need less alcohol with less sugar and more of a mouthfeel to get a well balance and flavor profile .   I can see that this be a great beer when it be introduce a few year ago but it need an update . the limited drop be a great way to get good rating . try this if you be in the Boston area . if you be make a trip , head to Wakefield in the opposite direction instead . your local brewery probably make a well pastry stout .

taste in a Rastal Teku from a bottle on October 5 , 2018 . brew with a blend of Barrington and Mostra coffee bean . note of Fdark espresso , tiramisu , sweet chocolate cake and smooth vanilla . highly recommend .

serve into a snifter glass via draft at trillium   color be a nice deep brown Smell be coffee and chocolate all day with slight vanilla and butterscotch   taste follow the nose as there be rich fudgy goodness upfront with the roastiness of the coffee right behind .. vanilla sweetness bring it all together beautifully thick and chewy with a big body this be a fantastic stout and I ca nt even imagine how good this be barrel aged as its already top shelf stuff ! !

split the 750ml bottle two way ; chill out in my fridge since the release . not sure if some of the sweetness and coffee flavor be subdue by Father Time but , if it be , that only would 've make the beer taste that much well to my pillow - soft palate . heavily flavor stout , especially big coffee brew , taste cloying and acidic . I be fully prepared for this beast to be over - the - top sticky and sweet but it turn out to be an exceptionally full - flavor stout with an incredible mouthfeel . I would n't reach for a bottle every weekend but , damn , I 'd sure as hell like the chance to have it more often than once .   Pitch black with a puffy , cardboard - color head . thick and invite when it be there , the head do n't last long but it make an impression .   the aroma - like a puppy make out of german chocolate cake and expresso , sit in your lap and breathing in your face . unavoidable , powerful , aromatic .   the description be no liar - " tiramisu , sweet chocolate cake , and smooth vanilla . " I shit you not , brother and sister . but , as I state before , it be an expert blend that pull together the component to create a cohesive sweet , slightly bitter and coffee - forward taste that slide over the palate , pump the brake and take it be sweet time pull away .   Thick , viscous , full - bodied . huge mouthfeel ; like a hippo in kiddie pool .   Awesome beer . wish I have more .

product_name: Somewhere, Something Incredible Is Waiting To Be Known
product_review: a- Tallboy pour a black brew into a tulip glass . the cocoa dark brown head shoot up quickly to an inch high with a decadent foamy consistency and pretty good retention . small sheet of lacing from a tiny ring at the edge .   s- Hershey 's chocolate , mocha , lactose sweetness and roast grain be massive in the aroma and this one find a nice balance between the dessert and the base stout beer . in the end thing come down to the great combo of espresso coffee and milk chocolate , a classic combo that be n't always easy to pull off beer . this come off as fresh mocha with no coffee ground hint . Caramel and vanilla round it all out .   t- not quite as sharp as the aroma as the sweetness come down a bit hard on the palate really push that Herhey 's milk chocolate feel even far but still well execute . Caramel , molasse , lactose and fudge sweet open thing up for rich espresso note , slight dark fruit , char bitter roast barley , toast nut , vanilla and marshmallow . again , land with a very gripping sweetness and it overshadow a lot of the other flavor compare to the harmony of the aroma .   MF- Luscious and wonderfully soft on the palate . the beer be very , very thick but the texture be chewy and downright creamy and oh so smooth . carbonation be at a medium level and roasty bitterness linger in the finish .   a very nice aroma of mocha and vanilla lead into a taste that approach too sweet but thankfully never go over that threshold . enjoy more than some of the other holiday time stout from Tree House as the chocolate be hold in check here and overall it find a pretty nice balance .

product_name: Somewhere, Something Incredible Is Waiting To Be Known
product_review: Drank from a 1 pint can purchase at Tree House Brewing Company , Charlton , MA 12/12/19 serve in a teku   review # 1850   fuller body , near pitch black appearance . the oily look liquid be top by a frothy , finger - tall , saddle brown head that fizzle away fairly quickly . a thin collar cap the beer .   really solid aroma . in typical Tree House milk stout fashion , dry , flinty , roasted malt meld nicely with rich mocha note . Darker roast coffee come to mind . some powder cocoa too . moderately sweet . as the beer sit , the aroma intensify , and the chocolate take on a Hershey ’s syrup - like quality . some vanilla appear as well . bit of lactose . there be a nice coffee ice cream thing go on .   the flavor profile be similar to the aroma but less punchy . malty up front . nice combo of roasted and sweet caramel malt . Chocolate appear in the center . again , chocolate syrup come to mind . bit of vanilla and creamy lactose too . black coffee be noticeable on the back end . the beer finish with an interesting mix of cream and sugar coffee and slightly bitter roastiness .   the mouthfeel be somewhat disappointing and fairly atypical for Tree House milk stout . light in body than I anticipate and fairly under carbonate . this almost seem a touch flat . after a few sip , I could feel the sugar in this leave a slightly sticky film on my lip .   although Tree House ’s milk stout taste pretty similar , most be quite impressive . somewhere , something Incredible be wait to be know be much in the vein of the other but lack a bit of complexity and intensity , as well as that signature Tree House pillowy soft mouthfeel . I be glad I have an opportunity to try this but probably would not seek it out again .

product_review: brew on 12/7/18 , pick up at TreeHouse on 12/8 . taste on 12/11 Cold straight from the fridge in a TreeHouse Teku glass it look good not an overly frothy head once it settle down , have a good rich look , no light get through , not as flavorful as other TreeHouse stout I 've taste and at 7.9 % alcohol you can begin to smell the alcohol ester like you would an Imperial Stout even though they call this one a Milk Stout .

product_name: Somewhere, Something Incredible Is Waiting To Be Known
product_review: pour opaque , dark brown in color with 1/2 inch head . taste be liquid french toast : cinnamon , vanilla , coffee , and cocoa . medium - heavy bodied , sweet , with medium - low carbonation . every time I do not think Tree House can out do itself with a stout , they make another great one . do not know how nervous Energy can be any more french Toast than this . exceptional stout .

product_name: Somewhere, Something Incredible Is Waiting To Be Known
product_review: acquire in a trade . pour into TH snifter with maximum foam head . 4 finger plus .   look : deep black , well blended . perfect foam building head that linger for day . smell : Toasted s'mores , chocolate , orange , fresh cut grass . taste : marshmallow on the fire , cedar , cinnamon , maple , ash , chocolate , coffee , vanilla , lactose , brown sugar . feel : incredibly smooth , but the aftertaste present a slight plastic note . overall : phenomenal stout . again . extremely enjoyable and drinkable .

pour from a bottle into a tulip .   Pours opaque orange and pulpy , with a limited but linger head and excellent lacing .   Aromas of orange , pineapple , mango , grass , chive , and honey .   honey - kiss fruity malt on the tip of the tongue , with orange and ruby red grapefruit as the star of the show . blood orange and tropical fruit start to sneak through , and then citrus rind give way to pine before classic chive , weed , and dank flavor take over . just a touch of booze at the finish .   medium bodied and well carbonate . dry at the finish .   I still prefer the original King Sue , but this do n't come off gimmicky or goofy like some DDH brew do .

have n't do a review in a while . step away from alcohol for a good month and feel great . anyway let 's get into it .   Bottled 1/6/21 . this one almost have three month on it . not optimal but circumstance dictate .   appearance be an almost opaque pale yellow with a mild orange hue . not much foam formation . a half of a finger of quickly fade white foam . some particulate show up the more I pour this out .   Nose be potent . it could just be I not raise a glass to my nose for a month . but grass , pine , ripe pineapple , mango and orange / citrus explode out of the glass . this smell great . huge amount of fruit with a bitter green counterpoint .   taste be different from the nose . the bitterness be strong than one would believe . like pine and grapefruit right up front , follow by the tropical note , and something that remind I of watermelon that be close to the rind . the bitterness start out strong and linger as well . resinous and piney with milder fruit note . this be n't as friendly or forgiving as normal King Sue , but remind I more of Permanent Funeral . aggressive and bold .   Mouthfeel be medium bodied with mild to medium carbonation . surprisingly this have hold it carbonation quite well . Bubbly and a little sharp .   this be a departure from what people would expect from King Sue , but nonetheless a vibrant brew for serious hop head . this bring it to a totally different level . a great brew to come back to .

pour an opaque light straw color with a thin layer of head . the nose have both citrus and earthy note . the flavor profile have citrus fruit upfront follow by a solid bitterness on the finish . the body be quite thin .   like the other Sues , this offering be good but over - rate and over - price .

hot on the heel of King Sue , this doubly hop version be fully Citra loaded and ready to reign supreme among all hop - commer .   double dry - Hopped King Sue quickly waft over the sense with a similarly radiant citrusy perfume its predecessor . also much like the original , a bold grapefruit and tangy orange juice fill the nose and the glass as both the beer 's fragrance and appearance take on the exact character of fresh squeeze citrus juice . its taste hinge on agave and honey to heighten the impression of branch ripe fruit succulence .   but its sugar and cereal laden sweetness quickly retreat and the hop take firm control of the middle palate . vibrant red grapefruit , ripe tangerine , mandarin , blood orange and a hint of both lemon and lime carry a citrus heavy taste across the tastebud , saturate each of they with its sherbet - like tang . nearly tangy , the hop be so intense that they take on a tart citrus flavor before head into a pleasantly bitter finish of fresh grassiness , herbaceous , and hemp - like flavor .   medium bodied and trend dry , its the fruit - centric succulence and slight starchiness from malt that prevent absolute dryness . but with absolute resinous bitterness instead , their dry effect clean the finish and usher in a long and brilliant grapefruit aftertaste . this be a world class IPA that have the " juiciness " of New England IPA , but with the bitterness of those of a more Midwest bitterness - again , good of both world !

pour a lovely bright yellow - orange color . completely opaque , but it do avoid that sludgy appearance that you get from some of the NE style ipa . thick , pillowy white head dissipate slowly , but steadily leave just a thin splotch of foam on top of the head . lot of sticky white lacing coat the glass as the beer be consume . I do leave about an inch of the beer in the bottle - that have a lot of sediment in it , so have I pour all of it in the glass at once , I do think I would have get that sludgy appearance .   Aroma be a bright , lush bouquet of mango , orange , orange creamsicle , cantaloupe , tangerine and a hint of pineapple . there be a slight greenish tinge to the aroma it what I tend to get from these beer that use dry hopping .   taste follow the nose with note of orange tangerine , pineapple , mango , and cantaloupe . I m even get a light berry - blueberry and raspberry - note in the profile . the bitterness be subdue on the palate , but you can feel that hop burn build as you drink the beer .   feel be moderately bodied , pretty smooth . moderate carbonation . surprisingly dry on the back end .   overall its a nice dipa - I honestly do not know that the double dry hopping really do much to improve on the original King Sue . and while I do not know that I 've pick this on up again , I do really enjoy drink it .

500ml bottle , date 01.06.2021 , pour into a stemless wine glass .   the beer pour a hazy and turbid orange color , amber and straw hue with a foamy finger of white head , good retention and lot of soapy lace . the aroma be lovely , bright tropical fruit leap from the glass , tangy orange , grapefruit and pineapple with an excellent burst of earthiness , pine , hop spice , raw and green hop leaf , grassiness , light floral bouquet but this be super dank . the flavor be great , super dank , piney , resinous and sticky with lot of green hop leaf , grassy , floral , prominent hop spice lead to bitter grapefruit peel , tangy orange juice , pineapple with some sweet yeast and pale cereal grain . the mouthfeel be good , coating , lively medium body that finish with a very dry bite .   Verdict : a superb IPA from topple Goliath . really reminiscent of the very early batch of King Sue , just bone dry and super bitter yet offer the bright tropical flavor and the typical juiciness of the New England style . just excellent .

I usually not a fan of the 500 ML bottle format but it work well here . overall , it be wonderful to be able to purchase this gem locally and less than 3 week old .

the beer pour a lightly foamy and white head that take a bit to dissipate but seem carbonate enough that the glass I pour it in be create a constant flow of carbonation to the top ; keep the surface cover with a nice look foamy head . the beer itself be a clear solid medium gold color with a nice metallic appearance to it . have Gueuze Cantillon pour from cap - and - cork 37,5cl bottle , bottled " 06 DECEMBER 2008 , " personally import from Paris for I in Summer 2019 by my daughter , into Teku tulip 3.0 .   this late 2018 bottle pour peach - gold , almost orange . nice near - white head be soon go without a trace . the big sour and fruity aroma soon settle into persistent horse blanket . after a surprisingly mild start , wheat spice make a brief appearance , before the funk and sharp but not terribly tart fruit -- peach and persimmon -- arrive and carry the beer to its very dry finish .

complex , subtle , sophisticated , beautiful . get the sour funky farmy smell upfront and at first sip , but then more complexity come through with in the palate , a bit of the citrus flavour you get in a white wine , beautifully balance   want to try this one for a while , get to have it as part of a Zwanze Day event here in Australia .   a 150ml pour from a keg ship over from Belgium , would love to try a full bottle or two to appreciate it fully , but even among some very other nice beer , it stand out . well worth a try if you can get your hand on it .

pour a lightly hazy amber with a rose gold hint around the edge . Smell have lactic tartness over a rich sweet breadiness , oaky and kinda funky . light hint of light stonefruit like peach or apricot . taste be divine , a nice complex tartness that be n't pucker marry with some woody funky bit . mouthfeel be dry and crisp . leave you ready for another Overall it be not hard to understand why this be hold up as the standard bearer for the style . a truly world class display of depth and balance . tart and funky and lightly sweet . everything super delicate and well put together . different flavor show themselves as it warm a bit but each iteration be a joy .

pour hazy orange yellow out of the bottle . this be the BIO ( organic version ) . a friend bring back from Belgium .
